loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is a 50-year-old married woman with two sons and a daughter. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Her family has earned a living by renting furniture for the past 37 years. This business is the only income source of her family. 

She intends to take a loan to buy chicken and fish that she will then resell in a small local market. She hopes this will provide the family with an extra regular income source to sustain their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy chickens and fish to sell

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha is a 27-year-old woman and a mother for three young children. Suha and her husband  Alaa Aldeen, are trying their best to provide their kids a restful life in the future, so Alaa Aldeen started working in two jobs and Suha decided to work from her home selling cosmetics products.

It has been two years now since Suha started her small business to help her husband, selling cosmetics products such as make-up, but now she is applying for a loan to add more types of cosmetics and perfumes, in order for her to open a special cosmetics store to cover a wider area.

Since Suha is a conservative person, her husband Alaa Aldeen has agreed to be in the picture instead of her.

loans.use: To add perfumes to the cosmetics products that she sells.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI I  est constitué de 10 femmes mariées du village de SANANKORO dans la sous préfecture de SELINGUE, région de SIKASSO (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 40  ans,  7 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide, du gombo et de mil.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  deuxième  prêt  de campagne.
FATOUMA, qui est la deuxième assise à droite,  compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide et de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU,SELINGUE et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail, souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
FATOUMA compte  réaliser, après l’écoulement de ses produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 95.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et l pour es dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 10 married women from the village of Sanankoro, in the Selingue prefecture, in the Sikasso district (third administrative district in the Republic of Mali).  They live in traditional families, are on average 40 years old, have seven children, and grow groundnuts, okra, and millet.

In the hopes of making their agricultural ventures more profitable, the members of the group decided to work with the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their second loan of the year.

Fatouma, who is seated second from the right, intends to use her loan to purchase adequate quantities of groundnut seed and millet, small tools and agricultural inputs from the large market in Selefougou.  Following the winter season, the harvests will be stored for a certain amount of time so that they increase in value before sale.  They are then sold at the main market in Selefougou, Selingue, and in the surrounding markets, individually and often in bulk, for cash from a clientele who come mostly from the big cities.

After dispersing the agricultural products, Fatouma intends to earn a profit of 95,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the interest on her loan and for the ongoing expenses of her family.

loans.use:
Achat  d’intrants, semences  et petits matériels.
to purchase agricultural inputs, seeds, and small tools

loans.name: Yonis Alberto

texts.es:
Yonis es un joven de 24 años de edad, casado, aun no es padre, el trabaja en una tienda de vendedor, a si mismo su esposa, el tiene cinco años laborando en la tienda, pues es un joven de poco recursos economico el cual quiere progresar al tener mejores condiciones de vivienda. Tambien ha trabajado en construccion y ha salido adelante bajo las circuntancias economica de su familia.
actualmente su casa es de madera, en donde ha pasado dificultades de sol y agua, ahora que esta casado le impulsa superarse para ambos y con apoyo de su pareja, quieren construir su cuarto de concreto.
el no cuenta con el capital suficiente, para comenzar, pero atravez de Afodenic, se le hara posible la compra de materiales de construccion en piedra, bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, clavos, tabla. Para comenzar su cuarto. Esta sastifecho por esta mejora que comenzara y que le dara mejores condiciones de higiene y seguridad.
texts.en:
Yonis is a young man of 24.  He is married but is not a father yet.  He works as a shop assistant in a store, as does his wife.  He has been working in the store for five years.  Yonis is a young man with limited financial means who would like to make progress and improve the condition of his home.  He has also worked in construction and has gotten ahead in life despite the financial circumstances of his family.

Currently, Yonis' home is made from wood and he has experienced problems with sun and water.  Now that he is married, he would like to do better for both himself and his wife.  With the support of his wife, he would like to build a room from concrete.

Yonis does not have the capital he needs to start this work but, through Afodenic, he will be able to buy construction supplies (stone, blocks, sand, cement, iron, nails and planks) and start building his room.  He is happy that he will be able to start making this improvement as it will provide him with better hygiene and safety.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to start building a room

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr:
Akoua est une femme âgée de 38 ans. Elle est célibataire. 
Akoua travaille comme revendeuse de céréales depuis 2002. Elle vend seule à ses nombreux clients au marché de HEDZRANAWOE. Elle achète les produits à ANIE. 
Akoua a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales.
texts.en:
Akoua is a woman of 38 and single.  She has been selling cereals since 2002. She works alone, selling to her numerous customers at the market of HEDZRANAWOE. She buys her wares in ANIE. 

Akoua has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: 13 De Junio Group

texts.es:
13 de Junio es denominado el comité de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está integrado por 10 mujeres de esa ciudad. Dicho grupo se forma a iniciativa de una de las miembros del grupo, la cual oyó hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y organizó a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surge el grupo. Ellas se definen como mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy sacrificadas, que día a día luchan por salir adelante y generar ingresos para sus hijos y familiares.
La señora Luciana se dedica a la venta de ropas, este trabajo la ha ayudado con todo los gastos que surgen día a día. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran de ella sus prendas. Uno de sus proyectos es poder traer más ropas y expandirse a zonas aledañas. Todo lo que hace es por darle un mejor futuro a sus familiares que de ella dependen.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, con lo cual podrá hacer frente a la demanda que tiene de sus clientes. Sabe que el crédito la ayudará mucho, por lo cual tiene muchas esperanzas en el.
texts.en:
The communal bank "13 de Junio"  is located in the city of Curuguaty and is comprised of 10 local women. The group was formed due to the initiative of one of the group members, who heard about Fundación Paraguaya's program for enterprising women. She then organized her friends and neighbors to form the group. They define themselves as hardworking, tenacious, and very sacrificed women that strive to get ahead every day in an effort to generate income for their children and family members.

Luciana sells clothes, which has helped her with all of the daily expenses. She told us that she has many clients that always buy their clothing from her. One of her projects is to acquire more clothing and expand to the neighboring areas. Everything that she does is to give a better future to the family members that are dependent on her. 

She is requesting this loan to buy winter clothing, with which she will be able to meet her clients' demands. She knows that this loan will help her greatly, which is why she is very hopeful for it.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a 62-year-old married man with 7 children. He is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato, where he and his family also live.

Manuel plants rice, corn and bananas on his land. He works hard to have an abundant harvest. He said he also wants to be able to support his grandchildren.

Manuel requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. He hopes for his family to be healthy and happy always.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, es agricultor y empleado de la Alcaldía Municipal como barrendero, vive con su familia, trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenía 20 años, inicia sus labores a las 4:00am en la milpa hasta las 8:00am, luego de esta hora ingresa a su trabajo como barrendero en la alcaldía hasta las 5:00pm. Su hijo mayor le ayuda a cuidar la siembra.
Él invertirá en la compra de tres sacos de abono, estos pues lo utilizara en la milpa, la compra será una gran ayuda para salir de la necesidad, fortaleciendo la plantación para que este produzca abundante cosecha.
Su aspiración es apoyar a su hijo para que aprenda todo lo que implica la agricultura, pudiendo defenderse con un oficio para su futuro.
texts.en:
Pedro is a farmer and employed by the City Government as a street sweeper. He lives with his family and has worked in farming since he was 20 years old. He begins his labors at 4 a.m. in the fields and works until 8 a.m. At that time he goes to his job as a street sweeper at the city hall until 5 p.m. His eldest son helps him care for the crops. 

He will invest in the purchase of three sacks of fertilizer which he will use on the fields. The purchase will be of great help in a time of need, strengthening the farm so it may produce an abundant harvest. 

His aspiration is to support his son in learning everything there is to know about farming so he will have a profession with which to fend for himself in the future.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is from the rural area of Bolinao province of Isabela. She is 29-years-old with four children. She is a vendor of eggs in their community. She is a very loving and understanding mother. She does everything she can just to support the daily needs of her family. Her spouse is a farmer.

Michelle is asking for a loan of P 5,000 to buy new eggs for additional income for her business. She hopes that in the future her that business will expand and improve.

loans.use: to buy eggs for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
María, es madre de 4 hijos, de los cuales uno es dependiente, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, desde hace 12 años realiza esta actividad como medio de obtener ingresos para la familia, quien le enseño a elaborar pan fue una tía y hoy en día realiza la venta de lunes a sábado.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina, royal, levadura, azúcar, esta inversión le ayudara para mantener en el inventario lo suficiente de materia prima, para continuar realizando sus ventas.
La aspiración de María es que el hijo que tienen a cargo, pueda sentir su apoyo y culminar los estudios, así como también continuar trabajando con préstamos.
texts.en:
María has 4 children, and only one of them depends economically on her. She has been baking and selling bread for 12 years, and she engages in this activity in order to earn money for her family. Her aunt taught her how to bake bread. She sells her products for Mondays to Saturdays.
She is requesting a loan to buy flour, baking powder, yeast and sugar: this investment will help her stocking up her inventory with the necessary raw ingredients she need to keep on baking and selling her products.
María wishes to continue providing for the son that depends on her, so that he can finish his studies; she also wishes to keep on working through the loans.

loans.use: To buy flour, baking powder, yeast and sugar.

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.ru: Санобар замужем имеет четверых детей. В бизнесе ей помогает сын. Вместе они стараются удовлетворять потребности односельчан. У нее свой магазин. Она торгует разными промышленными товарами. Она надеется получить займ и расширить ассортимент своего товара к предстоящим праздникам. Так как она товар приобретает  Душанбе и Истаравшане до закрытия перевала должна успеть закупить товар.
texts.en: Sanobar is married and has four children.  Her son helps her in the business.  Together, they try to satisfy residents' demands.  Sanobar has her own store.  She sells various household goods.  Sanobar hopes to obtain this loan and expand her merchandise selection for the upcoming holidays.  Because she buys her merchandise in Dushanbe and Istaravshan, she needs to buy the merchandise before the closing of the crossing.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection for the upcoming holidays

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a married woman and she has one young child. Mgeni has run her own greengrocery business for the past 6 years. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Mgeni’s greatest challenge is keeping her perishable products fresh for long enough to sell. Her highest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. 

Mgeni will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cabbages, onions and other stock for her grocery. Mgeni aspires to become a local supplier for vegetable products in the future. She joined Yehu because its requirements are fair.

loans.use: To purchase cabbages, onions and other stock for her grocery.

loans.name: Reyna Yamilet

texts.es: Reyna está ensu último año de la carrera de química y farmacia, trabaja en un hospita en donde está poniendo en práctica los conocimientos adquiridos. El crédito solicitado será para pagar los módulos de titulación para ya finalizar su carrera. La inspiran a obtener un título sus hijos y su familia porque desea darles una mejor calidad de vida, tiene la iniciativa y los sueños de prosperar en la vida, espera poder trabajar como regente en una farmacia.
texts.en:
Reyna is in her last year of her program in chemistry and pharmacy.  She works in a hospital where she is applying the knowledge she has acquired.

The loan requested will be to pay for degree requirements to finish her academic program.

Her children and her family inspire her to get her degree because she wants to give them a better quality of life.  She has the initiative and the dreams to prosper in life.  She hopes to be able to work as a manager in a pharmacy.

loans.use: to pay for degree requirements.

loans.name: Oscar Orlando

texts.es: El señor  Oscar Orlando a sus 45 años de edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa deportiva. Esta labor el señor Oscar Orlando la aprendió desde joven cuando trabajaba para empresas de confección. Hoy día, el señor Oscar Orlando tiene su propio taller donde el mismo elabora las prendas desde la compra de la materia prima hasta la comercialización. El señor Oscar Orlando realiza sus prendas deportivas de acuerdo a la moda y las tendencias del sector. El señor Oscar desea comprar insumos para su taller como lo son telas, hilos y moldes con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos y cumplir con la demanda de fin de año. El señor Oscar Orlando desea a futuro tener más grande su taller y así poder emplear a sus vecinos en el taller.
texts.en:
At 45 years old, Oscar Orlando makes and sells sports clothing.  He learned this trade when he was young and worked in a clothing factory.  Now Oscar Orlando has his own workshop where he works in all stages, from buying the raw materials to marketing.  He makes his clothing according the current styles and local tastes.

Oscar Orlando would like to buy supplies for his workshop, such as fabric, thread, and molds, with the intent of increasing his income and keeping up with the end of year demand.  In the future he would like to open a bigger workshop and be able to offer jobs to his neighbors.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his workshop.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is a 50-year-old married woman with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Diosdada deals Avon and Natasha products. She earns about 4,000 PHP per month with this business. She also helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops to sell. She does her best to support her family. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell. Diosdada hopes to have a progressive business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell

loans.name: Edita Dioselina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Edita, tiene 47  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, ambos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa allí vende productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, allí también vende deliciosos helados que ella prepara y que son de mucho agrado de sus clientes,  ella lleva en este negocio por más de 5 años y desde que está recibiendo los créditos se le ha hecho más fácil poder surtir su local.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva tres ciclos en el   Banco Comunal y espera seguir por mucho tiempo.

Sus sueños es seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
Virgen Del Mar communal bank gathers every 15 days in the beautiful beach resort of San Mateo in Manta city, that is famous for its beautiful beachs that are visited by national and international tourists during all four seasons.

There, most of the population makes a living fishing and conducting sea-related activities. In that location, we met Edita. She is 47, married, with two sons, both of whom are of legal age and still living in her house.

Her husband makes a living fishing. She owns a grocery store in her house, where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil and dishwashing liquid, among others.

She works 6 AM through 9 PM, and sometimes even later, Monday to Sunday. There she also sells delicious ice cream that she prepares herself and that her customers love.

She has been in this business for more than 5 years and since she started to receive the loans, it has been easier for her to supply her business with goods.

She will use this loan to buy products for her store, such as rice, sugar, oil, dishwashing liquid and other first priority products.

This is her third loan cycle in this communal bank and she expects to continue there for a long time. Her dream is to get ahead and be healthy.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, dishwashing liquid and other first priority products.

loans.name: Maria Rosmira

texts.es: La señora Maria Rosmira es dueña desde hace un año de una pequeña tienda adecuada en su casa, debido a las limitaciones de salud de la señora Maria Rosmira quien no puede realizar labores fuertes, ella se dedica sólo a la parte administrativa de la tienda y las demás funciones las realiza su esposo quien la apoya incondicionalmente. Con la esperanza de mejorar su surtido y sus ventas, la señora Maria necesita de la compra de diferentes productos tales como gaseosas, snacks, licor y abarrotes, soñando con mejorar sus ingresos y así ampliar su negocio y la calidad de vida de su esposo y dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Rosmira has been the owner of a small store in her home for the past year. Due to health limitations, she is not able to engage in heavy labor. Maria only handles the administrative functions of her store and leaves the rest to her husband who supports her unconditionally.

Hoping to improve her inventory and sales, Sra. Maria needs to buy different products such as sodas, snacks, liquor, and groceries. She dreams of improving her income, expanding her business, and improving the quality of life for her husband and two children.

loans.use: to buy sodas, snacks, liquor, and groceries.

loans.name: Yolima Vanesa

texts.es:
Yolima tiene un negocio de venta de fritos los fines de semana con el que genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, sin embargo con el ánimo de mejorar su condición económica busca montar un negocio que pueda atender los días de semana y así tener mejores ingresos. Yolima tiene conocimiento en la actividad de la preparación y venta de arepas, por esto busca un préstamo para comprar los utensilios y los insumos necesarios para la preparación de arepas.

De esta manera podrá tener unos ingresos que le permitirán tener una mejor condición económica y tener en su hogar mejores oportunidades para progresar. Su sueño es sacar su familia adelante y sacar su negocio adelante generando empleo para los más necesitados.

loans.use: Comprar los utensilios y los insumos necesarios para la preparación de arepas.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Aba did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Aba sells maize in Ohiaba (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. 

As a widow with three children, Aba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Aba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Aba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is 35 years old. He is married and they are blessed with 3 children. His business is farming. He has been in the business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of eighteen thousand Kenya shillings. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a donkey and pesticides to spray his crops. He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a donkey and pesticides to spray his crops.

loans.name: Fransisca

texts.en:
Miss Francisca lives with her husband in the city of Villa de Garcia in the State of Nuevo Leon. They live alone as their children are already married. They don\'t receive any support from them which is why Miss Francisca decided some time ago to start a small grocery store. Her husband is unemployed and they live from the sales of the store. Now the two of them work at the business and they work a great deal every day as it is their only source of income to live on. Together they have been able to make it on their own, that of course came about with much effort and patience.

She now needs a loan of $475 that she will use to purchase merchandise to be able to provide more variety to her clients and therefore expand the business and increase her sales. You can, with your generosity, support Francisca and her husband. Do not doubt any longer. The decision is in your hands. Remember, they need your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Francisca vive con su esposo en la localidad de Villa de García, en el estado de Nuevo León. Ellos viven solos, sus hijos ya están casados y no reciben apoyo de ellos, por lo que hace tiempo Doña Francisca decidió poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes para que les permitiera vivir de las ventas, ya que su esposo se quedó sin empleo. Ahora los dos atienden su negocio y trabajan mucho todos los días ya que es su única fuente de ingresos y de ahí viven. Juntos han logrado salir adelante solos, claro con mucho esfuerzo y paciencia.

Ella ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismo que utilizará para comprar mercancía y tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y con esto lograr crecer, obteniendo mayores ingresos. Tu puedes, con tu generosidad, apoyar a Francisca y a su esposo, no lo dudes más, la decisión esta en tus manos, recuerda que ellos necesitan de tu apoyo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Karimbayli

texts.en: Karimbayli is 50 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is married and has 2 children. Having borrowed a loan of $400  he bought materials. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy welding apparatus.

loans.use: To buy welding apparatus

loans.name: Mehry

texts.en:
Mehry is married  and has two beautiful daughters. She has been in the business of selling men's clothing for eight years. In 1999, she and her family were in a difficult situation. She was compelled to sell her wedding ring to  start her business. Step-by-step Mehry learned about trade and her business became successful very quickly. She is constantly looking for new ideas and products that  will make her business more profitable. She is consistently growing and developing as an entrepreneur. Mehry values every customer and tries to do her best  to meet their needs. In 2003, Mehry heard about MicroInvest and became an active client. She has repaid her loans on time.  Today, she has her own shop located at the busy market. Her husband helps Mehry in her business. She purchases goods from Bishkek from a wholesale market.  Mehry would like to request a loan for $1000 to purchase light shirts and knit clothing for the summer season.  
Her elder daughter dreams that she will became a doctor or popular fashion designer. Mehry wishes to help her daughters to realize their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase summer shirts

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei owns a men’s clothing business at the Sigma Sport market in Nikolaev, Ukraine. He started his business three years ago because he saw a potential for growth. Sergei has requested a loan to help accomplish some of that growth by opening a second sales location. He has developed a solid business and is looking forward to expanding.

Sergei is a hard worker and is very dedicated to what he does which shows in how he conducts his business. His large product selection and quality items are popular with his customers. Sergei is married and he has one daughter who is a college student.

Sergei is grateful for the financial assistance he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Using capital from a previous loan, he was able to increase his sales and his profits went up. As a result of Sergei’s experience using micro-lending, one of his neighbors in the market heard about the financial resources that are available from Nadiya Ukraine and was also able to obtain a business loan. We a happy for this and many other opportunities to make a difference in the lives of entrepreneurs like Sergei.

loans.use: Open second sales location

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Mrs. Seam H., age 49, is a housewife who would like to purchase a plot of land to resell for profit. Her husband, age 67, is a construction foreman who earns $5 per day. He also assists her in their land brokerage business. They have four children, one of whom is a construction foreman and the other three are students.

loans.use: Seam would like to purchase a plot of land to resell as a real estate broker.

loans.name: Caro

texts.en: Caro O. is 32 years old, married with 2 children and lives in Benin City.  She sells clothes and sews for people in her community.  She has been in this business since 2004 and has been a LAPO client for the past 4 years.  She wishes to buy more clothes to sell as well as tailoring materials.  She hopes to repay her loan within 8 months.

loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Afi Marcelline

texts.fr:
Born in 1972, Mrs. Afi Marcelline A. is married and the mother of seven children. Her ne'er-do-well husband leaves her to earn enough to cover all the household expenses and she is hardly able to manage. Mrs. A. began growing corn which she stores and sells to the women in her area when little food is available. Honest and sincere, Mrs. A. is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 which will allow her to expand her arable land and purchase fertilizer. She has a good deal of experience in the field of agriculture. This project will help her to eke out enough money to pay school fees for all her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née en 1972, Madame A. Afi Marcelline est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants. Son mari malafoutier laisse toutes les charges du ménage sur elle qui n’arrive pas à s’en sortir. Madame A. s’est lancée dans l’agriculture de maïs qu’elle stocke et revend aux bonnes femmes de sa localité au moment de soudure. Honnête et dévouée, elle sollicite un financement de $1000 qui lui servira d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et acheter des fertilisants. Elle a beaucoup d’expérience dans le domaine de l’agriculture. Ce projet l’aidera davantage à dégager une marge financière et scolariser tous ses enfants.

loans.use:
enlarge her field and purchase fertilizer

agrandissement de son champ et achat de fertilisants

loans.name: Socorro Guadalupe

texts.es:
"Although I am a sales employee in a business that makes plastic colorings, my salary is not enough", commented Socorro Guadalupe. Socorro is a single mother of two girls, one of her daughters is 15 and the other one 7 years old. Unfortunately the father of these girls does not contribute to his daughters' expenses, and this is why Socorro has a job and in addition has another job in her free time, so that she can make enough money to pay for the household expenses and her daughters' education. In July of 1993, she started selling clothing. Then she helped a neighbor selling perfumes. And starting in 1998, when for one of her daughters' birthday she created some flower arrangements, which were liked by all the guests, and so she was asked to create these products. Little by little, through recommendations of her excellent work, she has become well known in her community.

However, right now she has several orders she needs to make, and she does not have enough money or materials to make all of them. This is why Socorro is requesting a loan for US $650, which she is willing to pay in a period of 5 months. With this money Socorro will be able to cover all the orders she has, and save for school expenses. With your help Socorro will be able to support her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

“Aunque soy empleada de ventas en una empresa que se dedica a la fabricación de tintas plástica, pero el sueldo que percibo no me es suficiente” Comentó Socorro Guadalupe. Socorro es madre soltera de dos niñas una de 15 y la otra de 7 años, desafortunadamente el padre de las niñas no se quiere hacer cargo de los gastos de sus hijas y es por eso que Socorro tiene un trabajo y en su tiempos libres tiene otro trabajo para poder sacar para pagar los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus dos hijas. En julio de 1993 comenzó vendiendo ropa, después le ayudó a una vecina a vender productos de perfumería y fue a partir de 1998 que en el cumpleaños de una de sus hijas le hizo unos arreglos que a todas las invitadas les gustó y le pidieron para que les elabore estos productos. Poco a poco y con la recomendación de su buen trabajo a sido que se a hecho reconocida en su comunidad.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos que elaborar, y no cuenta con dinero o material suficiente como para poder hacer todos sus productos .Es por eso que Socorro está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses. Con este dinero Socorro podrá cumplir con los pedidos que le hicieron. Y con este dinero poder ahorrar para los gastos escolares. Con tu ayuda Socorro podrá sacar a sus hijas adelante.

loans.use: Buying raw materials (Comprar materia prima)

loans.name: Luzinga East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Aidah N.. She is currently in the business of selling rice wholesale and is requesting a loan to add working capital. Aidah is 40 years old and married to her husband, who is a tailor. She has 4 children ranging from age 4 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, Aidah makes approximately UGX 25000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to add to her business and also educate her children. Aidah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 100000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Aidah is joined in her small group by Miria B. and Sida K.. Miria B. has a business running a grocery store and wants to purchase more groceries. Sida K. is currently operating a business rearing cows and wants a loan to expand the business.

loans.use: To increase capital to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena belongs to the Las Triunfadoras Community Bank group, located at 845 Jr. Salaverry in the Calleria district of the department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old and the mother of 7 children. Her husband works in a mill but the income that he brings home doesn't cover their basic needs. She decided to invest the 300 soles from the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos/CrediMUJER in food sales.

She now has a restaurant where she serves local and vegetarian cuisine to the liking of every palate with the help of her children who wait on the customers.

With this loan of 1000 soles (approx. $350), which she will pay back in 5 months, she will invest in the purchase of 3 sacks of rice, 2 bags of noodles, one box of oil, etc.

The hard work of Milena and her children has paid off as now her restaurant is one of the most popular in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Milena pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Triunfadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Salaverry 845, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años es madre de 7 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un molino, pero el ingreso que tiene no les alcanza para cubrir sus necesidades. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertirlo en la venta de comida. En la actualidad tiene un restaurante donde ofrece comida criolla y vegetariana al gusto de todo paladar, con la ayuda de sus hijos atienden a los clientes. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de 3 sacos de arroz, 2 bolsas de fideos, 1 caja de aceite, etc. Milena y sus hijos han logrado a base de mucho esfuerzo lograr que su restaurante sea uno de los mas concurridos de su ciudad.

loans.use: To buy products for her business

loans.name: Wisdom 2015-1 Group

texts.en: Roda K. is the leader of her group of five.  Roda sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand the business.  Roda is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a  driver.  She has 7 children ranging from age 18 to 40.  Each week, Roda makes approximately 20 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the help of her loan, she hopes to be able to grow her business. Roda is joined in her small group by Madellina K., Rejina N., Anna F., and Victoria Eliyas.  Madellina K. and Rejina N. sell breads.  Anna F. brews alcohol and Victoria Eliyas is sells beer. All of these ladies will use their loans to build their businesses.

loans.use: To expands businesses

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Ms. Afi A. is 33, married and the mother of 2. She lives and works in Adeta, a town around 150 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. To make a living and to help support her family, she runs a small boutique called "Carrefour 2000." She has a good client base because she has already benefited from two previous loans and successfully repaid them and has remained in good standing. This is her third loan with FECECAV. Afi would like to purchase drinks, sweets, cookies and other products to sell in her boutique. This will allow her to increase her profits and respond to the needs of her customers as well as help to improve her family's standard of living.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ms. Afi A. est âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle habite et travaille à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle opère une petite boutique qui s’appelle « Carrefour 2000. » Elle est un bon client puisqu’elle à déjà bénéficié de deux crédits et les remboursements ont été réguliers. Avec ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, Afi veut acheter des boissons, des bonbons, des biscuits et autres produits variés pour revendre dans sa boutique. Ce qui lui permettra d’augmenter la capacité de sa boutique pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et d’améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase various items to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells drinks. She is married, but her husband's income from selling goods is not sufficient for Ama’s expenses. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba T. sells fish, cassava, and plantain. She is married, but her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for Aba and her five children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 55 years old, divorced, and has seven children. Currently, only one of the children is in school; the others have completed school. Theresa enjoys selling, and she has many years of experience serving customers. She has been selling maize and yam for 30 years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock from the farmers. This saves her from buying from middlemen, who buy from the farmers and resell at higher price.

She plans to use the loan to buy maize and yams in bulk so she can meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her children, who are ready to enter university this year.

Theresa is a member of a community group called Isaac Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: Buy maize and yams in bulk to resell

loans.name: Trading Goods, Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Tô Thị Lợi 28 tuổi. MS: 13.03.0032. Vay : 3.186.000 đồng
Chị Lợi vay vốn để đi chợ, gia đình chị chở hàng để nuôi ba đứa con ăn học. Gia đình chị có thu nhập hàng  ngày khoảng từ 300.000đồng / ngày. Chị là thành viên mới, chị thích vay vốn của chường trình để thêm vốn trong công việc kinh doanh của gia đình. Với cách trả hàng tuần của Chương trình gia đình chị thấy hợp lý vì có thể tiết kiệm và trả dễ dàng hơn.
Trong nhóm chị gồm:
<li> Đào Thị Huyền 25 tuổi . MS 13.03.0031. Vay 3.186.000 đồng. Chị Huyền vay vốn để đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
<li> Nghiêm Thị Mai 24 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0033. Với mức vay :3.186.000đồng. Chị Mai vay vốn để đi chợ và xây chuồng để chăn nuôi.
<li> Lê Thị Tuất: 49 tuổi. MS: 13.03.0034. Vay 3.186.000đồng. Cô Tuất vay vốn để đi chợ bán thị và chăn nuôi.
<li> Trần Thị Tươi 23 tuổi. MS: 13.03.0035. Mức vay: 3.186.000 đồng. Chị Tươi vay vốn để chăn nuôi và làm nghề mộc.
<li> Tô Thị Hợi:  24 tuổi. MS: 13.03.0036. Mức vay 3.186.000 đồng. Chị Hợi vay vốn để đi chợ, chị buôn bán rau, củ, quả.
<li> Trần Thị Vượng 49 tuổi. Ms: 13.03.0037. Mức vay 3.186.000 đồng. Cô Vượng vay vốn để chăn nuôi và làm giấy.
texts.en:
Mrs. Loi Thi T., 28 years old, is borrowing 3,186,000 VND T. do business trading goods. Her family currently works in transporting goods T. have money T. take care of and send her three children T. school. The family's average daily income is a minimum of about 300,000 VND per day. She is a new participant, and likes the method of borrowing from the loan program T. have more capital for the family's business. With the weekly repayment plan, the family sees that it is a good fit because it allows them T. save money and repay much easier. Her group also includes: Mrs. Huyen Thi D., 25 years old, borrowing 3,186,000 VND T. trade goods and raise livestock; Mrs. Mai Thi N., 24 years old, borrowing 3,186,000 VND T. trade goods and build a pen for raising livestock; Mrs. Tuat Thi L., 49 years old, borrowing 3,186,000 VND, T. trade goods and raise livestock; Mrs. Tuoi Thi T., 23 years old, borrowing 3,186,000 VND T. raise livestock and do woodwork; Mrs. Hoi Thi T., 24 years old, borrowing 3,186,000 VND T. trade goods, sell vegetables; Mrs. Vuong Thi T., 49 years old, borrowing 3,186,000 VND T. raise livestock and make paper.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trade goods, raise livestock

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.en: Mukadam M. is 48 years old. She and her husband have raised four children. For 10 years already Mukadam has been working in the largest local market of the city. She sells green gram and peas. This legume is very popular in Tajikistan. They can be cooked in soups more made into cereal, both of which are very nourishing, healthy and tasty. So Mukadam's business is very stable and generates the main income for the family as her husband is retired on a pension. Mukadam has been working with IMON for a year, and has proved herself as an accurate client. Today she requests 4000 Somoni ($1200 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent purchasing green gram and peas to sell. Mukadam thanks all for support and promises to pay the loan in time.

loans.use: Mukadam would like to purchasing green gram and peas to resell in order to increase her business.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de dos niños pequeños,  estudió en el Instituto Superior Tecnológico en Puno y vive en el sector Orccomplaya del C.P Uros Chulluni, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” de Puno. Con el primer préstamo aumentó su capital para comprar bordados en bayeta y cerámica. Desde los 20 años de edad, cuando tuvo su esposo, comenzó con este negocio, antes trabajaba como empleada del hogar en Puno. Nos cuenta que en los meses de Octubre y Noviembre sus ganancias se incrementan por la llegada de más turistas. 
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 10 calendarios de piedra a S/. 200, 10 bordados de familias a S/. 450, collares, cojines, etc. 

 Su deseo es terminar de construir su casa y que sus ganancias crezcan.
texts.en:
Julia is 25 years old, is married, is a mother of two small children, studied at the Higher Institute of Technology in Puno and lives in the area of Orccomplaya of C.P. Uros Chulluni, district, province and department of Puno. She is a member of the Communal Bank "Melchorita Saravia II" of Puno. With the first loan she increased her capital to buy embroidered cloth and ceramics. From the age of 20, when she married her husband, she started this business. Previously she worked in domestic service in Puno. We are told that in the months of October and November her earnings are increased by the arrival of more tourists. With this loan of 1200 soles (US $400), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 10 stone calendars for 200 soles (US $ 65), 10 embroidered items from families for 450 soles (US $145), necklaces, pillows, etc. Her desire is to finish building her house and increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 10 stone calendars, 10 embroidered items, necklaces, pillows, etc.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo tiene 30 años, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Es agricultor, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años, prácticamente  desde que se casó, con ella puede mantener su hogar,  es por ello que se dedica a ello con mucho esfuerzo y empeño, además le agrada poder sembrar papa y maíz en sus terrenos, pero sobre todo le  gusta cosechar, ya que después de la cosecha puede disfrutar de la calidad de sus productos. Dentro de su  ciudad la venta de papa es rentable, según la calidad de papa que producen, pero por lo general la producción de papa por su zona es muy buena y tiene  gran demanda. Lo difícil  es la misma siembra, además de los costosos de los abonos que requiere. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Alfredo invertirá en la compra de abonos para sus terrenos de papa.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 30-years-old and lives with his wife and two children. He has been a farmer for 10 years, since the time of his marriage. This work enables him to support his family and it is for this reason that he works so hard and with such determination. He enjoys planting potatoes and corn on his land and he likes harvesting even more because this is when he can see and appreciate the high quality of his products. In his city, the sale of potatoes is profitable depending on the quality of potatoes produced. In general, the production of potatoes in his area is good and there is a great demand for them. The most difficult part of the business is planting season, especially with the cost of fertilizers that are necessary for good yield. This is Alfredo’s first loan through MFP; he plans to purchase fertilizer for his potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Molloy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Mrs. Khiev V. is 60 years old and a widow. She sells groceries and lives in Prey Chysak Village in the Kandal Province. She has seven children, four of whom are married and three live out of home independently. V. sells a variety of products from her house. She, alone sells groceries in this manner from her house and her business is going well. Her business is growing and V. would like to request a loan to purchase more grocery inventory for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery inventory for resale

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina T. sells clothing and fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Tatermu in Elmina. Justina has received no formal education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a military man.

Justina has been selling clothing and fish since 1998. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing and fresh fish to meet the increase in the demand for her goods. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business and save toward a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more clothing and fresh fish for re-sale

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en:
Zakir M. is a 61 year old retired accountant who lives with his wife and their 5 children.  

He is a man who, from an early age, was characterized as a hard-worker who is very dedicated to his agricultural work of raising cattle.  He saw this as an activity that would enable him to have additional income due to the high demand for these animals in the markets. The challenge is to improve the breed, but in order to do so he has to feed them properly. 

Zakir has the best intentions for his children and this allows him to continue improving as a father and farmer.  This farmer yearns to expand his business so that he will be able to improve his family's standard of living.  In order to do so, he is asking for a loan that will allow him to buy animals of a better breed in order to improve the quality of his herd.

loans.use: Purchase two cattle

loans.name: Eduardo Jose

texts.es: Eduardo Z. se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de muebles de madera por mas de 16 años, el esta casado y es padre de 4 hijos, la hija mayor cursa la secundaria y los tres menores cursan la primaria, con los ingresos que el negocio le genera le permiten cubrir con los gastos del hogar, atraves de este negocio logro comprar su casa en la cual vive el y su familia, el comenzo a trabajar a los 14 años y a los 21 monto su propio taller de carpinteria con los ahorros que el tenia compro la maquinaria, los clientes que eran donde el trabajaba se pasaron a ser clientes de su negocio ya que el es muy bueno en su actividad, el tiene dos empleados en la acutualidad que le ayudan a fabricar sus muebles, sus clientes han crecido mucho en vista de las necesidades de ellos esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas madera y asi poder cumplir con todas las exigencias de todos ellos.
texts.en:
Eduardo Z. has been making and selling wooden furniture for more than 16 years. He is married with four children; his eldest daughter is in secondary school and his three youngest are in primary school. Through his business, he was able to buy the house in which he and his family live. The business now generates enough income to cover his household expenses. He started working at 14, and by 21 he used his savings to buy machinery and set up his own carpentry shop. The customers from his old work followed him to his new business since he is very good at his trade. He currently has two employees who help him manufacture the furniture. Seeing that his customer base has grown, he is asking for a loan to purchase more wood to meet all their needs.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cedar, mahogany, laurel and pine wood

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru: Тохиров Фахриддин проживает в городе Яван. Живет в одном из отдаленных кишлаков . Занимается земледелием. Имеет 1 га . земли  . В данный момент не может засеить. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена лука и удобрения. Кредит поможет ему своевременно посееть лук и не остаться без урожая. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.Фахриддину 33 года , он женат и имеет троих детей.
texts.en:
Fahriddin T. lives in the town of Yavan. He lives in one of the remote villages (kishlaks). He is in agriculture. He has one ha. (hectare) of land. He cannot sow the land at this time and this is why he plans to take out a loan to buy seeds of onions and fertilizer. The loan will help him sow the onions on time and not be left out without a harvest. He can pay off the loan within 10 months. Fahriddin is 33 years old, married and has three children.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lorna Majuma

texts.en: Lorna Majuma O. is a 37-year-old mother of six children, two boys and four girls aged 17, 13, 9, 8, 4, and 5 months old. She is married, but her husband does not work. She sells grains such as groundnuts, beans, finger millets and dengu that she purchases in Sondu and then transports for sale to Kisumu. She uses the profits from her business to pay the school fees for her children and rent for the house. One of Lorna’s greatest challenges right now is paying the medical expenses for her oldest child who has sickle cell anemia. She is asking for 15,000 KSH. This will be her first loan.

loans.use: To pay school fees and rent.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is an energetic general store owner in Barangay Alibago of Enrile, Cagayan. Felisa is married to Joel, who operates the bakery shop located in their house. The couple works hard to secure the future of their children, who are currently studying. They have always wanted their children to be able to finish their college education so that they may have a better future.

Felisa sells different grocery items that meet her customers’ demands and other basic commodities for families. Her small business serves as her source of income which really is a great help to her family. For almost 9 years in the business, Felisa has learned a lot about how to manage her income and how to spend money wisely. She also believes that patience and hard work are the best attitudes to have in order to become a successful businessperson. 

Once a week she purchases, in the city of Tuguegarao, the products for her store . Currently, her business is doing well but Felisa still wants to improve it and to make it grow.  She wants to borrow  PHP25,000 ($525 US) so that she can buy additional grocery items for her store. With what she earns daily from her business, she has been able to provide some of the basic needs for her family, especially her children. This loan will really help her business to expand, thus, earning more profit.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Bakali's Group

texts.en: N. Bakali, 29, is the leader of the Kisimba group in Lugazi. She is a down-to-earth lady who is married with three children between the ages of 5 and 10. She cares for 10 dependents. She has managed a grocery store in the Kisimba village for four years, selling stuff like sugar, salt, cooking oil and paraffin plus many other items. For the two years that she has been getting loans, her shop stock has increased and she makes 50,000 more profit per week than before the loans. She is happy that right now there are not so many shops in her area, so she has more customers and hopes to increase her stock. Bakali hopes to see all her children attain the best education as they grow up. She needs a new loan to help restock her grocery store.

loans.use: Buying for more stock for her shop

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta B. is from the village of Garang, Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Crisanta is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, namely, running a "sari-sari" or general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from this work.

In 2009, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

This loan will be the first loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en: N. Scovia is the leader of Gambwa Akwata empola group2 in Mityana. She is a kind-hearted and hardworking lady with a restaurant as her business. Scovia has had the business for five years and she decided to join her lending group to improve her business. As a result, she has been able to buy more crates of sodas, saucepans, tables, chairs, forks, and spoons and this has enabled her to make more profit as compared to before the loans. Scovia is a married lady with seven children; five are still in school and the eldest two stopped in S.4 and started their own businesses due to lack of school fees. One child makes chapatti for sale by the roadside while the other is a motorcycle driver. Scovia’s husband is also a boda boda cyclist and together they ensure that their children are cared for. She also cares for her mother who stays nearby. With her share of the loan, Scovia hopes to invest in her business more by buying more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.en:
M. Bahrom is dedicated to the business of livestock. He distinguishes himself by having a lot of experience when it comes to livestock. He supports his spouse and two children and also provides for their education. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to give his children his support so that they can get ahead. Bahrom is hoping for the support of IMON with the goal of obtaining a loan of 2500 Somoni. The loan will allow him to purchase young cattle, raise and breed them, and in this way, to earn more. Both Bahrom and his loving family will benefit from this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 35 years old and married with 4 children. Tina sells foodstuffs. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more products to sell. She remains grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita lives in the rural community of Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now a widow and has sole responsibility for their only daughter, Mylene. With her patience in maintaining her hog-raising business, she was able to provide her daughter with a college education. Her daughter is now working abroad.

Perlita has been into hog-raising for many years. The business has become her partner in sending her daughter to school and in providing the needs of their family. She started with two piglets, one male and one female until they multiplies into six. Her business grows because of her hard work and dedication.

Her desire to further improve her business motivated Perlita to ask for additional capital of PHP 31,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes that the business will someday become successful and stable to enable her daughter to decide to stay home for good.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros.
Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Orcasitas, Juana junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales y los comercializa en la misma comunidad a intermediarios. Además Juana tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Juana son ahorrar mas y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Señor de los Milagros Community Bank. Juana is 50, married, and she has seven children. She lives in the Orcasitas community. Juana, together with her husband, makes artesian bricks. They sell them in their community to distributors. Juana also has a grocery story in her house. Juana needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Juana’s dreams are to save more and to give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Elizerbeth

texts.en:
Elizerbeth P. is currently in the business of breaking and selling stones and is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to break stones for sale. Elizerbeth is 38 years old and is married to a husband who is a watchman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more tools to break stones for sale

loans.name: Kankalay Iii Group

texts.en:
Here are Fatu A., Yangie K. and Kurta K.. They are small scale businesspeople in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. They called their group Kankalay III. They are requesting for a loan of Le 1,200,000 for each from Kiva Lenders to help them improve on the sizes and qualities of their businesses. In this way, they will be able to make more sale, better profit and consequently improving on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatu A. on the right. Fatu was born in Kabala and she is approximately forty-three years of age. She is married to a dealer in cigarettes and both of them have four children together. Two of their children are in colleges, one in secondary school and the other in primary school. Fatu sells rice, ground-nut/peanuts, pepper, beans and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil). She has been doing this business for five years now. Fatu will invest this loan into her business by buying more of the same goods to add to the ones she already has in her stall.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y dos de sus cuatro hijos en la urbanización Las Brisas, en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace proximadamente 13 años vende comida en un pequeño puesto dentro del mercado de la ciudad de Lambayeque, situado a 15 minutos de Chiclayo, todos los días atiende a sus clientes desde las 11:30 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, su puesto es muy frecuentado debido a su trato amable y la buena sazón de los platos que ofrece.

Este negocio le ayuda a mantenerse activa y  apoyar a su familia, su esposo trabaja como auxiliar dentro de la universidad pública de la zona y con el dinero que ambos perciben ayudan a los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.

La continua demanda por los platos que vende ha hecho que Rosa piense en preparar más platos que ofrecer a sus clientes, motivo por el cual está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos para seguir preparando comida (arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceite y fideos).

Su mas grande anhelo es instalar en su casa una pequeña bodega con la cual su familia pueda seguir progresando. Rosa es una mujer muy conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y clientes que las consideran una mujer sencilla y trabajadora
texts.en:
Rosa is a 52 year old mother who lives with her husband and two of her four children in the urban neighborhood of Las Brisas, which is in the city of Chiclayo.

For approximately 13 years, she has been selling food from a small market stall in the city of Lambayeque, which is 15 minutes away from Chiclayo. Every day she attends to her customers from 11:30am until 5pm. Her vending stall is quite popular because of Rosa’s excellent service and the good seasoning of the dishes she offers.

This business enables her to remain active and generate income to support her family. Her husband works as an assistant at the public university in the area. With the money from both of their incomes, they are able to pay for their children’s college education.

Because of the continuous demand that she experiences, Rosa believes she has to prepare more dishes to offer to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edypme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles. She will use the money to purchase supplies to continue preparing her dishes (rice, sugar, beans, oil, and noodles).

Her greatest wish is to open a small grocery store in her home so that her family can continue to move forward. Rosa is well-known and respected by her neighbors. Her customers view her as a modest hardworking woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Church Of God Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of one of the primary schools in Sierra Leone. Their school was built by missionaries in 1954, one of the oldest in the area. The school has a total of twenty staff members and 800 pupils.

Teachers are among the lowest paid workers in Sierra Leone. Because of this, many of them find alternative means of making a living. Some engage in business and agriculture while others organize extra classes for the pupils (a practice the government is trying to abolish). These teachers are seeking a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects. Then out of their monthly salaries, they gradually repay the loan.

This group of teacher are seeking a loan from SMT for the second time and for the first time from Kiva lenders. (Charles S. K. was not able to be present for the original photo, but an individual shot has been added in the corner of the frame).

Thomas is head teacher at the school and the leader of the group. He is forty-eight years old. Thomas is married and has 5 children, all of whom are currently attending school. With the help of this loan, he will be able to continue paying the school fees for all of his children, as will many other teachers.

loans.use: School Fees for children

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
La señora Perla L. L. ha sido muy buena clienta ha demostrado un buen historial crediticio. Con este préstamo seria el quinto, por lo que Perla les agradece el apoyo por que a podido realizar cada proyecto para mejorar su casa.  Donde vive no pasa el drenaje y para poder tener baño su esposo construyo una fosa séptica hace años en el que ahora necesita una reparación.
Perla es madre de tres hijos por lo que no quiere que la fosa antigua pueda causarles alguna enfermedad infecciosa por que la fosa esta al intemperie solo lo que la cubre es una tabla sobre puesta y lo que quiere hacer es ponerle una tapa de concreto  para que este mas reforzada.
texts.en:
Perla L. L. has been a good member and has a good credit history. This will be her fifth loan, and Perla is grateful for the support in helping her carry out all the improvement projects on her home. There is not a drainage system where she lives, and to be able to go to the bathroom there her husband built a septic tank years ago, and it now needs repairs. Perla is a mother of three children, and she doesn't want the old tank to make them sick or cause infections since it is out in the open with only a board over it. Perla wants to put a concrete lid on it that is stronger and more secure.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair septic tank

loans.name: Wonderful Family Group

texts.en:
Edna is forty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to four children, all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people.

Edna is a food vendor. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Wonderful Family. The members of the group are mainly into fishing and other commercial activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Edna is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Bhagabati K. lives in Bhakepati, which is located in Kathmandu district. Bhakepati is one of the developing village of Kathmandu and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.

Mrs. Kutuwal lives in a single-family dwelling with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Mr. Krishna Kumar, is a teacher in local school. Both her sons are now studying.

Mrs. Kutuwal opened a grocery shop 5 years ago. She sells different grocery goods in her shop. She opened her shop to strengthen the economic condition of her family. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 30000.00 to increase the necessary stock of food in her shop, such as noodles, rice, biscuits and other goods. She will also use the loan to expand her shop. She wishes to use her income to give a better education to her sons.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Doung is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from farming, she is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell for a better price. Her husband, Mr. Nhab Yim, is also a farmer. In this farming, Mrs. Srey Doung and her husband face a problem because their field is far from an irrigation system, so Mrs. Srey Doung decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine. With the rest of the loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to support the field. 

Mrs. Srey Doung is 40 years old and lives in Tamouk village in Takeo province. She is the mother of four children: two are pure drink water sellers, while the other two attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy a water machine and fertilizers

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange is 30 years old and is married with two children aged 7 and 9. Her family lives in Kayonza, a region of Rwamagana located in the Eastern Province of Rwanda, approximately an hour-and-a-half drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Solange has been in the business of working as a retailer in her shop for the past two years. She really appreciates her business and she opens her shop from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Solange has been a hardworking businesswoman in her business and therefore she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business through purchasing some additional goods for sale. These additional goods include soft drinks and some other beverages.

Solange is expecting to earn more profits that will help her take good care of her family as well as enable her to save a portion of them. She is thankful to all Kiva lenders that are ready to contribute to the success of her business.

loans.use: To buy additional goods like juice and some other beverages

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is from the village of Talic Oroquieta City. She is 53 years old and married with three grown children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling pork meat in the community market. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pascuala Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala del Carmen P. de 52 años es una mujer trabajadora, fuerte, emprendedora y con mucho deseo de seguir adelante. Ella inicio en el 2000 con la comercialización de frutas de forma ambulante por los andenes del mercado de Masaya y algunos barrios aledaños a su hogar. En el 2003 decide invertir en la producción de pinolillo bebida típica a base de maíz y cacao los cuales se tuestan y se dan a moler.
P. con el préstamo comprara  maíz, leña, cacao y frutas para que su negocio siga creciendo y un día poder instalar una pequeña venta en su casa.
texts.en:
Pascuala del Carmen P., 52, is a strong, hard-working, enterprising woman with a strong desire to succeed. In 2000 she began to sell fruit along the sidewalks around Masaya's market and in some of the neighborhoods near her home. In 2003 she decided to invest in pinolillo (a typical beverage made from toasted, ground corn and cocoa). She will use the funds to buy corn, firewood, cocoa and fruits so that her business will continue to grow and someday be able to set up a small sales operation in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, corn, cocoa and firewood.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
El  señor Francisco José B. T. es  trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega, como Vigilante ubicado en el mercado bisne es casado, tiene tres hijos todos bajo su cargo vive junto a su familia en el barrio Gerardo Aguilera de Chinandega
  
El señor Francisco B. tiene dos años de trabajar con créditos los que le han ayudado para el desarrollo de su familia y condiciones estables cabe señalar que el señor Francisco en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser una persona honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Francisco José B. T. is employed by the city of Chinandega as a watchman in the Bisne market; he's married and has three children under his care. The family live in Chinandega's Gerardo Aguilera neighborhood. Francisco has had loans for two years that have helped him support his family and provide stability; it is important to point out that all this time he has shown himself to be an honest and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
Violeta es natural de Urubamba, tiene 27 años y  es una joven responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. 

Violeta es profesora del nivel inicial y actualmente esta trabajando en la Institución  Educativa “La Salle” de Urubamba, ella y su familia abrieron un pequeño negocio de venta de anticuchos (El anticucho es un plato de origen peruano que consiste en carne marinada en un aderezo especial a base de ají panca ensartada en un palito de caña o de metal y cocinada a la parrilla.). 
 

Violeta pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, cervezas y carnes. El anhelo de la socia es que su negocio se convierta en una cadena de anticucherias (Anticucheria, lugar donde se vende anticuchos). 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Violeta is 27 years old and a native of Urubamba. She is a responsible young woman who looks at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and strive daily to help her family.

Violeta is a pre-school teacher and currently works at an educational institution called “La Salle” in Urubamba. She and her family opened a small business selling “anticuchos” (a Peruvian dish consisting of meat that is marinated in a dressing made of aji peppers, skewered on sticks or metal rods, and cooked on a grill).

Violeta is a member of the Communal Bank “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium), which is part of Asociación Arariwa. Her first loan as a member was for $100, which was invested in her business. She needs a loan to buy sodas, beer, and meat. Violeta hopes to convert her business of into a chain of establishments that sell “anticuchos”.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sodas, beer, and meat

loans.name: Los Cuatro Group

texts.es:
El grupo LOS CUATRO esta compuesto por 4 integrantes D. ahí D. donD. viene el nombre, las clientes se dedican a diferentes rubros uno D. estos es el comercio D. productos comestibles por menor, el comercio D. mercaderia a crediTo tales como edredones, mp3 y otros, otra D. las integrantes se dedica a la elaboracion D. reposteria elaborando masas como donas y alfajores.    

La Sra. Sandra esta casada y tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, se dedica a la venta D. edredones al contado y tambien da a credito y despues lo cobra semanalmente o quincenalmente, es muy trabajadora y D. esta manera colabora con su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
 
El grupo decidio unirse D. acuerdo a la afinidad y conocimiento que tiene la una D. la otra, y ademas la confianza y solidaridad que las carateriza, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
