The group "Los Cuatro" (The Four) is maD. up of 4 members, which is where the name came from. These individuals are in different lines of work: one of them is a retail vendor of food products, others sell merchandise on credit, such as comforters, MP3 players, and other items, and another of the members makes pastries in bulk, such as donuts and sweet sandwich cookies. Sandra is married and has 3 school-aged children. She sells comforters on a cash and credit basis. Later she collects the money weekly or bi-weekly. She is very hardworking, and in this way contributes with her husband to the household expenses. The group decided to get together because they knew each other very well and shared an affinity for each other, based on a high level of trust and solidarity. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: David Ong’Uo

texts.en:
David Ong’uo N. is 26 years old. He is married and the father of two children. In 2007, after finishing his high school education, he started a business in Migori, Kenya, selling rice to generate income. He purchases his stock in Sirare weekly.

He would like to raise enough income to be able to provide for his family, including education for his children. He plans to expand his business and would like to get a loan worth 30,000 KES to boost his business.

loans.use: increase stock to boost business

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna G. is from the village of Bitag Pequeño, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 40 years old. Myrna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en:
May Joy F. is from the village of Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 31 years old, and is single. To make a living, May Joy owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. May Joy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, May Joy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. May Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. May Joy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by May Joy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo C. M., habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe ; junto a su esposa la cual  labora como comerciante , ellos tienen dos hijas  actualmente estudiantes de primaria , don Juan desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras , la mayor dificultad es la falta de financiamiento y la alza de productos varios en verduras y legumbres .E l préstamo lo quieren para la mejora de vivienda ya que la ganancia de las frutas no le permite  comprar de una sola vez materiales de construcción, y la tormenta Alex que actualmente acecha Managua, dejado problemas en el techo y socavado el muro del frente de su casa, por tal razón solicita este préstamo para poder remodelar las áreas deñadas y que sus hijos moren en un habitad mas seguro.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Pablo C. M. lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe. With his wife, who works as a merchant, he has two daughters in elementary school. For four years Juan has sold fruits and vegetables. His greatest difficulty is the lack of financing and the rising prices of vegetables and legumes. He wants this loan to improve his home, since his earnings from fruit do not permit him to purchase construction materials; and the storm "Alex", which is currently threatening Managua, has left him with problems in his roof and has undermined the integrity of the home's front wall. For this reason he is requesting this loan to remodel damaged areas so that his children will live in a safer home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home remodeling

loans.name: Latékoé

texts.fr: Monsieur L. est un homme marié et père de 3 enfants. il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de hedzranawoé, il est électricien d'automobile, il a ouvert à ce effet son garage qu'il a appelé "ALLS CONCEPT". il a des commandes de ses clients qu'il n'a pas encore exécuté parce que ne disposant pas de matériaux appropriés. il souhaite acheter du matériel approprié raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers matériaux devant lui permettre d'exécuter ses commandes.
texts.en:
Mr. L. is married and the father of three children. He lives with his family in the Hedzranawoé district. He is a automotive electrician. He has his own auto shop named “Alls Concept.” He has some repair jobs pending because he lacks the necessary materials. He would like to purchase some necessary materials, which is why he is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchases various supplies needed to carry out his work.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing work supplies

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg B. is 25 years old and lives with her parents in Hovd province, a western of Mongolia.  She and her family live together in an apartment which her family has bought thanks to their business profits. Her father is retired and her mother manages a fruit business at the local market while her three younger sisters are students. 

Battsetseg operates a hair salon in a rented place at a local store. She started the hair  salon in 2009 and has progressed her business in a short time with many clients. Her daily sales and service revenues range from 30,000 to 70,000 MNT.  For the future, Battsetseg hopes to expand her business further.

Battsetseg works very hard and is a clever woman.  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory for her salon.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her salon

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Madame Aissatou Traoré est une veuve de 39 ans qui habite dans la localité de Dalifort. 
Madame Traoré a l’amour du commerce et dispose d’un emplacement au sein de la maison familiale qu’elle souhaite aménager pour débuter le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Dalifort  depuis 6 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour acheter des produits et  mettre en place son stock. Selon madame Traoré l’impact social que pourrait avoir ce financement serait de régler ses besoins personnels et aussi d’assister ses proches avec la réalisation de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aissatou Traoré is a 39-year-old widow living in the town of Dalifort. Mrs. Traoré loves commerce and has an area at her disposal in the family home where she wishes to start selling cosmetic products. She has been a member of the Dalifort credit union for six years. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy merchandise and set up a display. Mrs. Traoré believes in the social impact of making profits to fulfill her personal needs and to help her family.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To start a commercial activity

loans.name: Dolores Cecilia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Dolores, mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 20 años de la cual ha tenido tres hijos, todos menores de edad, dos de ellos están en la escuela. El marido se dedica a la venta de lotería en las calles de Portoviejo.

Ella al igual que su marido también se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, trabaja de lunes a viernes de cuatro a cinco horas diarias y los fines de semana junto con su marido se van a otros cantones cercanos para aprovechar las ferias que es cuando más se vende. Dice que esto si deja ganancias aunque  ya no quiere trabajar lejos de su casa por sus hijos, es por eso que desea poner una tienda en su casa.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar productos de primera necesidad para surtir una tienda y así poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijos. Es socia de la Fundacion Espoir  y le ha gustado por la facilidad para obtener los créditos.
 
Sus deseos son tener un gran local comercial.
texts.en:
The community bank named August 30 meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The region is known for its commerce, their traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the happy population. Dolores has lived with her boyfriend for the past 20 years and they have three children together. They are all minors and two are in school. Her boyfriend sells lottery tickets in the streets of Portoviejo. She, like her husband, sells lottery tickets, working from Monday to Friday for four or five hours a day. On weekends she and her husband go to fairs in neighboring villages because that is when the tickets sell the best. She says that the business is profitable but she doesn't want to work far from home anymore because of the children. She would like to set up a store in her home instead. This loan will be used to purchase basic grocery products to stock her new grocery store. She will be able to have more time with her kids this way. She is a member of the Espoir Foundation (Kiva Field Partner) and she has enjoyed being a member for the loans that are granted. Her dreams are to have a large grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha que significa Dios Sol en quechua.
Julia es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 2 años, Julia tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su mama, porque Julia es docente y cuando ella no esta su mama le ayuda.
Julia solicita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de gaseosas.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una ferretería y que todos sus proyectos se cumplan.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Wiracocha communal bank. In Quechua, Wiracocha means ‘Sun God’.

Julia has a live-in partner and a 2-year-old son. She has a store in her parents’ house where she sells general groceries, vegetables, and fruits. Julia is a teacher, so her mother helps her when she is not there.

Julia is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN for the purchase of soft drinks. Her dreams are to have a hardware store and that all of her plans work out.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita C. is from the village of Calamagui. She is 48 years old, married and has 8 school-aged children. Julita owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells a raised pig.

In 2009, Julita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock. Julita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. This will be her 4th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
This loan group is made up of five members, who are shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Mao K., is a 32-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. She is married to Oum Sok, age 44. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to five children. One of the children is married and four are single. She and her husband also fish along the river in order to earn extra profit. As she lacks money to buy fishing gear and supplies, she has decided to request a loan from Kiva, and she will use these funds to buy nets and traps for the fishing business.

The other four borrowers:
Mrs. N. is asking for a loan to buying fishing equipment for earning extra profit.
Mrs. Y. is asking for a loan to purchase nets and traps.  
Mrs. E. is applying for a loan to buy fishing tools for additional revenue.   
Mrs. T. is applying for a loan to buy nets and traps for extra income.

loans.use: To buy nets, traps for fishing business.

loans.name: Maziima Association-Jinja Group

texts.en: K. Hassani, 30 years old,  belongs to Maziima Association-Jinja. He has been operating his food sales business in Namulesa for 8 years. His clients have mostly been people in the local community. His weekly profits add up to 70,000 UGX. Prior to this business, he was into farming. With this loan, he plans to purchase about 20 litres of cooking oil, salt and charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, salt and charcoal

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PROGRESO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jorge Antonio; el tiene 52 años de edad y es casado y tiene 1 hijo; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de servicio de taxi, el socio tiene un carro donde realiza servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad del Cusco, el socio quiere mejorar el servicio de taxi. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos y mantenimiento para el carro productos.

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Progreso" ["Progress"] communal bank.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is also in the province and department of Cusco.

The borrower's name is Mr. Jorge Antonio.  He is 52 years old, married, and has one son.  Jorge alternates his daily activities with a taxi service business.  He has a car that he uses to provide taxi service throughout the different streets of the city of Cusco.  He would like to improve his taxi service.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts and maintenance products for his car.

Jorge is grateful to those who, through this means, will contribute to his dream.  He also promises to comply with his repayment schedule according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and maintenance products for his taxi

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella M. is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She also takes care of her mother. Angella lives in the Kitawuluzi neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for her family.

Angella has been a retail shopkeeper for ten years, and she works seven days a week. The main business challenges Angella faces include seasonality and thieves.

Angella has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals for her business are to go to the villages of the Nakasongola district for charcoal and to start selling charcoal at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario C. is from the village of Binakalan, Gingoog City. She is 35 years old. Rosario is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosario owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and delicacies like banana cues and rice cakes in the local community. She also buys and sells dried fish and home-made sausage or chorizo. Rosario has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosario has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Rosario is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken by Rosario from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio A. is from the village of District 4. He is 53 years old. Antonio is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Antonio raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Antonio has been engaged in his business for more than 23 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Antonio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Antonio is requesting a loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken by Antonio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Ибодов Каромат проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 72 года. Женат. Имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Каромат при доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Кроме того она занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. У него богатый опыт в этой сфере. В продвижении деятельности ему помогают дети. Кредит берет для закупа скота и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Karomat I. lives in the Vahdat Region. He is 72 years old. Married, with three children. His wife is a homemaker. Karomat has a land plot by his house and grows wheat and vegetables. In addition, [he]  breeds and raises livestock. He has a lot of experience with this work. His children help him with his business. He is taking out a loan in order to buy livestock and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 28-year-old married man, living in Chtoura with his wife and one child. Maher has worked in the international transportation business since 2002. He owns a six-wheel truck and really enjoys his work. He explains that his work allows him to discover different countries and to see the beauty of the countries. Maher works hard to provide for his family.

Maher bought a new pickup trick, which he works on when he's in Lebanon, though he may rent it to someone else to work on while he is away. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, which would be his first loan, so that he can legally register the pickup truck.

loans.use: To register his pickup truck

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, 56 years old, lives in the town of Bunawan. She is a farmer and tills her own land. She and her husband plant rice and corn crops. They sell their harvest to rice traders. They also plant vegetables in their backyard. Alicia is a hard-working mother and only wants the best for her family. She hopes to have a better yield and income so she can improve her family's living conditions.

Alicia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seed, fertilizer, and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Juliana Mueni

texts.en:
Juliana Mueni is a 51 years old farmer.  She is married to S. who contributes to the family income.  Juliana supports 10 members of her family.  Farming for over a decade, she has a monthly income of about KES. 2,000 per month. 

This is her first loan from KADET LTD.  She will buy seedlings, fertilizer and watering cans with the money.  She hopes to be a leading farmer in her area by growing different crops which will improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy seedlings, fertilizer and watering cans

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva K. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school.  Eva has a business which sells clothes. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days a week. Eva sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.    

Eva has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of new clothes. The main business challenges for Eva include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of clothes. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to become a wholesaler. Eva lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of new clothes

loans.name: Karabek

texts.en:
S. Karabek is 49 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. His wife helps him with their household expenses now that she is a merchant with a stall in the oriental market in Shahrituz. Karabek has worked in agriculture for 15 years. The biggest problem he has is a lack of funding. His plans for the future are to succeed in establishing more farmland and to be able to help his children build their homes. He has requested this loan to invest in farm supplies.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and herbicides for his farm

loans.name: Jesukpego Lokokoukoumè Group

texts.fr:
JESUKPEGO LOKOKOUKOUME est un groupe constitué de six personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Vidéhou. Les membres du groupe mènent leur activité dans la même zone. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
Née en 1959 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, Vidéhou vit depuis une dizaine d’année à Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji.  Vidéhou est mariée à un boucher du nom de Antoine et a sept enfants dont cinq sont à sa charge. Vidéhou assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges de la maison. Il y a environs treize ans que Vidéhou est dans la restauration. En effet, Vidéhou  prépare la pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce aux poissons qu’elle vend à Cotonou. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qui l’aident à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Vidéhou  s’approvisionne également à Cotonou. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Vidéhou et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
Jesukpego Lokokoukoumè is a group of six people. The group’s president (the woman raising her hand in the photo) is named Vidéhou. The members all carry out their businesses in the same area. To meet their goal of increasing working capital, the group is asking for its first loan from Alidé.

Through she was born in Benin’s economic capital, Cotonou, in 1959, Vidéhou has been living in Lokokoukoumè, in the Sèmè-Podji area, for the last decade. Vidéhou is married to a butcher by the name of Antoine, and is a mother of seven, five of which she is still supporting. Vidéhou works together with her husband to meet their household’s various financial needs. She has been in the restaurant business for about 13 years. More specifically, Vidéhou prepares corn mash with fish sauce, which she then sells in Cotonou. Through this business, she makes income to help meet her childrens’ needs. She buys her supplies in Cotonou. This first loan will likely enable Vidéhou and her group to increase their business, as well as their clientele and profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn, fresh fish and sauce condiments

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 35 years old and married. She runs a general store where she sells items such as soap, lotion, cooking oil, and rice. Her business is solid. She employs two people to help her. Speciose has three years of experience. Her store is open from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. every day.

Speciose has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store. With the profit, Speciose will build her own house and save for her family's future needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Wala'a

texts.en:
Wala’a is a 26-year-old single lady. After getting her diploma degree, she worked at a sewing workshop and gained a lot of experience there.  Then she used her mother’s sewing machines at home to start a small sewing business.

Three years ago, Wala’a started her own sewing workshop by herself. At first she used her mother’s machine at home, and through these years, she was able to expand her business and open an independent sewing workshop that includes six sewing machines, one cutting machine, and three employees.

Now, Wala’a has applied for this loan to buy a distributing bus, and in the future she want to open a sewing factory.

loans.use: To buy a bus for distributing clothes to the shops

loans.name: Rebulon

texts.en:
Rebulon is a 51-year-old farmer who lives with his wife Yokebet and 3 children –  22-year-old Yalon is currently studying at the University, 17-year-old Robet is in the 1st grade of junior high school, and 11-year-old Stevanus is in the 6th grade of elementary school. 

Although Rebulon has his own plot of land to farm, he also buys crops such as coconuts, bananas, soursops, sweet potatoes and cassavas from other farmers and then resell them in the market. He has been involved in this business for almost 2 years. Previously, he sold only the crops from his farm.   

As the father of 3 children, Rebulon works hard in order to fulfill his family's needs as well as pay for the educational cost for his children.  His son Yalon needs much money while studying at the University, so Rebulon wants to increase his income from his business. Rebulon would like to purchase more agricultural  products from other farmers in his village to increase his sales, but unfortunately he does not have enough capital to do so.  Therefore, he is seeking for a loan to make his dream come true. 

Rebulon met a TLM Field officer who introduced him to the TLM lending programs. Rebulon thinks that he should take this opportunity to improve his business for the future. He has requested a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM.   He would like to spend the loan to buy crops such as bananas, coconuts, vegetables, etc. in large quantity. Rebulon is really expecting that TLM will approve his loan application.

loans.use: buy fruits & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Walter David

texts.es:
Walter David tiene 28 años, es casada vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Walter se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es superar la situacion economica.

Le gusta hacer deporte y ayudar a la esposa en el estudio.
texts.en:
Walter David is 28 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called 'Nuevo Horizonte' (New Horizon).  It is located in Cachely Grande, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Walter grows crops, especially corn, rice and beans.  He makes his purchases in "Hnos. Olivos" store each month and makes his sales in the street market in the same town.

Walter is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges in his work such as crop diseases.  His dream is to improve his financial situation.

Walter enjoys taking part in sports and helping his wife in her studies.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en: Diosdada is a married woman with four children. She is 50 years old and has been an AVON dealer for a year. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him till the land where they grow rice crops. She rents a stall at the market to sell their harvest. Diosdada is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase farm inputs and products to sell. In the future, she hopes to help her family live in harmony and be able to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and products to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 38 years old.  He is married and a father of fifteen children.  He has been a farmer for the last four years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for wheat farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his third loan.  It will be used to prepare his wheat farm. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming so that he can increase his wheat production and educate his children.

His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land for a building plot.  He is a hard-working man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his wheat farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods such as maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past two years, he has operated a poultry business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000, he wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feeds. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: La Bendicion 3-5 Group

texts.en:
Luisa is the coordinator of her group La Bendicion (Blessing) 3 & 5. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area.

She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed to start a business since the income from her husband was not enough. She found a way to help him by bringing in extra incoming through selling used clothes. She has had her business for over four years, starting with her first Esperanza  loan. 

This is Luisa´s eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business.

She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying a bag of used clothing and some new pieces specially for men. She will use the profits to buy more bags and improve her business. She is also planning to save and buy a house to live in with her family so she can stop paying rent. This is her most difficult challenge and also one of her dreams. She enjoys being at her home with her children and her partner.

Luisa is thankful for all your support!

loans.use: to buy a bag of used clothes and also some new clothes to resell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 23, married with three children age seven and below, and has been farming for three years in the Kitale area of western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, eggs and maize which she sells to the local market. She runs a motorcycle business for additional income.

Christine has made a loan request of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, this being her third loan request with Juhudi Kilimo. She says the loan will enable her purchase more birds for her poultry business. She says her focus is to be a major supplier of poultry birds and eggs in the area and expand her farm to 2,000 birds in number.

Christine says she will pay back the loan, since Juhudi loans have been of great help to her family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Cherlyn

texts.en:
Cherlyn is 37 years old and lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two school-aged children. 

Cherlyn has a motorcycle transport business. This has been operated by her husband for over five years and fortunately provides at least the day-to-day needs of the household and the minimal school expenses of their children.  Each month, she earns approximately PHP 7,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to repair a transport vehicle for a better service. 

Cherlyn has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. She was able to repay the previous loans made in the cooperative. In the future, Cherlyn expects to resume the business operation soon to sustain daily needs. She also plans to improve the house to live comfortably.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle.

loans.name: Shareefa

texts.en:
Shareefa is a 51-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons and two daughters. Some of her sons are a construction workers with decent salaries. 

Shareefa has a store for selling DVDs and computers. She wants to purchase more computers to sell because of high demand from customers. She has some money, but not enough to pay for the additional inventory, so she needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN to complete the amount she needs to pay. When Shareefa gets this loan that is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to pay for purchasing more computers to sell, which will enable her to increase her income and offer better living conditions for her family.

Shareefa is a conservative woman, so her son Mahmoud is photographed instead in the store.

loans.use: To purchase computers for sale.

loans.name: Javier Alvaro

texts.es: El señor Javier  es un cliente emprendedor que tiene su taller mecánico en la zona el Tejar, lleva en esta actividad hace bastantes años, el crédito solicitado es para  la compra de un motor para el arreglo de una movilidad. El cliente demostró un trato amable y Cortez en la evaluación que se le hizo,  el señor Javier es muy trabajador y además dedicado a su trabajo, padre de tres lindas hijas y junto a su esposa tienen la voluntad y la idea de que con trabajo, un día tendrá una sucursal de su negocio en un lugar mas comercial, además con mayor producción y rentabilidad que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida y poder brindar a su hijas una buena educación, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Javier is an enterprising client who has a mechanic’s shop in the Tejar zone.  He has had this business activity for quite a few years.

The requested loan is to buy a motor to fix up a car.

During the evaluation that was done he demonstrated a kind and courteous manner.  Javier is very hard-working, and he is also dedicated to his work.

He has three beautiful daughters.  He and his wife have the will and the belief that, with work, they will one day have a branch of his business in a more commercial place.  It will also have greater production and profitability.  This will allow him to improve their quality of life and to give his daughters a good education.

He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: to buy a motor.

loans.name: Ndeye Rama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune femme célibataire qui a décidé de se lancer dans le transport urbain.Elle sollicite ainsi un pret de 400000f pour acheter une motocyclette "Djakarta".Celle ci étant le principal moyen de transport dans sa localité, elle pourra rapidement générer des bénéfices qui lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge des dépenses alimentaires, de santé et de scolarité de sa famille.Son ambitiopn est d'arriver à acheter cinq motos de transport.
texts.en: This borrower is a single young woman who decided to get into urban transport. She is thus requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy a small motorcycle of the "Djakarta" brand. This is the principal means of transport in her locality. She will be able to generate profit quickly which will allow her to help cover her family's expenses for food, healthcare, and school fees. Her ambition is to manage to buy five transport motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy a "Djakarta"-brand motorcycle.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two school-going children.  Her husband is a seaman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Mwanamisi has operated a food stall for the past 4 years; in addition she also sells coconuts. Her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; in some months of the year, like the month of Ramadan, demand is low. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase bags of beans, wheat flour and 5 sacks of coconuts for her businesses. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans, wheat flour and 5 sacks of coconuts for her businesses.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema  lives in Kampala, Uganda with her husband and two children, both of whom attend school. She also helps care for two other family members, her niece and nephew. For the last three years, she has worked for seven days a week to earn a living by selling chapatti (a type of flatbread) in a local market. She is applying for a loan  for 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more flour and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are transportation, the rising price of ingredients and the seasonal nature of her business. Her goals for the future is to go into a wholesale business. She lives in a rented house where her family has access to electricity but not piped-in water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and medical care.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make flatbread.

loans.name: Enciende Una Luz 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is a single mother with 4 children who lives in the beautiful town of Samana. This area is a nascent tourist zone, surrounded by the Atlantic ocean and mountains, rivers and natural breezes. Ramona says her most important challenge is to raise her children and guide them in a good way. She enjoys the kitchen and cooking.

Ramona is receiving her second loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid her previous loan.  She started her food business 8 months ago with the first loan she took from us. She will use this loan to purchase seafood, meat, chicken and vegetables. With her business profits (for the long term) she will save because she needs to repair her house and make her business prosperous. 

Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: to buy seafood, meat, chicken and vegetables for her food business.

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe /rbv Group

texts.fr:
Thérèse  fait partie du groupe Abishyizehamwe/Rbv. Elle a 54 ans et elle est mariée avec 4 enfants de 18 à 25 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Elle a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 5 ans de primaire.

Thérèse est cultivatrice de maïs. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des semences, des engrais chimiques,location de champs et paiement main d’œuvre pour son agriculture des maïs. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de moderniser son agriculture. Dans les prochaines années, Thérèse voudrait être distributeur des produits agricole dans sa région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Thérèse is part of the Abishyizehamwe/Rbv group. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of 4 children aged between 18 and 25, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of one more person. She has 5 years of primary school education and is a corn grower.

This is Thérèse's second loan cycle with ACB. She will use the money to buy seeds and chemical fertilizer, as well as to pay the rent on her land and the labourers for their work on her corn farm.

Thérèse plans to increase her profits by modernising her business and would eventually like to become a main distributor of agricultural products in her region. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children´s education and build a house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemical fertilizer and to pay the manual labourers and the rent on her land.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
This is Ellen.  She is 51 years old, married, and has three children aged 29, 22 and 15 years. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she was adopted. 

In 1996, Ellen established her pub business. She began her business because her husband’s salary was not enough to support their family, so she had to sell drinks to get extra income to help her husband provide a livelihood for their children. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le.3,000,000 in order to buy more drinks for her business. 

In the future, Ellen plans to send her children overseas to study and to build a dwelling house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for her pub.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells palm oil and palm kernel oil at Ayensudo.  She is married to a farmer and has 10 dependents. Ekua uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family. Ekua will use her loan to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernels for the production of the oil. Ekua will use the new profit to expand her oil business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit and palm kernels for oil production.

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson is a forty-year-old hardworking man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house.

He has been a farmer for the last two years after starting with two acres of land and now he has four and a half acres. His major hardship have been price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a goal of diversifying his farm to include cattle rearing. The purpose for this loan is to pay workers who are weeding his garden and for buying pesticides.

loans.use: to weed and buy pesticides for his garden

loans.name: Faride Anahi

texts.es: La Señorita Faride tiene  como actividad principal la elaboración de collares, pulseras y canastones artesanales los vende en la feria 16 de julio  de la ciudad de el Alto y también por la zona de la ceja de el Alto , el credito que solicita es para poner madera en el piso de uno d elos ambientes de su casa ya necesita un ambiente mas grande para  trasladar su taller ya que a la mucha demanda que tiene  su taller le quede pequeño, el domicilio de Faride  en la zona Ciudad Satélite , actualmente vive con sus tres hermanos y su mama, a quienes ayuda con  los gastos del hogar, es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida por el apoyo que le brindan ya que esta es la unica actividda que le permite manter a su familia.
texts.en: Faride’s main activity is manufacturing necklaces, bracelets and artisanal baskets that she then sells at the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio street market and also in El Alto’s La Ceja zone.  She needs the loan to install a wood floor in one of the rooms in her house because she needs a larger space to move her shop into because demand is high and her workshop is too small.  Faride lives in Ciudad Satélite with her three siblings and her mother that she helps with household expenses.   She’s a very responsible, hardworking young woman who feels happy and grateful for the support she’s being given since this is the only activity she has that allows her to support her family.

loans.use: to install a wood floor.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en: Delfin lives in Pingol, Ozamiz City. He is 56 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. For more than 3 years, he has made a living by selling food & daily use products in the local community. He earns about 10,000 PHP a month from his work. In 2010, Delfin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for this loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand his product offering. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offering.

loans.name: Kyanyambubi Farmers Group

texts.en: Scovia is a thirty three year old woman, a resident of Masindi district, married and has three children. She does farming as her major business. She has stayed in farming since 1994.Her aim of starting up the business was to sustain her family and ensure education of her children.Scovia wants the loan for weeding and to buy fertilizers.She has a good customer language to her clients and they describe her as a hard working and honest woman. Her dreams are to expand and modernize her farm land but she faces a problem of inadequate capital. She is normally challenged by weather changes and price fluctuations plus loss of soil fertility. She is in need of a loan for, weeding and buying fertilizers. She is a member of Kyanyambubi Farmers Group where members offer guarantorship for one another to obtain a group loan.

loans.use: to pay labor for, weeding and buying fertilizers for the farm .

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif applied for a loan of $300 to buy writing materials. He wants to improve his business. For the first time he borrowed a loan of $600 and repaired his own shop.
This 52-year-old man is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of  Azerbaijan Agdam region, settled in Khirdalan settlement, married has 2 children.
Now he applied for a loan of $1000 to expand the area of his shop and o increase range of goods. 
You can see his shop in the picture. This shop is very small.
He has been engaged in this business for 5 years.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh is a very kind and responsible man. He was born in 1973 in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He is married and has 2 children. Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought 2 calves. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Laurinda Jasse

texts.en:
Laurinda Jesse P. is 55 years old. She was raised in Chanalane by her parents. Laurinda’s father was a crocodile – jacare – hunter, and his financial conditions prevented her from pursuing her studies. Laurinda studied only until the 4th grade because this was the highest education in her area. When she was 16 years old Laurinda moved to Maputo with her husband, after 6 years she heard about a Portuguese school, however her husband did not approve of her going to school. Laurinda did attend sewing classes with the help of her brother.

When she was 26 years old, Laurinda worked as a seamstress and owned a sewing machine. In 1991, she divorced her husband and started working as a seamstress, but in 1998 because of an illness she had to interrupt her sewing activities and opened a small commercial establishment in her home. Laurinda was introduced to HLUVUKU ADSEMA by a neighbor there she requested her first loans in order to expand her business. Since then Laurinda’s business has been thriving and now provides employment for her and her mother.

With the loan of 18.000,00MT, Laurinda plans on increasing the number of her laying hens. Laurinda’s work has appositive impact in her community in that it provides fresh eggs to her neighborhood especially in the Boane market.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZAÇÃO: Bairro1 - Boane CLIENTE : Laurinda Jesse P. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE : Avicultura VALOR DE EMPRESTIMO: 18.000,00 MT (720.00US$) APLICAÇÃO DO MONTANTE : Compra de poedeiras . Data Inicio: 10/06/2007 Fim:31/05/2008 Laurinda Jesse P., de 55 anos de idade, natural de Maputo, Provincia de Maputo, divorciada, cresceu sob responsabilidade dos Pais em Changalane.O Pai era caçador de Jacares e as condições financeiras da familia nao lhe criaram oportunidade de Estudar muito tendo estudado ate a 4ª classe isso porque era a classe maxima da zona onde ela vivia e para ela poder continuar tinha que se deslocar a cidade. Aos 16 anos ela se casa tendo passado a viver na cidade de Maputo com o seu esposo, passados 6 anos tomou conhecimento da existencia duma Escola Potuguesa mas o marido nao dexava ela ir a Escola , mas, ela tinha muita vontade de aprender o irmão cuateou as despesas do curso de costura.

Com 26 anos ja assumia na integra a gestão de negocio como custureira e possuia uma maquina de costura. Em 1991 separa-se do marido e começa a trabalhar na casa de gaiato como costureira e em 1998 para de trabalhar por motivo de doença e veio a abrir um estabelecimento comercial perto da sua casa. Por indicação de um vizinho teve conhecimento da existência da HLUVUKU ADSEMA, tendo aproximado e solicitado o seu primeiro emprestimo para ampliação do seu negocio. Desde então o seu negocio conheçe outra dinâmica, tendo solicitado varios outros emprestimos e actualmente esta num bom ritmo e providencia emprego para ela e sua Mãe .

Com o emprestimo de 18.000,00MT pretende aumentar a quantidaade de poedeiras. A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade porque coloca o produto mas perto do cliente, com particualr destaque para o mercado de Boane.

loans.use: Egg production

loans.name: Graciela

texts.en:
Graciela is married and has two children ages 18 and 1. Her husband, Abelino Janeiro, is 41 years old and works as a construction worker.

Graciela sells spices such as pepper, oregano, cumin, anise, etc. She started out as an assistant in a business that processed, packaged and sold spices. After several years, she was able to pool together some savings and start her own business. She bought a packaging machine and with her eldest son's help she started processing and selling her own spices.

While her son tends to the business, she sells the spices door to door. Today, demand for her products has increased and she is requesting a loan in the amount of US $200 to invest in packaging materials, such as plastic bags, and an additional packaging machine.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Graciela es casada y es madre de 2 hijos, el mayor tiene 18 años y el menor 1 año. Su marido se llama Abelino Janeiro y tiene 41 años, y es constructor de obras.

Graciela se dedica a la venta de especias tales como pimienta, orégano, comino, anís y muchos otros más. Ella empezó como ayudante en un negocio que se dedicaba a la elaboración y venta de los mismos, tras varios años ella pudo juntar unos ahorros y monto su propio negocio. Compró una máquina empaquetadora y con la ayuda de su hijo mayor elaborar y empaquetan las especias.

Su hijo atiene el negocio, y Graciela sale a vender de forma ambulante sus productos. Hoy día la demanda de sus productos va en aumento, por lo que desea un crédito de $ 200, que los invertirá en la compra de bolsitas y una máquina más, para empaquetar mayor cantidad de condimentos.

loans.use: To purchase a packaging machine and bags

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.en: Huseyn is 29 years old and lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region  with his wife.  They don't have a child. He has run his own farm for the past 4 years. Huseyn has requested a loan of $1200  to buy pesticides and fertilizer, which he will use to improve the size and quality of his crops.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Ahanuwa

texts.en: Ahanuwa O. is 28 years old, still single and lives in Benin City. She sells provisions and drinks to people living in her community. She learnt her business from her mother when she was a child; she is in need of $400 loan to buy more provisions and drinks for sales.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr:
Mr. Alphonse B., 28, was born in Lomé; he has a physical handicap and is single. He is a shoemaker by trade, making and repairing shoes. Unfortunately, his financial means are meager and so he is not able to procure a machine to polish the soles he makes nor to have enough leather of various types. Alphonse is requesting a loan of US$ 900 so that he can purchase the polishing machine which is fundamental to his trade and also stock up on leather. This will permit him to satisfy his customers' needs and make a better profit which should lead to improved living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agé de 28 ans, Monsieur B. Alphonse est né à Lomé, handicapé et célibataire. Il est cordonnier de profession. Son activité est basée sur la fabrication et la réparation des chaussures. Il manque cruellement de moyens pour acquérir une machine à polir les semelles de sa fabrication et avoir suffisamment de cuir de différentes qualités. Monsieur Alphonse sollicite un prêt de $900 afin de se procurer de la machine qui est un moyen très fondamental de son activité et s’approvisionner en cuir. Ceci lui permettra de satisfaire ses clients et de dégager une marge bénéficiaire susceptible de contribuer à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.

loans.use:
purchase of a shoe-polishing machine and additional leather for making shoes

Achat de machine à polir

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Asrorhoja

texts.en: O. Asrorhoja lives in the Mastchokh region, and he is married and has 6 children. Mr. O. raises and sells livestock. He dreams of having a large herd to increase meat production and the self-made dairy goods. Mr. O. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase pedigree bulls.

loans.use: Purchase pedigree bulls to increase meat production and diary products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use:
Purchase fertilizers, seeds and agrochemicals.

Comprar abonos semillas, fertilizantes, agroquimicos

loans.name: Tereza's Group

texts.es:
Magna, Maritza and Tereza belong to the Santo Domingo de Acocro community bank. They are from the district of Acocro, located 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho.

Magna lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has 3 children. Magna has a general store in her home. Additionally, Magna plants grains, which she sells to intermediaries.

Maritza, on the other hand, lives with her partner, is 27 years old and has 1 son. Maritza has a small store where she sells groceries and sweets, her store is located close to the district school. In addition, Maritza sells food.

Tereza lives with her partner, is 43 years old and has 5 children. Tereza has a store where she sells groceries and vegetables. In addition, Tereza sells food to workers at different institutions in the district.

Magna, Maritza and Tereza need loans to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, pastas, cookies, candy, chicken, vegetables, meat and spices.

Among the dreams which Magna, Maritza and Tereza have are to have a cart to transporting their merchandise, that their children become professionals, to have a restaurant and that their businesses improve.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Magna, Maritza y Tereza pertenecen al Banco Comunal Santo Domingo de Acocro, las socias son del Distrito de Acocro que esta ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Magna es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 3 hijos, Magna tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, Además Magna siembra cereales que vende a intermediarios.

Por otro lado Maritza es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Maritza tiene una pequeña tienda donde vende abarrotes y golosinas, su tienda esta ubicada cerca del centro educativo del Distrito. Además Maritza vende comida.

Mientras que Tereza es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 5 hijos, Tereza tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras. Además Tereza vende comida a los trabajadores de las diferentes instituciones del Distrito.

Magna, Maritza y Tereza necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideo, galletas, caramelos, pollo, verduras, carne y condimentos.

Los sueños de Magna, Maritza y Tereza son tener un carro para transportar su mercadería, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener un restaurante y que sus negocios sean mejores.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses; buy rice, sugar, milk, pastas, cookies, candy, chicken, vegetables, meat and spices.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 42 year old father of six who sells potatoes and matoke from a road-side stall in Kampala. He has had this business for ten years in the same location, buying his produce from the local market. He also has a business which rents out wheel barrows to supplement his income.

Abbas is seeking a loan to purchase another wheel barrow for his hire business and a sack of matoke to sell at his stall. 

Abbas' wife has her own little restaurant business and together they raise their children who range in age from four to 17 years. He hopes to one day have a shop from which to sell his vegetables rather than from his road-side stall.

loans.use: Abbas is seeking a loan to purchase another wheel barrow for his hire business and a sack of matoke to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A lease

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand a small business of selling women's clothing.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. H. Thi Nguyen joined the Fund in 2007. Her family lives in a house facing a main street, which is very convenient for running a business. She first joined the Fund to borrow money to invest in buying fruits to sell; at first she only sold small quantities to serve people in the area. After one round of funding and seeing that the business had very high profits, she invested more money to expand the store with many more types of fruits. Her husband buys and brings home the inventory of goods, and she runs the store and sells the fruits. Besides sales at the store, she also sells to traders who supply the local markets around the area, and also has contracts to supply fruits for family gatherings, events, and ceremonies. The family’s finances are slowly improving and her is also very happy with their business. She has two small school-age children. In this round of funding she is requesting 9,000,000 VND to continue investing in the fruits business. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hương tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2007, gia đình chị sống ở cạnh đường liên xã nên rất thuận tiện cho việc buôn bán. Năm 2007 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn về đầu tư mua hoa quả, ban đầu chị cũng chỉ buôn bán nhỏ lẻ phục vụ bà con quanh địa phương. Trải qua 1 vòng vốn thấy rằng việc buôn bán thu nhấp rất cao, nên chị đã đầu tư thêm nhiều vốn mở rộng cửa hàng với nhiều loại hoa quả khác nhau. Chồng chị chuyên đi lấy hàng về và chị là người bán, ngoài việc bán lẻ chị cũng chuyên bán buôn cho các con buôn tại các khu chợ lẻ quanh vùng, và nhận hợp đồng cung cấp hoa quả cho các hộ gia đình có công việc như hiếu, hỷ.....Kinh tế gia đình chị từng bước phát triển và chị cũng rất hài lòng với việc kinh doanh của gia đình. Chị có 2 con còn nhỏ đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào buôn bán hoa quả. Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Invest in fruits retail, trading business

loans.name: Orzukhon

texts.en:
Orzukhon G. is a very hard-working woman and knows that each day she has to give her best effort and all her courage. She is married with 3 children. She works raising animals and feeding them with the goal of later selling them. This activity creates in her feelings of satisfaction because it allows her to provide a considerable amount of the household income.

Orzukhon began making a living in this way when she invested money from a loan over five years ago to get started and with the dedication that she puts forth, she has seen her little stable grow. The care that she takes to feed the animals and supply them with occasional medical visits from the veterinarian has increased their numbers and so now she guides them into the field each day for feeding.

Orzukhon makes sure not to neglect her role as a mother, because she i€™s also very dedicated to lovingly raising her three children, who also help out in caring for the animals, as you can see in the photo, during their free time. She wants to improve her stable and stalls and produce milk in a quantity sufficient for selling it commercially. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for the term of 12 months to buy calves and fodder for her animals. Please support this woman who is determined to change the course of her life with dedication and hard work.

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand her business

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is Mohamed M.. Mohamed was born in Kabala 27 years ago. He is married with 2 children, both of whom are still not of school age. Mohamed is a tailor and is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000.00 to help him buy working materials such as sewing machines, cottons, threads, and zippers. Previously, Mohamed received a loan of the same amount, Le 3,000,000.00, from Kiva through SMT.  He also used that loan to buy working materials. While the new loan amount remains the same, it will still enable him to make a better profit and consequently improve his living standard. Each time Mohamed makes profit, he reinvests part of the profit into the business and part of it into the house he is currently building.

loans.use: Mohamed would like to buy sewing materials for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Yuly Angela

texts.es:
Yuly tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente, madre de una niña recién nacida, estudió el quinto año de secundaria y vive en el Jr. La Paz s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador”-Juli. Con el primer préstamo de S/: 300 aumentó su capital y compró un carrito salchipapero. A los 18 años de edad tuvo su esposo y tuvo  empezar a trabajar vendiendo salchipapas en el Jr. Cusco, por esa razón no continuo sus estudios superiores. Al mismo tiempo hace trabajos en bordados de bayeta que vende en el mismo Juli.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado 4 cuotas, comprará insumos para preparar salchipapas como salchichas, aceite, pollo y papa.

Su mayor deseo es tener un Restaurante en Juli o Puno donde pueda trabajar con comodidad.
texts.en:
Yuly is 19 years old, is married, and is the mother of a new-born daughter. She studied until the fifth year of secondary school and lives in Jr. La Paz s/n, in the district of Juli, Chuchito, Puno.

She is member of the Niño San Salvador Community Bank in Juli. With her first loan of 300 soles, she increased her capital and bought a kebab cart. At 18 years of age, she got married to her husband and had to being selling kebabs in the Jr. Cusco. As a result, she didn’t continue her education. At the same time, she does cloth embroidery that she sells in Juli.

With this loan of 500 soles, which will be repaid in 4 installments, she will buy ingredients, like sausages, oil, chicken, and potatoes, to make kebabs.

Her biggest dream is to have a restaurant in Juli or Puno, where she can work in comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sausages, oil, chicken, and potatoes

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía  tiene 63 años, es viuda, vive con su hijo de 37 años. Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 40 años, época en que se casó, comenzó a trabajar en la chacra para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Esta actividad le agrada, ya que desde niña aprendió poco a poco la labor, siendo la cosecha lo que más le agrada realizar, ya que no es muy  trabajoso. Además, que  el dedicarse al cultivo de plátanos es rentable, ya que su producción  es quincenal, con lo cual logra obtener cada 1 días ingresos económicos. Lo más difícil es poder  trasladar sus productos a los mercados de la ciudad, ya que el flete es costoso. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Sofía tiene pensado ampliar sus terrenos de cultivo, para  lo cual  requiere la cantidad que solicita para la compra de plantas de  plátano.
texts.en:
Sofia is 63 years old, a widow, and lives with her 37-year old son. She has dedicated herself to farming for the past 40 years, when she married, starting by working on the farm to help her husband with the household expenses. She enjoys this activity, since as a child she learned about it little by little, taking the most pleasure in harvesting her crop. In addition, growing bananas is profitable and produces bimonthly, which allows her to earn money each day. The most difficult part of her enterprise is transporting her product to the city’s markets, since the charters are costly. This is her first loan with MFP. Sofia has thoughts of expanding her farmlands, for which she needs the funds requested to purchase more banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase banana plants.

loans.name: Poeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Poeurn H. lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Choun Sok, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Although they work hard, in the plantation, they do not earn enough revenue to provide a better life for her family.

In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mr. Poeurn H. is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike to start a new motorbike taxi driver. He is 29 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study. His wife is shown at the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to start a new motorbike taxi driver business.

loans.name: Leydi De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Leydi tiene 30 años de edad, habita en sabana grande en la ciudad de Managua, con dos hijos de 1 y 7 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña de mecánico en una empresa privada, ella es un joven que se dedica a cuidar a  su familia,  como en las ventas de cosméticos y ropa, que inicio desde hace cinco años para apoyar a los gastos, que comenzó con dinero que su esposo dio y con prestamos en Afodenic, que ha sido de muchos beneficios para desarrollarse en su negocio  así como poder tomar medio tiempo para ofertar a sus clientes sus productos ya que por las mañana le toca hacer el aseo de su casa. Con la solicitud de prestamos va invertir en la compra de ropa escolar ya que los alumnos están por ingresar a clase y se vende mucho espera obtener con estas ventas buenos ingresos, sus objetivos es poder crecer en inventario y ventas ya que sus metas a futuro es tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Leydi is 30 years old and lives in Sabana Grande of Managua city. She has two children ages 1 and 7. Her husband works as a mechanic in a private business, while she is a young woman who takes care of her family by selling cosmetics and clothing. She began her business 5 years ago to help with the expenses, beginning with money her husband gave her and loans from Afodenic, which have been a great help in growing her business so she is able to work part time offering her clients products and in the mornings take care of her household chores. With the loan she is going to invest in buying school clothing as the students are getting ready to begin class and she can sell a lot. With these sales she hopes to receive good income. Her objectives are to be able to grow her inventory and sales in order to have a store in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school clothing and supplies

loans.name: Asatillo

texts.en:
G. Asatillo is 37 years old and married with four children. After he received a loan from IMON International, he witnessed an increased harvest for the first time in his life. With the loan, Asatillo expanded his vegetable-growing business. With the additional income from the harvest, Asatillo opened a small kiosk in his house where his family sells different foodstuff. Accordingly, his family’s standard of living has improved.

Now he is seeking a loan of 2500 Somoni ($675 USD) to expand his farming operations, which will enable him to meet his targets for the coming season and, in turn, to generate additional income.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged its already weak economy. 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable--conditions that have resulted in high levels of unemployment and forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Union Cristiana 2 Group

texts.en:
This group of five is part of the Union Cristiana (Christian Union) Bank of Hope, which is joining Esperanza International, so they can fund businesses with micro loans.

Elta M. is the group coordinator. She speaks almost no Spanish, so a Creole translator was needed during her interview (luckily, one of the bank members speaks Creole and translated for her). She is expecting her first baby.

Elta needs to generate income more than ever, because now she is responsible for taking care of her child. Elta is in the business of selling clothes. She would like to purchase more clothing to sell with this loan, especially jeans and tennis shoes, which sell really well.

She is committed to working hard to make her business grow and to make sure that her baby is safe and has everything he or she needs (she still doesn’t know if the baby will be a boy or a girl). Please help this young mother-to-be and her fellow micro entrepreneurs in their ventures to make their way out of poverty. Thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
El señor Heriberto tiene 47 años y esta casado con la señora Benita de 46 años.  Cuentan con 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio.

El señor anteriormente trabajaba con sus padres en la compra y venta de mercaderías. Heriberto no cuenta con una profesión ya que solo el colegio terminó. Gracias a la experiencia que adquirió en las ventas y con los clientes que contaba pudo crecer pronto en el ramo a que se dedicaba (venta de guitarras).

Actualmente no cuenta con un local propio ya que se dedica a la venta directa. Posee varios clientes por la zona de Luque y alrededores.

Le gustaría  contar con un local propio mas adelante y que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria ya que el no tuvo la misma suerte, debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos.

El préstamo fue invertido en la compra de guitarras. arpas, sombreros etc.
texts.en:
Heriberto is 47 years old, and he is married to Benita who is 46 years old. They have 2 children who attend school. He used to work with his parents buying and selling goods. He does not have the education for a professional career. Thanks to his experience with sales and with his customers, he was able to quickly develop his own branch of sales. He sells guitars. He does not now have his own location. He deals in direct sales. He has various customers in and around the area of Luque. He would like to have his own location. He would also like for his children to get a college education. He was not lucky enough to go to college due to the limited resources of his parents. The loan will be used to buy guitars, harps, hats, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
