loans.use: To buy guitars, harps, hats

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
I. Aminatou est née vers 1971 à Bassila dans le Département de la Donga au Nord du Bénin. Aminatou est mariée et mère de trois enfants tous scolarisés. C'est depuis huit ans que Aminatou a quitté Bassila pour Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Aminatou vend à Cotonou des produits cosmétiques. C'est de maison en maison que Aminatou passe pour proposer et vendre ses articles. Aminatou achète ses produits cosmétiques à Cotonou à Dantokpa, au grand marché international du Bénin. Pour amener son activité à un niveau plus élevé afin de mieux répondre à la demande de ses clients, Aminatou a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu'elle n'en a aujourd'hui. C'est le pourquoi de la demande de crédit de Aminatou.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Aminatou I. was born in 1971 in Bassila, in the Donga Department in Northern Benin. She's married and the mother of 3 school-attending children. Eight years ago, she left Bassila and came to Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. In Cotonou, Aminatou sells cosmetics door-to-door. She gets her supplies in Cotonou, at Dantokpa, the large international marketplace of Benin. To bolster her business in order to better meet customer demand, Aminatou needs more important financial means than she has today. This is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cosmetics

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 35 years old and happily married to Edmundo, 41 years old, who is an ordinary carpenter in their village. The couple has been blessed with three children; two are still under their care and one is already married and now lives separately. The couple and their two children live in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan.

Teresita has a small hog raising business that serves as her source of income. She sells the pigs in a slaughter house in Solana, Cagayan, which is the pig buying station in their area. To maintain her business Teresita needs more capital. She is hoping to borrow a loan of around PHP7,000 to purchase more feed for her hogs to make them grow healthy. The loan will be a big help to earn more income for Teresita so she can provide for all her family's needs.

Teresita also assists her husband in planting rice, peanuts, and watermelon twice a year. She really works hard for the welfare of her family. She hopes to maintain her business and make it more progressive in order to provide her family a good living condition.

loans.use: To buy more feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia P. is from the village of Kauswagan. She is 58 years old. Leocadia is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Leocadia owns & operates a fish-selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Leocadia is just starting this business.

In 2008, Leocadia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leocadia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Leocadia is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Leocadia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Hokumkhan

texts.en:
Hokumkhan was born in 1966. He is married and settled in the Fuzuli region. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan.

Six years ago he started a cafe. He now needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy tables, chairs, and equipment for his cafe.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, and the equipment for his cafe.

loans.name: Kurbonazar

texts.en:
Kurbonazar K. is 41 years old and married with eight children. Kurbonazar manufactures wooden doors and window frames. His shop is located in his house. Working in this business for seven years, he has became a rather experienced master. Because he produces goods of high quality and acceptable prices, Kurbonazar has many customers. In general, the business is successful and generates a stable income for the family.

Kurbonazar is now planning to purchase an additional woodworker to expand his business. With this purpose, he requests 2500 Somoni. His goal is to continue expanding and improving his business everyday and, more importantly, to ensure that his children will always be able to attend a good school. Kurbonazar is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a woodworker.

loans.name: Allah Wallie Group

texts.en:
This is Sallamatu J., Fatmata J. and Rashid B.. They named their group Allah Wallie. They are local entrepreneurs based in Waterloo, a small town about 22 miles from Freetown.  This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, their businesses will improve in size and quality. Sales and profit will also improve as a result. Consequently, they will be in a better position to help their children in their educational, nutritional and medical needs.

Sallamatu J. (right) is the leader of this group. Sallamatu is now 37 years of age. She was born in Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. She currently resides in Waterloo together with her husband who is a lorry driver. They have one child who is in Junior Secondary School II. Sallamatu sells market food and has been in the business for seven years now. This loan will enable her to improve the standard of her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Berdishukur

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Отаев Бердишукур- мужчина средних лет, отец 4х детей. Жена Хамрокулова С  воспитывает детей, помогая мужу .Бердишукур кормит свою семью за счёт откормленных скотов, которым занимается более 15 лет. Каждую неделю  на базарный день Бердишукур бывает на скотном рынке покупает скот и приносит домой. Его жена и дети присматривают за скотом несколько месяцев, когда скот будет готов муж продает его на базаре за хорошие деньги. На выручку он покупает семье необходимые вещи и ещё и  неготовых бычков на откорм. Бердишукур  сотрудничает с нашей организацией и благодарен нам за то что мы поддержали его с финансовой стороны. Он намерен в дальнейшем работать с нами.
texts.en:
Berdishukur O. is a middle-aged man and a father of 4 children. His wife, S. Hamrokulova, raises their children and helps her husband. Berdishukur supports his family by raising livestock. He has been involved in this business for over 15 years. Berdishukur visits a livestock market, buys livestock and takes it home every week on market days. His wife and children look after the livestock for several months, and, once the livestock is ready, Berdishukur sells it at a market for good money. He uses the profits to purchase necessary items for his family and to purchase more livestock to feed. Berdishukur cooperates with our organization and is grateful to us for the financial support. He intends to work with us in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is selling native snacks made from glutinous rice in Antagan 1st, Tumauini, Isabela. She worked as a domestic helper in Kuwait for seven years that was when her children were still young. Her salary before was just enough for her five children.  She came home without any savings so her husband decided to work abroad as a construction worker with the dream to build a small house for his family. 

Presently, Melinda and their five children lives in a very simple house. Melinda helps her husband by engaging herself into snack vending business.  She used to roam around the village selling her products.  She also sells barbecue in the afternoon and other snacks like cassava. Melinda wanted to be more productive in her enterprise so she is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP6, 000 as additional  capital. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Magnolia.
Victoria es divorciada, tiene 53 años y 3 hijos, Victoria tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado que esta ubicado en un local céntrico, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 3 personas. Además Victoria junto a su hija tienen una empresa de distribución de celulares.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de celulares.
Los sueños de Victoria son que sus hijos sean profesionales y empresaria.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Magnolia Communal Bank. Victoria is 53 years old, divorced, and has 3 children. Victoria has a restaurant in a space that she rents, which is situated in a central location. She manages her restaurant every day with the help of 3 people. In addition, Victoria and her daughter have a mobile phone distribution business. Victoria needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of mobile phones. Victoria’s dream is for her children to become professionals and entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing mobile phones

loans.name: Houda

texts.en: Houda is a 53-year-old widow woman and mother of 3 children. After the pass of her husband, she decided to help her children in the household by working as a baker producing special Lebanese bread in her town. Today, Houda is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase tools to satisfy the needs of her clients after being known by the neighboring villages.

loans.use: purchase tools

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace 3 años que tiene una tienda de comestibles y otros artículos para el hogar, la cual atiende todos los días, durante todo el día, pues es una de las pocas bodegas de su zona y esto es una ventaja para su negocio. Marleny tiene mayor demanda generalmente por las mañanas, por lo que su esposo la apoya en la atención y por las tardes, mientras está pendiente de su tienda, también cuida de algunos animales que cría en su casa. Marleny se siente muy contenta por el progreso de su negocio, pues nota que cada día puede ir mejorando su tienda, pues su deseo a futuro es vender gran variedad de productos, tal como un minimarket.
Este es su 11avo crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, por lo que su compromiso se expresa siendo parte de la junta directiva de éste. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería; tanto comestibles, como algunos artículos de ferretería.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Frisca

texts.en:
Frisca E. is from the town of Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Frisca is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Frisca owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Frisca is just starting this business.

In 2006, Frisca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Frisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. Frisca is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Frisca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 46 years old. She is married and has three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Florence works hard to support her husband and to provide for their family. She is a trader. She trades in printed textiles. Florence buys the textile goods from nearby towns and she sells in a shop by the roadside in her community. She also treks to sell.

Florence has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Mr. Victoriano E. is from the town of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 67 years old. He is married and blessed with 5 adult children. He's a pensioner, having a monthly pension of 5,700 as his source of income. In 2009, he joined PMPC to access the programs and services of this Coop. Currently,he's applying for his 1st loan in the amount of 40,000 which will be used for house renovation.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a fifty nine year old widow with three children, all in school. Mary and her children live in a rented apartment in Axim, which is predominantly a fishing area along the coastal area in the western region in Ghana.

Mary trades in bags of flour, sugar, rice and other food items, which she buys from nearby towns and supplies to bakers and other food vendors in her community. Mary has been in business for over ten years and would like a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to resell

loans.name: Blanca Irene

texts.es:
Blanca es soltera, tiene 30 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica al servicio de peluquería y maquillaje. Aprendió esta profesión en un instituto de la ciudad de Lambayeque y actualmente se vale de sus conocimientos para ganarse la vida y ayudar a sus padres. 

Blanca tiene un ambiente preparado en una parte de su casa donde planea hacer funcionar su peluquería y actualmente cuenta con la mayoría de utilería para realizar esta actividad. Su negocio es muy frecuentado por clientes de la zona que acuden a ella gracias a la calidad de su trabajo y a los precios cómodos que ofrece. 

Ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de algunos accesorios e insumos que le faltan (shampoo y tintes) así como en la mejora del ambiente destinado para su negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es perfeccionar poco a poco sus técnicas y hacer crecer su negocio. Ella es una mujer bastante humilde en su trato pero que tiene bastante voluntad para trabajar y cooperar con sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Blanca is single, 30, and lives in her parents' house in the Muy Finca area in the district of Mochumí, situated 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the past two years, she has been working in hairdressing and make-up services. She learnt this profession at an institute in the city of Lambayeque and currently uses her knowledge to earn a living and help her parents. Blanca has a room prepared in a part of her house where she plans to run her hairdressers and currently she counts on the majority of her equipment to undertake this activity. Her business is very popular among clients in the area who turn to her, thanks to the quality of her work and the reasonable prices she offers. She is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time of 600 new soles which she plans to invest in buying various accessories and supplies that she lacks (shampoo and dyes), and thereby improve the room intended for her business. Blanca's greatest desire is to perfect her techniques bit by bit and to grow her business. She is a humble woman but is keen to work and to cooperate with her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy accessories and supplies to establish her hairdressers.

loans.name: Marivic's Group

texts.en:
Marivic A. is from the village of Santiago. She is 35 years old. Marivic is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marivic is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business planting & harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Suntali

texts.en: Mrs. Suntali K. (see this note on Nepali names) is a grocery shopkeeper in the village of Bhatkepati. She sells a variety of grocery items in her shop and uses her earnings to fulfill the daily needs of her family and to support her children’s education. Several years ago, Mrs. Suntali K.’s husband died and therefore she is solely responsible for raising her four children. Her two sons and two daughters are studying in higher secondary school. All of her children also help her with the shop. Mrs. Suntali K. is requesting an Rs 20,000 loan to buy grocery items such as rice and maize for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Mrs. Pak Uk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Pak U. is a village bank president who has been selected by members of the TrapE. Angk village in the Takeo province. The village bank loan consists of twelve people who will use their loans for different purposes.

Mrs. Pak U. is 39 years old, and she owns a general store in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Phally Leng, is a farmer who owns two hectares of land where he cultivates rice to support his family. Unfortunately, the rice field has infertile soil, and they do not have enough money to improve it. Thus, in order to improve the condition of the family's standard of living, Mrs. Pak U. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer for the field. The remaining part of the loan will be used to buy groceries that she will resell. She is a mother of four children, one of whom helps the parents sell the groceries. Two of her children are enrolled in the local public school, and the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Denis Fernando M

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega y es casado padre de 02 hijos los cuales mantiene con la actividad agrícola el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos y alquiler de tierras para la siembra del primer siclo
texts.en:
This client is from the city of Chinandega; he's married and the father of two children, whom he supports through farming. He will use the funds to buy supplies and to lease farmland for the first planting cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease farmland.

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal  vive, en la zona Villa Exaltación, de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su esposa y su sobrina, puesto que sus hijos son mayores de edad y por lo tanto formaron sus propias familias y se fueron a vivir en otras zonas.

Es jubilado rentista de un centro minero.


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción (cemento, arena, ladrillo) para continuar con la construcción de su vivienda.
 
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Cristóbal lives in El Alto's Villa Exaltación neighborhood with his wife and niece; his children are all adults and have their own families living in other parts of the city. He is a retired miner. He will use the funds to buy building materials and supplies (cement, sand, bricks) to continue building his house. This is his first loan with Impro; the evaluation done indicates that he qualifies for loan approval.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Rechael

texts.en: Rechael is a hardworking tailor. At 30 years of age, she is married and has three children. She was previously selling vehicle spare parts.  Rechael also earns a living by selling second-hand clothes. She took up tailoring after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya and she mainly makes table cloths for sale. She wants to buy two sewing machines and fabric. So, she has requested a loan of KES 50,000 from Faulu Kenya. She hopes to own her own company in the future so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines and fabric.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
El señor Cristian vive en casa alquilada con su mama en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz; trabaja como auxiliar contable en una consultora, con este ingresos el mantiene a su mama.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar el capital de la tienda de abarrotes de su mama y de esta manera ayudar a que ella pueda generar su propios ingresos.

Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de Impro;  por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Cristian lives in a rented house with his mother in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone of the city of La Paz. He works as an accounting assistant in a consultancy. With his income he maintains his mother. The loan he solicits is intended to increase the capital of his mother's grocery store and, in this way, help her to generate her own income. This is the first time he has solicited a loan through Impro. His good social character makes him deserving of a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: SUPPLYING MORE PRODUCTS FOR HIS MOTHER'S GROCERY STORE

loans.name: Violina

texts.en:
Violina Pesi S. is 42 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Violina Pesi has 3 years of experience in this business.  Violina Pesi needs a loan of WST $1700 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

Violina Pesi joined SPBD.This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Violina Pesi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Sarinke Ole

texts.en:
Sarinke Ole N. is 30 years old, married to Nanyikae N., and the father of four children. For the last ten years, he has farmed his own piece of land.
Sarinke learned about Kiva partner, KADET, from marketing awareness carried out by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan. He is planning to spend his 50,000 KES on maize farming; maize is doing very well in the area due to fertile land and adequate rainfall. With the profits he hopes to make from the loan, he plans to rent land for farming to increase his maize production. He also hopes to buy some livestock and start livestock farming.
Sarinke's future dream is that he will be able to practise large-scale maize farming. He is a hardworking man who is determined to achieve his goals.

loans.use: To spend on maize farming

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Petty trading like the sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and eventually becomes supermarket. Helena is one of such entrepreneurs who have been trading in groceries like biscuits, bottled water, candies, can foods, rice, cooking oil, toiletries, etc., for the past three years. She sells in a metal store near her community market, hoping that, one day, she will be able to grow her business into a supermarket. She is excited to be taking out the loan which she plans to invest in purchasing groceries in bulk to serve her customers. She anticipates increasing her profit level and also expanding her market.

Apart from being a vibrant entrepreneur, Helena is also married and she is the mother of three children from age 3-11 years. She describes herself as an industrious woman who is able to combine household demands with business demands.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: Madame Marieme F. est une femme de 42 ans qui habite à Bambilor. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse depuis juillet 2009. Elle a déjà  bénéficié d’un prêt antérieur. Elle est mariée et s’active dans l’élevage de poussins depuis  plus d’un an. Avec le soutien de son mari qui travaille dans une ferme avicole  elle a eu l’idée  d’investir dans le secteur de l’aviculture. La réalisation de bénéfices  lui permet de  satisfaire  ses quelques besoins personnels tels que l’achat de vêtements, de  bijoux, etc. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs destine a l’achat d’une bande de 150 poussins pour renforcer son activité. Si ses gains le lui permettent madame F. pourrait même aller jusqu'à soutenir son mari a prendre en charge ses factures d’électricité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marieme F. is a 42-year old woman living in Bambilor. She has been a member of the mutual fund since July 2009. She already obtained a loan in the past. She is married, and her line of business is raising poultry, something that she has been doing for over a year. With the support of her husband, who works on a poultry farm, she decided to go into aviculture. The resulting income allows her to meet some personal expenses such as purchasing clothing, jewelry and so on. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 in order to purchase a flock of 150 chickens in order to bolster her enterprise. If her income allows it, Mrs. F. would like to help her husband with the electricity bills.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Sra. Marta   tiene  46  años, está casado con el Sr.Justo Rolon ,ellos tienen tres hijos mayores .
Marta  se dedica a la confección de ropas   en su domicilio ,ella heredo esta profesión de su madre, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación logro montar  su propio  taller hace 10 años  y mantener su clientela formada; mientras que  el Sr. Justo  trabaja como chófer de ómnibus .
El crédito será de gran  ayuda para la compra de telas en cantidad por los pedidos que tiene  en esta temporada . 
 Ellos en el futuro desean construir un salón y exhibir sus mercaderías .
texts.en:
46-year old Sra. Marta is married to Sr. Justo Rolon and they have three adult children. Marta earns her living by making clothes in her home, a job she learned from her mother. Through hard work and dedication she managed to obtain her own workshop ten years ago and has a regular clientele. Her husband works as a a bus driver. The loan will be a great help to her for the purchase of a quantity of material for the orders that she currently has. In the future she and her mother want to build a store in which to display their products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy material, thread, buttons etc.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
N. Saida is 22 years old. She has run her own business for five years, despite her young age. At the local market, she sells clothing for children.

Saida is very successful in her business. The business is the main source of income for her family.

IMON has provided Saida with a loan in the past. She has built a positive credit history without any violations. Today, she requests $1,500 USD.

This courageous lady plans to use the loan to increase the range of goods she sells and to improve the living of her family. Saida thanks everyone for trusting and supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods sell

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena C. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 60 years old. Magdalena is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Magdalena owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling  vegetables in the local community. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 28,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Magdalena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: La Union Del Ave Fenix Group

texts.es:
La unión del Ave Fénix es un grupo conformado por trece mujeres trabajadoras que decidieron llamarse así por que están seguras que la unión hace la fuerza. Ellas radican en San Miguel Xico, Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, Estado de México. Los integrantes de este grupo son: Ma Gabriela Ramírez (Venta de Barbacoa), Fidelia C. (Venta por Catalogo), Angélica R. (Venta de Cerámica), Andrea Dávila (Venta de Bisutería), Josefina E. (Venta de Antojitos), Esperanza Valentín (Venta de Productos Nutricionales), Carmen Martínez (Taller de Costura), Marisol García (Venta de Joyería), Beatriz Hernández (Venta de Pollo), Graciela R. (Venta de Abarrotes), Ana Karen Dávalos (Bisutería), María Teresa C. (Taquería) y Epifanía O. (Tienda de Ropa). 

Marisol de 40 años de edad, tiene una hija que estudia la secundaria, Marisol enviudo hace diez años, desde entonces ha tenido que trabajar el doble para sustentar a su familia ya que también su madre depende de ella. Marisol se dedica a la venta de joyería desde hace doce años y ha seguido con esta actividad porque es muy comercial, todos los días después de terminar con sus labores del hogar sale a ofrecer su mercancía en diferentes lugares como casas, tiendas, ya que para ella el tiempo vale oro y no desaprovecha cualquier oportunidad que se le presenta. Marisol surte una vez por semana ya que así puede tener variedad de aretes, pulseras y cadenas y mantener a su clientela. Sus meses de mayor venta son los días festivos y el mes de diciembre y por su puesto la mayoría de clientela son mujeres. Los planes de Marisol es poner una tienda de regalos para tener un mayor ingreso para su familia y poder darles lo necesario. El crédito lo invirtió para surtir un poco más. 

Ellas se sienten muy contentas por el apoyo que les brinda Kiva a través de Fundación Realidad y así cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
The "Unión de Ave Fénix" group is formed by thirteen hard-working ladies who decided on the name as union makes strength. They live in San Miguel Xico, Valle de Chalco Solidaridad, Estado de Mexico. The members of the group are: Ma. Gabriela Ramírez (barbecued meat sale), Fidelia C. (sale from catalog), Angélica R. (ceramics sale), Andrea Dávila (costume jewellery sale), Josefina E. (Mexican snacks sale), Esperanza Valentín (nutrition products sale), Carmen Martínez (dressmaking), Marisol García (jewellery sale), Beatriz Hernández (chicken sale), Graciela R. (groceries), Ana Karen Dávalos (custome jewellery), María Teresa C. (tacos), and Epifanía Olmeda (Clothing store).

Marisol is 40 years old, she has a daughter in middle school. Marisol became a widow ten years ago and since then she has worked double in order to maintain her family as her mother also depends on her. Marisol has sold jewellery for twelve years and is continuing with this activity as it is very profitable. Every day when she has finished her chores she goes out to offer her merchandise at different places such as homes and stores. As time is worth gold to her she takes advantage of every opportunity given to her. Marisol stocks up once a week in order to have a variety of earrings, bracelets, and chains to keep her customers satisfied. She sells the most on holidays and during the month of December and obviously most of her customers are ladies. Marisol plans to set up a gift shop to obtain more profit for her family and be able to meet their needs. The loan will be spent on stocking up.

They are very pleased with the support offered by Kiva through Fundación Realidad that enables them to reach their goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for Mexican snacks, catalogs, bracelets,chains and rings.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Sulficia

texts.en:
Sulficia F. is a widow  who lives in Punta Talaban, Barangay Talaban, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  fishing and the buying and selling of fish. Sulficia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sulficia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 23rd cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for her fishing business, will help her to continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and do home repairs.  Sulficia F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing equipment.

loans.name: Pancha Laxmi

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Pancha Laxmi S.. She is married and has 4 children, aged 25, 22, 21 and 19. In 2005, she established her incense-making business. She supports her family by working7 hours a day, 7 days a week. She wants to use this loan from Patan BPW to increase inventory for incense-making. In the future, Pancha Laxmi plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy material for manufacturing incense

loans.name: Lê's Group

texts.en:
H. Lê V. (20213010070) is a 34-year-old male living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a five-member group loA. offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives A. individual loA., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is A. Ninh nhóm 13 (Nhóm 13).


H. is married and has one infant-aged child.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business providing general clothing services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loA. of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loA. was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  He is now requesting a new loA. of 6,944,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loA. will be the second loA. taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trần Thị H. (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loA. to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Chu Thị H. (0) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loA. to support her business running a food stall.


3.  Ngô Thị T. A. (0) is a 37-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loA. to support her business operating a tailoring business.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 6,944,000 VND loA. to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loA. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Lê V. (20213010070) là 34 tuổi nam.  Anh ấy sống ở thành phố Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là A. Ninh nhóm 13 (Nhóm 13).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  điều kiện và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Anh ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.944.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trần Thị H. (0) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Chu Thị H. (0) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


3.  Ngô Thị T. A. (0) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh may mặc.


4.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Anweri's Group

texts.en:
Anweri is a resident of Arifwala, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and known for its dairy industry. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house. She is married to G. M. and has no children.
 
She is a very talented lady who owns and operates her embroidery business at home. Earlier, she did this work to spend her time but later on she took it as a profession and now works on orders which she receives from different shops and from neighboring areas. She enjoys doing this work and earns well from it. Her earnings allow her to share the financial burden with her husband who operates a ready-made garment-selling business. 

Her husband has been dealing with his garment business for the last ten years. He has obtained a good reputation among his clients and serves them with quality clothes. He operates his shop in the market and deals with a good clientele base. 
 
Anweri has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy ready-made garments in bulk quantities for his business. The winter season has come and he will buy some winter clothes as well to provide a different variety to his customers. Anweri is hopeful that this investment will put more money in her husband’s pocket and his business will become more profitable for him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has responsibly paid her installments and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments for reselling

loans.name: Bester

texts.en: Bester N.  is currently in the business of selling coffee, cow peas, fish, beans, groundnuts etc  and is requesting a loan to stock more supplies of goods to sell.  Bester is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a head teacher. She has 11 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more supplies of  goods to sell

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet M., 50, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. 

M. is a housewife. Her daughter is employed at a hotel as a housekeeper, earning an income of about USD 7 per day. M. has to spend USD 30 on food, USD 10 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month. M. is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use.  

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Азизов Али проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 65 лет. Женат. Имеет 7 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Али имеет среднее образование. Занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Он хочет закупить бычков для откормки и перепродажи.
texts.en: Ali A. lives in Yavan.  He is 65 years old, married, and has seven children.  His wife is a housewife. Ali has a high school education.  He works in animal husbandry.  He raises cattle at home, fattening and selling them.  He is taking out a loan to buy cattle.  He wants to buy calves for fattening and reselling.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en:
Fathiya I. is a housewife and mother of two daughters from Kufor Raie Village in Jenin district. Kufor Raie is famous for its almonds trees. Fathiya's son bought a car three years ago and was able to pay much of its price from his savings, but he still needs $3,000 to pay the full amount, which Fathiya took from FATEN to help her son own the car.

Fathiya's son will be able to make a better income now as he won't have to share the money he earns with the previous owner of the car.

Fathiya's husband appears in the picture here because she is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture posted.

loans.use: To pay the last payment of a taxi car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista N. lives in the Namungoona neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Teopista has a business selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Teopista sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. Teopista has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling bananas. The main business challenges for Teopista include rainy season, transportation and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling as a wholesale-only agent and also educating her children up to university. Teopista lives in a home that she owns. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Eskarlet De La Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Eskarlet De La Concepción posee un negocio que es la venta de ropa de manera ambulante. Ella tiene 27 años de edad madre de 2 hijos que estudian gracias a su esfuerzo y el de su esposo el cual trabaja como taxista. Doña Eskarlet sale a vender todos los días por lo que tenía que buscar como llevar el alimento diario a su hogar. Ella recorro distancias muy largas pero esto no la desanima para salir adelante pues siempre le ha gustado su actividad económica. Ella solicita este financiamiento para el mejoramiento del negocio ya que se aproxima la semana Santa y tiene muchos pedidos. Sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Eskarlet De La Concepción's business is selling clothes in an ambulatory manner. She is 27 years old and the mother of two children who are in school thanks to the efforts of her and her husband, a taxi driver. Ms. Eskarlet goes out selling every day because she needs a way to provide for her household's daily needs. She covers great distances but, because she has always enjoyed her work, this does not discourage her from pushing forward.

She is requesting this loan to improve her business, as Semana Santa [Holy Week] is approaching and she has many orders. She dreams of improving her living conditions.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua A. is married with six children and has completed her junior high school education. For the last two decades, Ekua has been selling Fante Kenkey (a staple in Ghanaian diet, made of fermented maize dough – shown in the picture) at Efutu Mampong in Cape Coast. 
Her income pays for school fees and utility bills. She plans to use her loan to expand her kenkey business, and to plough profits back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: She plans to use her loan to expand her kenkey business,

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: K. is currently in a business of selling items like sugar. She is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has no children. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock more items like sugar to sell.

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en: S. Kahramon is a very responsible and optimistic person. He has three children and a wife who he has to support. His father is not working - only S. works in the family and is responsible for feeding them. Kahramon began his working life in the catering field. His mother baked pies at home and he sold them in order to feed his family. Saving money, he began his business and got married. He has been in the clothing sales business for six years. Kahramon is currently faced with many problems because as his children grow up, accordingly their expenses are growing too. He would like to get a loan of 11,000 Somoni to buy a place for his business. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities, along with the services provided by IMON International will help him improve the business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th century BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007 IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy a business premises

loans.name: Fondo

texts.en:
Fondo is a married man with three children, one who attends school while two are still too young for school. He lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past three years, he has operated a hawking business, and he moves from door to door selling clothes to his neighbours.

With the Kshs 20,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. Fondo dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Duo Esperanzas De San Juan Group

texts.es:
DUO ESPERANZA DE SAN JUAN
Para las dos integrantes de este dúo eligieron para ellas el nombre  de Esperanza en San Juan,  porque siempre han tenido la confianza y esperanza  en Dios y el las ha ayudado en su familias y negocios, la  señora Mónica  C., quien tiene una venta de mini ferretería y variedades, en el mercado  local, su negocio surge ya que su esposo es electromecánico, quien se encarga de recolectar piezas de todo lo referido a su trabajo a un buen precio  para que ella pueda venderla.ella solicita el credito para la compra de verduras de toda clase como ejotes,sanaorias,repollo etc.
Doña Judith S.,  quien desde los 6 años de edad acompañaba a su mama en la venta de verduras en el mercado de la Terminal y luego de casada ella tomo la iniciativa de tener su negocio propio ya teniendo el conocimiento de esta actividad, ella viaja diariamente, a vender verdura ya peladas y cortadas para todo tipo de comida para sus clientes.
Ambas desean darles una buena preparación a sus hijos ya que ambas no  terminaron el nivel primario, y no quieren lo mismo para sus hijos, es por eso que siguen luchando para alcanzar sus sueños y metas familiares y personales.
texts.en:
"DUO ESPERANZA DE SAN JUAN" Group

The two members of this group chose the name "Esperanza de San Juan" because they have always had trust and hope in God, who has helped their families.  Mrs. Mónica C. has a mini-hardware and variety store in the local market.  Her business stems from her husbands profession as an electro-mechanic.  He finds well-priced items related to his work for her to sell.  She will use the loan to buy all kinds of vegetables such as string-beans, carrots, cabbage, etc.

Doña Judith S. helped her mother for six years selling vegetables in the Terminal market.  After she married she decided to set up her own business because she had experience.  She travels daily to sell peeled and pre-cut vegetables which are ready for cooking.

Both women want to give their children a good education since they, themselves, were unable to finish primary school.  They continue to work hard to realize their family and personal dreams and goals.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Ikhtiyar

texts.ru: Ikhtiyar G. 53 qoda. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey 2 iz kotorix uje okonchili shkolu. Ikhtiyar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On uje 11 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Skotovodstvu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo dedushki kotoriy toje zanimalsya etim. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupi korovi dlya uluchsheniya svoyeqo biznessa a takje dlya uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta, tak kak iz moloka on delayet sir i prodayet etoot sir v magazini.
texts.en: Ikhtiyar G. is 53 years old.  He is married and has three children who have finished school.  Ikhtiyar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his loving family.  He has been a herdsman for eleven years already.  He started tending cattle with his grandfather who worked doing that.  Now he needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to improve his business and increase milk production.  He makes cheese from this milk and sells it in stores.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Babamurod

texts.en:
Babamurod is a 61-year-old cattleman who is married with six children. Babamurod has been in this business for 4 years. He purchases the cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the cattle-shed and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. He sells his cattle in the market of Yavan, Sultonobod and in the market of Rudaki region. Now, Babamulod would like to expand his business and purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he has applied for 5000 Somoni and with your help he hopes to reach his goal. 
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel, 35 years of age, is married, and blessed with three children. He has been growing corn for almost 15 years. At the last cropping, he earned 7,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides for his corn farm. He hopes to continue to take loans and achieve his dreams for his children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides

loans.name: Kathlen Marvely

texts.es:
Kathlen, es comerciante D. ropa, vive con su esposo y dos hijos D. 15 y 17 años D. edad, ella trabaja todos los días D. la semana, vendiendo prendas D. vestir por toda la zona donD. pueD. accesar fácilmente cerca D. su vivienda, tiene 10 años D. estar dedicada al comercio D. ropa.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar prendas, ropa interior, blusas, faldas, camisetas, ya que se le agotan y debe estar en constante inversión, pues llegan nuevos estilos D. los cuales debe mantener a disposición para los clientes.
El propósito D. ella es mantener el negocio, aumentar su rentabilidad y D. esta manera contribuir a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Kathlen's business is selling clothes.  She lives with her husband and her two children who are 15 and 17.  She works every day of the week, selling clothes all around that area near her home which she is able to easily access.  She has been selling clothes for ten years.

Kathlen is requesting a loan to buy clothes: underwear, blouses, skirts and t-shirts, since she has run out of stock and needs to constantly invest in the business as new styles keep arriving and she must ensure she has them available for her customers.

Kathlen's goal is to keep her business running, increase her profitability and, in this way, contribute towards improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses, skirts and t-shirts

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is a married woman from the town of Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur.  She has 4 children. 

She is a farmer and has been tilling their rice farm for 20 years.  Like any other mother, she would like to give her children a brighter future. She works hard to sustain her family.  This loan will help her buy the farm supplies she needs, like fertilizer and rice seeds.

In future, Josie hopes to see her children succeed.

loans.use: buy farm supplies like fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Wilgean

texts.en:
Wilgean is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Wilgean has a retail shop that sells ready-to-wear clothes (RTW), like t-shirts & blouses. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional ready-to-wear clothes to sell.  Wilgean is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Wilgean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear (RTW) clothes to sell

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is a 45 year old Rwandan entrepreneur. He has 7 children between the ages of 6 months and 21 years. 3 are in school, 2 have finished school, and 2 have yet to start. His wife is a businesswoman as well.

For the past 5 years, Etienne has been running a store selling bicycle and motorcycle spare parts. This business has enabled him to pay the school fees for his many children. He will use this loan to purchase more spare parts that will sustain his business. With future profits, he plans to begin building a house and dreams of opening a wholesale spare parts shop.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice sells wakye (rice and beans cooked together) at Elmina. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a mason. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy beans and rice to cook wakye for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a restaurant.

Wakye is a traditional rice dish in Ghana. To prepare wakye, she gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish color. Then, she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender to eat. Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari, salad with pepper sauce, tomatoes sauce, fish, or meat.

loans.use: to buy beans and rice to cook wakye for resale.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La Sra. María es casada, tiene dos hijas en edad escolar; ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, bollos y bizcochos; ya lleva en este negocio más de 10 años, eligió este trabajo por sus tías ya que también se dedicaban a este negocio; gana aproximadamente  S/300 nuevos soles semanal; el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda (compra de puertas y ventanas) ya que estas se encuentra deterioradas por el tiempo; su principal desafío que enfrenta es el frio y las enfermedades virales que en este tiempo da. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio y poner una panadería grande, ella está muy atardecida por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Maria is married, has two school-age daughters. She earns her living making and selling bread, buns, and biscuits. She has had this business for more than 10 years, and she chose this work because of her aunts who also work in this business. She earns about 300 nuevo soles per week. 

She will invest the loan granted to her into improving her home, which has deteriorated over time. The main challenge she faces is the cold and the viral diseases this season brings. Her dream is to see her business grow and install a large oven. She is very grateful for the awarded loan.

loans.use: to purchase doors and windows to improve her home

loans.name: Fatima Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Fatima bibi is a caring lady who stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She performs her work very efficiently. She takes care of everyone's needs and makes the utmost effort to fulfill them. 

Her husband runs a tea stall in the market where he serves tea of different flavors, such as green tea, milky, and creamy tea. He has a good customer base and serves them with good and tasty tea. He also serves them with good quality biscuits and nimko (a snack mix) which enriches the taste of his tea. 

Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband's tea stall. With the loan, he will buy tea, sugar, and milk in bulk to offer better services to his clients and earn a good income. 

Fatima is hopeful that her husband's business will be established further after investing the loan into it.

loans.use: To buy tea, sugar and milk for a tea stall business

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 37 лет, разведена, и воспитывает двух детей – годовалого сына Нурэл и дочь Перизат, которая учится в 1 классе. Источником дохода семьи является животноводство, начатое Эльмирой со стартовым капиталом в сумме 6,000 сом (KGS) и приносящее на сегодняшний день около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Эльмира обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом для покупки бычков для откорма. Доходы от кредита она планирует использовать для заготовки корма и сена на зиму.
texts.en: Elmira is 37 years old, divorced and is raising two children - one-year-old son Nurel and daughter Perizat, who is in first grade.  Animal husbandry, which Elmira began with the starting capital of 6,000 som (KGS) and brings about 12,000 som (KGS) per month today from sales of milk and meat products, is the family's source of income.  In order to further develop her business, Elmira requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company for the purchase of bulls for fattening up.  She plans to use the income from the loan to prepare livestock feed and hay for the winter.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Eshrat's Group

texts.en:
Eshrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a painter by profession. He paints walls, buildings and houses on order. He makes contracts with the owners and earns on daily basis while the contract is valid. 

With this loan, Eshrat's husband will buy paint brushes and different paint boxes to provide better quality paint services to his clients and increase his profits. He is well-experienced in his business and Eshrat hopes that this investment will be a productive one for his business and helps him improve the living standard of the family. 

Eshrat is the mother of 4 children. All of them are very young and haven’t started their education yet. She is a regular loan user of Asasah's and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she had established good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Eshrat.

loans.use: To buy brushes and paint for painting business

loans.name: Yolanda Viviana

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 27 años, tiene 2 hijos y vive con su cónyugue en Ibarra. Yolanda se describe como una persona responsable y trabajadora.

Trabaja sola en la confección de sacos de lana. Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a Fodemi, el crédito va a invertir en la compra de Lana para la confección de sus sacos, lo cual aumentará su producción y se incrementarán sus ventas e ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida de ella y de los suyos.

Su sueño es poder construir su casa y poder emplear a personas que mas lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 27 years old, has two children, and lives with her spouse in Ibarra.  She describes herself as a hard-working and responsible person.

She works alone making wool bags.  This is the first time she is requesting a loan from FODEMI.  She's going to buy wool to make her bags, which will increase her production as well as her sales and earnings, improving her family's quality of life.

Her dream is to be able to build her house and employ people who need to work.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
Rodolfo is in his fifties. He is a farmer in the Philippines, planting two hectares of rice. According to him, his business has been a big help for him and to his family. His income from the business provides their food every day. 

Rodolfo has been 25 years in the business. His income depends on the climate, but he declares that most of his income comes from his crops, ranging from P40,000 to P60,000 per crop. Rodolfo has no other source of income that would help him in providing his needs in farming. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to P42,000 to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and herbicides for plant care.

Rodolfo wishes to gain higher income from the business and will have his own savings. As he said, he is getting older. He wants to have savings for the preparation for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds to grow and fertilizers and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Mize

texts.en:
Mize is a divorced woman with 4 children who are all working. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for herself.

Mize has operated a coconut selling business for the past 13 years. In addition she also sells fruit. Her potential clients are her neighbors and friends. She faces a major challenge of seasonality; where there is low demand in some months of the year. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase 3 sacks of coconuts and some fruit for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of their customer care.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sacks of coconuts and some fruit for resale.

loans.name: Surdari

texts.es: Surdari, tiene la edad  de  26 años de edad, está en unión libre y vive actualmente con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como abonos, plaguicidas y foliares para la asistencia del cafetal y darle una ayuda extra para obtener de el en esta proxima cosecha los mejores rendimientos de produccion. Ella actualmente cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotación de este cultivo ya sembrado y en producción. Ella quiere con el dinero asistir de la mejor forma su cafetal para estas próximas cosechas sean mayores y así obtener el mejor rendimiento de producción con respecto al año anterior. Ella quiere generar el máximo de ganancias para su bienestar familiar y así cada día poder seguir adelante con los gastos necesarios de su familia. Ella piensa en el futuro de su familia por lo cual espera tener el mayor resultado de esta inversión. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Surdari is 26 years old, has a partner, and lives with him and their 3 children, who are her top priority.  With this loan she plans to buy supplies to assist with her coffee plantation, such as manure, pesticides and plant fertilizer to help with coffee cultivation and give her extra help for this upcoming harvest so as to have the best crop possible.  She currently has the right kind of land to grow this crop, which has already been planted and is in production.  She wants to use the money to help her coffee plantation as much as possible so that these next harvests will be bigger, thus surpassing last year's production.  She wants to generate the maximum possible income for the well-being of her family and thereby be able to cover her family's essential expenses on a daily basis.
