She thinks about her family's future, for which she hopes to see the best possible results from this investment.  This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She had never taken out other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her this loan with greater ease and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy supplies for coffee cultivation.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Elia

texts.es:
Elia 
Puntarenas
300000
	Elia tiene una panadería en la zona de Puntarenas, a pesar de lo cercano de la ciudad ella vive en un lugar de bastante pobreza y donde el comercio existente  es poco, provee a los habitantes del lugar la venta de pan fresco para su desayuno diario. La Panadería Elia tiene más de 10 años de existir, es un negocio familiar, ella trabaja con su esposo e hijos. El objetivo de este crédito es invertir en la reparación de horno para incrementar así la producción de su pan.
	Su día inicia a las 4 de la mañana cuando se empieza a hornear el pan que se prepara la noche anterior, la panadería empieza a vender a partir de la 5:30 am por lo que la labor empieza desde tempranas horas de la mañana, sus hijos son mayores de edad por lo que no tiene que ir a la escuela, más bien entre todos apoyan la labor de esta microempresa, ya que también se distribuye el producto en pulperías de la zona, mejorando así los ingresos de la actividad y expandiendo sus operaciones para dar a conocer su producto.
	Entre sus metas esta mejorar su equipo, modernizándolo para mejorar la calidad del mismo y la eficiencia en su producción. Abrir sucursales y mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Ella emigró de Nicaragua en los años 80, y se estableció aquí con sus hijos, a los que les dio educación y les enseño un oficio, que ahora ellos practican, una  de sus hijas tiene otra panadería. 
	Su negocio ha caminado muy bien, ya tiene cerca de 10 años de trabajar en este, por lo que el principal problema  es la falta de dinero para invertir en el mismo, pero con la oportunidad brindada por Fundación Mujer por medio de KIVA, con este préstamo se va a mejorar mucho la capacidad del negocio.
texts.en:
Elia has a bakery in Puntarenas. Although it is close to the city, the area where she lives is very poor. The little commercial activity that exists there is small scale. Elia provides the local residents with fresh bread each day. Her bakery, Panadería Elia, has been around for more than 10 years, nad is a family business where she works with her husband and children. The purpose of the loan is to invest in getting an oven repaired to increase the quantity of bread they make. 

Her day begins at 4am when she starts baking the bread she has prepared the night before. The bakery opens for business at 5.30am for people who have to to work early in the morning. Their children are grown up and don't have to go to school, so they can help by working in the bakery and by distributing the produce to local grocery stores, which increases the income to the business and expands the operation to get their products known. 

Among their goals are to improve the bakery's equipment, modernising it to improve the quality and effiicency of production. They would like to open other branches of the business and to improve the family's standard of living. Elia emigrated from Nicaragua in the 1980s, and established herself here with her children, whom she has given both an education and a trade for them to follow. One of her daughters now runs a bakery of her own.

Her business has progressed well in the past 10 years. The main problem has been the lack of money to invest back into the business, but with the opportunity offered through Fundación Mujer and KIVA, this loan means she can greatly increase the capacity of her business.

loans.use: To repair an oven for bread-making.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 28 and a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Dorris

texts.en: Dorris is 38 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has four children between the ages of 10 and 21. All of them are attending school: two with their aunt and two living at home. Dorris has been making soap for the past twenty years. She says her main challenge is the cost for palm oil that she uses to make soap. She started this business with money that she saved. She learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is the fast profits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (caustic, palm oil, and wood) for her business. In the future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (caustic, palm oil, and wood) for making soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to set up a heating machine in his house.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha sells cloth, sponges, towels and cosmetics in Asebu Ekroful. Agatha completed form 4. She is single and has three children. 

Agatha has been selling the above for 12 years now. She is responsible for feeding and clothing her children. Her loan will be used to purchase cloth, sponges, towels and cosmetics for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount up a shop to contain her goods.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, sponges, towels and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Sabougnouman I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN I sont toutes des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Manakoro, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, ADJA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 125.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "SABOUGNOUMAN I" are married women averaging 46 years of age and six children each. The women live for the most part in polygamous families in Manakoro, a village in Commune de Guegneka, in Dioïla Prefecture. They are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of further organizing their work at the start of the rainy season. The crops grown are millet and peanuts. They are on their seventh collaboration with the institution.

With this new loan, ADJA, who is sitting second from the left in the photo, intends to buy supplies and sundry equipment and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining about 1.5 hectares of millet and peanuts. After the harvest, the produce is sold in Fana City to a customer base composed of men and women. 

ANA plans on making an average profit of about 125,000 francs CFA per planting season. This profit will enable her to repay her loan and also to help out her husband in meeting day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, weeding, and sundry farm equipment

loans.name: Zaw

texts.en:
Zaw (second from left in photo), lives in Thae Kone Gyi Village and he is married with three children. He has been breeding and raising ducks for 25 years. Zaw’s family helps him look after ducks. This loan will help Zaw’s family, and his group members, expand their livestock business by purchasing high quality duck feed. In addition to duck feed, Zaw’s 27 fellow group members will use the loan to purchase more ducks and duck vaccinations.
The higher production rates resulting from these investments will help this group boost income so that they can reinvest in their businesses. With Kiva’s loan, the group is excited to build and grow financially sustainable businesses.
Pictured above are group leaders from Thae Kone Gyi Village Group 1: Zaw, Aung, Khine, San and Thida. This village is located Delta Region side by Ayeyarwaddy River. Besides raising stock for businesses, villagers do fishing, tailoring and agricultural productions.

loans.use: to purchase more ducks and duck vaccinations

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is applying for her second loan through Mifex and Kiva. Her first loan had a much bigger impact than she ever imagined. During the loan period her husband was killed in a robbery attempt. The extra capital she had invested in her business allowed her to support her family during the hard time after her husband’s death. She is now applying for a second loan in order to continue investing in her business.

She has a small store where she sells many different food items that are popular in Ecuador. She also has started selling clothes door-to-door during the day. While she is out selling her 2 kids and her mother help run the store. Despite the death of the Rosa’s husband, the family remains close and they are optimistic about the future.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Continue investing in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and animal feed

loans.name: Rufet

texts.en: I. Rufet is married and has 3 children. He is 31 and is a dislocated person (IDP) from Nagorniy Karabakh. In 2001 he borrowed  US$ 1200  to buy 1 cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Prom

texts.en: Mrs. Prom M. is 35 years old and lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia with her husband and their 3 children.  She works selling bananas and raising pigs, and earns about $3/day.  Her husband earns $2.5/day working as a horse-cart driver.  This loan will be used to purchase pigs to raise and also bananas for her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and bananas

loans.name: Ni Ketut Tantri

texts.id:
Mrs Ni Ketut Tantri is a very able and diligent housewife and she has proved she can aid the household economy by opening a pig breeding and livestock business three years ago. Ketut Tantri's husband is only a farmer who does not have enough income, because the land he works is not large. From this marriage Ketut Tantri has two children but they are already married and live apart from Ketut Tantri. With starting capital of Rp. 1,600,000, Ketut Tantri bought two sows. One of them now has twelve children. Two months after birth those piglets can be sold, and usually one piglet sells for Rp 200,000, but the plan is for five of these to be fattened up, leaving seven to be sold. The income from the sale will be Rp.1,400,000 (@200,000 x &), of which Rp. 500,000 will be profit, which Ketut Tantri will use to improve her house although it is still very basic (semi-permanent). Of the loan received from Dinari the plan is to use Rp.1,300,000 to buy feed because Ketut Tantri is now expanding her business to raise and fatten-up five piglets, in addition to the two sows, with the goal of increasing the profits.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Ibu Ni Ketut Tantri seorang ibu rumah tangga yang sangat ulet dan tekun terbukti untuk membantu perekonomian rumah tangganya Ketut Tantri menjalankan usaha memelihara ternak babi sejak 3 tahun yang lalu. Suami Ketut Tantri hanya sebagai seorang petani yang tidak mempunyai penghasilan cukup,karena ladang yang dikerjakannyapun tidak banyak,dari pernikahannya ini Ketut Tantri mempuyai 2 orang anak namun keduanya kini sudah menikah dan tinggal terpisah dengan Ketut Tantri.Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1.600.000 Ketut Tantri membeli 2 ekor babi penginduk. Dan salah satunya sekarang sudah mempunyai anak 12 ekor ,Setelah 2 bulan sejak lahir maka anak babi ini sudah bisa dijual ,Biasanya 1 ekor dijual seharga Rp.200.000,tetapi rencananya anak babi ini akan dipelihara sebagai babi penggemukan,sebanyak 5 ekor dan sisanya 7 ekor baru dijual. Dari hasil penjualan sebesar Rp.1.400.000 (@200.000 x 7) maka diperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.500.000 , dari keuntungan inilah Ketut Tantri bisa memperbaiki rumahnya walaupun masih sangat sederhana (semipermanen) . Untuk pinjaman yang diperoleh dari dinari sebesar Rp.1.300.000 rencananya akan dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak karena KetutTantri sekarang menambah usahanya dengan memelihara 5 ekor penggemukan disamping 2 ekor penginduk tadi,dengan harapan keuntungan yang diperoleh lebih meningkat.

loans.use: Buy livestock feed - Membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva is 49 years old, married to Sixto Zarate, and they have 8 children: 7 are married and working while the youngest studies in school.

Previously she worked in a tailor shop and with the time and experience she gained there, she opened her own tailor shop. She began with only one machine and now she has three sewing machines.

Her husband works buying and selling cattle.

Genoveva wants to expand her tailor shop by buying more sewing machines and then she can have more employees thereby providing employment to other people.

With the loan she wishes to invest in the purchase of a sewing machine, thread, and fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Genoveva tiene 49 años esta casada con el Sr. Sixto Zarate tienen 8 hijos: 7 están casados trabajan y el menor estudia en el colegio.

Anteriormente la señora trabajaba en un taller de costura y con el tiempo y la experiencia adquirida, ella abrió su propio taller de costura. Ella empezó con una sola maquina y ahora posee tres máquinas de costura.

Su marido se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno.

La señora Genoveva quiere ampliar su taller de costura comprando más maquinas de coser y poder contar con más empleados y de esa forma dar también empleo a otras personas.

El préstamo que solicito desea invertirlo en la compra de una maquina de coser, hilos y telas.

loans.use: Purchase thread, fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Another new face to the SPBD programme, Malia will utilise this loan to support her small farm. She wants to expand the crops that she has and she sees SPBD's support as the opportunity for her to do that. She is really looking forward to getting more out of her farm now that this assistance is made available for her.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her small farm

loans.name: Namungoona 1G (F) Group

texts.en: Rebecca is 32 years old and married with two children. Her current busines is charcoal selling. She wants to use the extra business profits to build a store (kibanda) for the charcoal. Grace and Spe both offer catering services. Milly has a bar business and wants to use the loan to stock more beers for sale.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their businesses.

loans.name: Kadiba Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Sarah N.. She is currently in the business of operating a canteen and is requesting a loan to add stock. Sarah is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 1 child. Each week, Sarah makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her child and boost business. Sarah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her hotel business and the loan was paid back on time.

Sarah is joined in her small group by Zulaika N. and A. Balimuguhra. Zulaika N. sells fish and wants the loan to expand business. A. B.is currently operating a photo studio business and wants a loan to add more capital and boost business.

loans.use: To add more food and edibles to the canteen

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela was raised to believe that the father of her children would support her and together, they would try to keep their family going. Unfortunately, everything was the opposite of what she was taught. Only she had to face the immense responsibility of working endless hours. Currently, she is a diligent and responsible mother who is dedicated to 2 businesses: she sells peeled potatoes and sweets in a mobile cart. These two activities had provided education to her 2 lovely children, who are currently students. She sees it necessary to increase her income - she wants to expand her sweets business. Graciela thinks that these changes will improve the quality of life for her family and provide further education for her children. Your generosity will allow this self-sacrificing mother to accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Graciela desde que formó su familia creyó que el padre de sus hijos la apoyaría y juntos tratarían de salir adelante, lamentablemente fue todo lo contrario, sola tuvo que enfrentar con tan grande responsabilidad y dedicarse horas interminables a sus actividades.Actualmente esta laboriosa y responsable madre está dedicada a 2 negocios, oferta papas peladas y golosinas en forma ambulatoria, con estas dos actividades tenía pensado brindarles su educación a sus 2 queridos hijos que se encuentran en etapa escolar, debido a la gran demanda de útiles se ve en la necesidad de aumentar sus ingresos económicos, para eso desea ampliar su negocio de venta de golosinas, Graciela considera que con estos cambios logrará mejorar su calidad de vida y la educación de sus pequeños.Tu Generosidad permitirá cumplir la meta de esta abnegada madre.

loans.use: to increase her income in order to offer cookies, caramel, soft drinks in greater quaitity

loans.name: Masturahon

texts.ru:
Masturahon A. lives in the Shahrinav region. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education and is in the animal husbandry business. She breeds calves for resale. She buys young calves, feeds them and then resells at a more profitable price. She has been in this business for four years. Masturahon wants to buy two more calves and for this she needs $450US. She needs a loan which she will pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Атабаева Мастурахон проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 32 года,замужем и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит бычков для продажи. Покупает молодых телят , откармливает и продает на базаре по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 4 года. Хочет купить еще двух теля . на покупку которых необходимо 450 долларов США . Для этого ей необходимо получить кредит , а погасить его она планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Señora Carmen belongs to the Communal Bank 'The Breezes', located at Jr. Huanuco 200, in the Calleria District of the Ucayali Department. She is 51 years old, and is the mother of 3 children. She is a widow, and her income was not sufficient to maintain her family. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in the business of an internet kiosk.

Now she has a business with internet terminals that is very well implemented and that she manages with the help of her children all day.

With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 1 computer to use in the kiosk. Carmen considers herself to be a woman who values herself only through her efforts and dedication to help her children improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en el Jr. Huanuco 200, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años, es madre D. 3 hijos, es viuda, pero los ingresos con los que cuenta no le alcanzan para mantener a su familia, es así que Carmen con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en negocio D. cabinas D. Internet. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio D. cabinas D. Internet muy bien implementado que lo atienD. con el apoyo D. sus hijos durante todo el dia. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1 200 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: 1 computadora para implementar sus cabinas. Carmen se considera una mujer que supo valerse por si misma valiéndose solo D. esfuerzo y dedicación para poder apoyar a sus hijos a salir adelante.

loans.use: With this loan Carmen will buy a computer for her business

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
In one of the most commercial streets in the town of Juliaca, we find ourselves in the small office of Luzmila’s business, whom for the last two years has devoted herself to selling hamburgers and salchipapas (Hot-dogs and French fries) on the street. Luzmila established this business with many hopes of improving her quality of life and that of her family. It is for this reason that since she started-up the business, she has worked to provide an excellent service to her customers. Currently, she has a large number of regular customers which she wishes to retain: in order to do this, she is thinking of acquiring chairs and tables to improve her customers’ comfort. Luzmila hopes from the bottom of her heart to receive your help.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

En una de las calles más comerciales de la ciudad de Juliaca ubicamos el puestito de negocio de Luzmila, quien desde hace 2 años viene dedicándose a la venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas en forma ambulatoria. Luzmila inició este negocio con muchas perceptivas de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, es por ello que desde un inició se esforzó para brindarles un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.Actualmente cuenta con gran cantidad de asiduos comensales a los que desea seguir conservando, para ello tiene pensado adquirir sillas y mesas para mayor comodidad de sus clientes. Luzmila espera de corazón recibir tu colaboración.

loans.use: Injections of capital in order to install  tables and chairs in her daily work space

loans.name: Dionisio Guadalupe

texts.es:
Dionisio has a taxi business which supports his family. He began this business 18 years ago with his own money. He would like to add another taxi to his business and rent it out, generating more income and growing his business. The loan will be used for maintenance on his vehicles.

Dionisio is married and has 4 children, 3 of them are now grown up and one is still in school. His wife works in a shop selling clothing and shoes to help with their household expenses.

Don Dionisio tiene una unidad de taxi en la que trabaja diariamente para llevar el sustento a su familia. Hace 18 años vendió un patrimonio familiar y con ese dinero compró el vehículo para usarlo en el servicio de taxi. Sus planes son adquirir otra unidad de taxi, la cual alquilará para generar más ingresos para su familia. El dinero será utilizado para darle mantenimiento al vehículo y así asegurarse que no le vaya a fallar. Don Dionisio es casado, su espsos es comerciante de ropa y zapatos y le apoya en lo económico. Tiene 4 hijos, 3 ya son independientes, y uno todavia está estudiando.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR MAINTENANCE ON HIS VEHICLES AND INVEST IN HIS TAXI BUSINESS.

loans.name: Va

texts.en:
Va S., age 49, is a widow and lives with her three children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She earns around $2 of profit per day from selling water. One of her children is a student and the two others are employed. She has been selling water for over 20 years. She used to use a cart to transfer the water but currently she owns a small truck to transport the water.  The truck is currently broken so she needs a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to fix the truck. She believes that once the truck is fixed, her business can go smoothly again.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: She hopes this loan can help fix her truck.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Bui Thi S. is 55 years old. Her 5 children are all mature. In 1997, she joined TYM fund to avail loans to improve her family's economy. She used her first loan in animal raising but did not gain much money as she was inexperienced. For the following loans, she invested in her grocery and at the same time still raised animals and grew rice. Thanks to her ceaseless effort, she now has a stable income of VND 3 million. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 18 million to buy more types of consumer products to serve local people.
texts.en:
Note: the original description was already in English

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi  A. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il tient depuis 5 ans un une boutique d’alimentation générale à  Apéyémé une ville à l’intérieur du Togo située sur les plateaux de Danye à 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale. Il souhaite par ce deuxième crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité ce qui lui assurera une bonne marge à la revente. Ce faisant il contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi A., age 35, is married and the father of 3 children. For 5 years, he's been running a general grocery store in Apéyémé, an interior city in Togo, located on the Danye plateaux, at approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital. With this second loan with FECECAV, he wishes to bolster his business, which will ensure him a good retail margin. In doing so, he will help improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandises for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthorn Sray Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthorn S., 29 years old, has four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school, while the youngest one is too young to study. Mrs. S. is the leader of a group of six businessmen who all live in the Andong Village in Kandal Province. She earns income breeding pigs, while her husband, Mr. Em Lok, works as a motorbike-taxi driver, make very little. Mrs. S.'s business, on the other hand, is going well, and she wants to expand it. Therefore, Mrs. S. is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets for breeding. 
This is a group loan mainly consisting of end-of-term loans. Three members of the group have end-of-term loans, while the others have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product, because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase of additional piglets for breeding

loans.name: Fátima Vicente

texts.pt:
Fátima Vicente M. is from Maputo, 39 years old, separated and the mother of 3 children who all attend school - the oldest is 16, the second oldest is 12 and the youngest is 9. She supports only her children.

Fátima was in school until the 8th grade and she stopped studying when she landed a contract to go and work in what used to be the RDA (Democratic Republic of Germany). She remained there for two years and when she returned, she married the father of her children; a marriage which lasted only 14 years.

Fátima is a trader and business owner and sells necessary (staple) items and various drinks. She does this alone as she has no employees and her establishment opens at 8am and closes at 8pm. Her monthly income from this business is 2250 MZN and she lives in her own home.

This is Fátima’s first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She intends to repay her loan early in order to request another one to improve her house and later buy a vehicle to aid her in her business.

Translated from Portuguese, Brazil by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

Fátima Vicente M. é natural de Maputo, tem 39 anos de idade, separada e mãe de 3 filhos todos estudantes com idade entre o primeiro com16 anos, o segundo com 12 anos e o terceiro com 9 anos de idade respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Fátima estudou até 8ªclasse e parou quando conseguiu contrato para ir trabalhar na Alemanha antiga RDA, onde por lá esteve por dois anos, no seu regresso juntou se com o pais dos seus filhos casamento que durou apenas 14 anos.

Fátima é negociante e dona do negocio, o qual consiste na venda de produtos da primeira necessidade e bebidas diversas. Faz sozinha não tem empregada, com um estabelecimento que abre as 8:30 e fecha as 20:00h, com este negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 2250 mt, vive numa casa própria.

Para Fátima este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva e pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro afim melhorar a sua casa e posterior comprar uma viatura para ajudar lhe no seu negocio.

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget L. lives in Prey Chuor Village in Takeo Province. She is 40 years old and the mother of eight children. Five of her children help her and her husband with the business and the others stay at home.  She is pictured with her husband.

Mrs. Nget L. makes a living by cultivating rice on her plot of land.  Her husband, Mr. Mon Nhon, is a laborer and earns a small income. Although they work hard, they live in an old house and cannot provide a good standard of living for their family. In order to improve her family's livelihood, Mrs. Nget L. is requesting a loan to buy timber to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy timber to build a new house for her family

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Saom T. is 52 years old and lives with his wife in the Bati district of Takeo province. He has a business selling banana ice-cream in the village and earns approximately US$2 a day. His wife is a farmer who grows rice. His wife, Nub Kan, 52, pictured here with her husband, has been growing rice since 1987. This couple, together, have three children and all of them are employed as workers.

Mr. Saom T. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport ice-cream to sell in the village.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Nasira Parveen Abdul Aziz Group
loans.use: To buy materials for Punjabi food business.

loans.name: Norjmaa

texts.en:
Norjmaa D. is a widowed, single mother of four. Her family lives in a "ger" district (a ger district is where many people have settled in this type of nomadic home, forming a sort of ad hoc suburb) on plot of land she owns. Her eldest son runs a transport business between Uvurhangay, his home province, and Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

In 1999, Norjmaa began to run a meat-sales business at the local food market. She buys, butchers and sells four sheep a day. She earns between 250-1,000 MNT (0.17 cents-70 cents) per kilogram. Norjmaa's eldest daughter helps her business. Since she has no storage to freeze meat, she buys few animals during the summer but buys many sheep during the winter.

Norjmaa told us in Mongolian: "By running my retail business, I'm planning to enable my children to enroll in universities for their future career. I dream of having my own big supermarket!" (At the picture: Norjmaa is sitting at the left hand)

loans.use: To buy sheep meat

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan Carlos vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Juan Granier de la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como profesor urbano donde percibe un sueldo mínimo, por lo que para mejorar sus ingresos tiene un taller donde arregla celulares. El crédito que requiere es para comprar herramientas especiales para arreglo de celulares y estabilizar su negocio ya que tiene bastantes clientes.

El historial del cliente es muy bueno y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos lives at his parent's house at Juan Granier street, which is in the September 14th zone of La Paz. He works as teacher in the city where he makes a minimal salary. Therefore, he has a shop where he repairs cell-phones to improve his income. He needs a loan to purchase special tools to repair cell-phones and to establish his business because he already has plenty of clients. The client's credit history is very good and he can receive a new loan. He has been an IMPRO client since 2007.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase special tools to repair cellphones

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela O. is the 34-year-old mother of four children who lives in Manyatta. She sells secondhand clothing which she purchases from dealers who bring in the clothes from Nairobi. She likes running her own business and says she is good at it - seeing more than 20 customers a day.

Pamela was married to a policeman, but he is not around anymore. She says it is a struggle to survive as she is sick, but hopes that a 20,000 KSH loan will help her grow her business.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothing to sell

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia es una mujer que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, a sus 37 años todavía tiene muchas fuerzas para seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia, vive en la casa que le cedieron sus padres. Zonia tiene uno de las tiendas más llenas de su barrio, ella lleva a su humilde localidad los abarrotes más necesarios y útiles para sus moradores, administra su tienda hace más de 8 años, es muy feliz vendiendo sus productos y satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes, lo más difícil de su trabajo es permanecer todo el día en su negocio sin poder salir, ya que atiende todo el día y siempre está cuando sus compradores la solicitan. Para el futuro de su negocio, desea ampliar su tienda y tener muchos más productos que vender, puesto que su barrio está creciendo y la mercadería con la cuenta, ya no le alcanza. Es el quinto préstamo de Zonia con MFP, sus anteriores créditos los pagó puntualmente y sin problemas, es la socia más activa y solidaria de su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querida. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que ha solicitado, comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su bodega.
texts.en:
Zonia is a woman who has always worked hard to get ahead. At 37 years old, she still has great desire to continue working and helping her family. She lives in a house that was left to her by her parents. Zonia has one of the most well-stocked stores in her neighborhood. Her humble shop offers the groceries and household supplies most requested by the local population. She has had her shop for eight years and is very happy to sell products that meet the demands of her customers. The most difficult thing about her work is staying in her shop all day without being able to leave, as her store is open all day and she must be available to serve her customers whenever they call. In the future, Zonia would like to expand her business to provide more products, as her neighborhood is growing and her current supply of merchandise is not enough.

This is Zonia's fifth loan from Microfinanzas PRISMA, and all of her previous loan were repaid punctually and without problems. She is the most active member of her community bank, where she is much loved. She will use the 800 Peruvian nuevos soles from this loan to purchase more merchandise to better stock her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Buvrobiya

texts.ru: Ибрагимова Бувробия 1950 год рождения ,узбек ,образование среднее .Место жительства Шахристанский район к. Карачи .Вдова имеет 1 ребёнка .Муж  Ибрагимов  Яхшибой . Клиентка занимается животноводством  уже около 40лет .Клиентка берёт кредит для выращивания и откорма  скота .Клиентка имеет 7 голова крупного рогатого скота  .Дополнительный семейный доход клиентка занимается сельском хозяйством  и переработка молока. В свободное время Бувробия любит роботать в огороде,где выращивает овощи и зелень.
texts.en:
Buvrobiya I., an Uzbek, was born in 1950, and has a high school education. She lives in Karachi, a town in the Shahristan district. She is a widow and has one child. Her husband was Yahshiboy Ibragimov. This entrepreneur has practiced animal husbandry for about 40 years. She is requesting a loan to help with feeding and raising the livestock. She has 7 head of cattle. She earns extra income for the family by growing crops and processing milk. In her free time she loves to work in her garden, where she grows vegetables and herbs.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Holniso

texts.ru: Шокирова Холнисо – кредитор в Микроинвест уже четвёртый год. Она занимается продажей разных сортов конфет, на рынке Костакоза. Все предыдущие кредиты она погашает своевременно без нарушений. Следующий кредит она хочет использовать для завоза карамели и леденцов.  У неё много постоянных клиентов , которые покупают у неё конфеты. На снимке Холнисо на месте бизнеса .
texts.en:
Holniso S. is in her fourth year borrowing from MicroInvest. She works selling different types of candy at the market in Kostakoz. She has repaid her previous loans on time and without problems. She wants to use this loan for a delivery of caramels and fruit drops. She has many regular customers who buy sweets from her. The picture is of Holniso at her shop.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
T. Dilorom is 25 years old. She is not married and in order to support her parents she runs her own business selling food items: fruits, vegetables, sweets, soft drinks, detergents and other items in her grocery. She is known among people of her community because of the attractive prices and fresh foodstuff. All of this allows Dilorom’s business to generate the stable, considerable incomes for her family. Today she is planning to purchase additional fresh foodstuff to fulfill the needs of a growing number of customers. With this purpose she requests 2500 Somoni. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Dilorom’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of cloth in bulk

loans.name: Хаким

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Каримов Хаким-мужчина 1960 года рождения ,женат имеет 3-х детей ,жена Каримова Мухаббат .Клиент берёт кредит  для расширения  своего бизнеса .Хаким занимается купля продажей и откормом  скота .Ему в этом помогает отец . Дополнительно Хаким занимается  выращиванием и переработкой сельхозпродуктов , чтобы пополнить свой семейный бюджет.На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить 2-х  бычков, откормив их в течении3-4 месяцев, продаст их за хорошую цену.

loans.use: для покупки скота

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
D. Mahbuba is 45 years old. Mahbuba and her husband are married for almost 25 years and raised 4 children. One of them is already married and has the children of his own who adore their grandparents. Mahbuba has been running her own small business for 14 years already. She has a place for selling items such as: soft drinks, sweets, potted goods, detergents, soap, tooth-paste and many others. She works from the 7:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Mahbuba is very friendly and polite which allows her to have the clientele. Now she is requesting for 5000 Somoni that will spend for purchasing more goods for selling thus increasing the range of the products. She thanks everyone who have decided to support her.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing of the stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Ana Hortencia

texts.es: La señora Ana Hortencia vive en compañía de sus dos hijos y de su esposo el señor José Luis Rangel; su esposo labora para una empresa reconocida del país y muy importante en la ciudad desde hace 8 años. Ella tiene su propio negocio de nombre “Mini Súper Martínez” establecido desde hace 3 años, y que esta funcionando muy bien ya que la señora Ana es muy emprendedora y esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de mas mercancía de su negocio y así sus ganancias crecerán y sus clientes se incrementaran porque tendrá para cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Ana Hortencia lives with her two children and her husband, José Luis Rangel. For eight years her husband has worked for a business that is well-known in the country and very important in the city. She has her own business called “Mini Súper Martínez”, which was established three years ago. The business is working very well because Ana is very enterprising. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for her store. This way her earnings will grow, and she will get more customers because she will have what it takes to cover their necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Bukorakole Nyangoma Beatrice Group

texts.en: N. Beatrice is been selected by her loan group as Cashier. She is twenty-four years old, married with three children. She operates a bar business of which she has been doing for over four years. She is requesting for the loan to boost her business by purchasing crates of beer, sodas, water, etc to meet her customers’ demand. She is so much willing to improve upon her business for big profit return. She is an active business woman whose dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To boost her business by purchasing crates of beer, sodas, water, etc to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es una noble mujer de 40 años, vive con su esposo, Santos de 44 años, y sus 4 hijos: Jonathan de 18, Junior de 16, Luis Ángel de 8 y Josue de 5 añitos de edad. Durante toda su vida ha trabajado en diversidad de labores, pero hace 3 años decidió incursionar en un negocio que le diera la ventaja de ser independiente. Es así que explotando sus habilidades culinarias, que es lo que su familia siempre ha alabado, en asociación con una amiga implementó dos puestos de comida en una de las calles más concurridas de su localidad. Ahora, Ana viene obteniendo buenos ingresos realizando una actividad que le gusta mucho y tiene en mente para el futuro tener un restaurante donde ofrezca con mayor comodidad sus ricos platillos, ya que actualmente tiene dificultades de espacio, pues sus puestos son muy concurridos. Felizmente el negocio va muy bien y Ana puede brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida gracias a su trabajo. 
Ella es parte de un banco comunal denominado “Las delicias de Ancón” y siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos, al igual que sus amigas con quienes integra su grupo. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de ingredientes y comestibles para incrementar la cantidad de porciones de comida que prepara diariamente.

loans.use: Compra de comestibles e ingredientes para sus comidas

loans.name: Talisuaga

texts.en:
Talisuaga N. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Talisuaga owns & operates a taxi.  Talisuaga also owns a plantation, where she grows taro (a starchy root), bananas, and cocoa.  Talisuaga has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Talisuaga joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Talisuaga is requesting for the first time, a loan from SPBD.    Talisuaga is requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Talisuaga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand her taxi business.

Talisuaga has not been affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase parts and materials to improve her taxi service

loans.name: The Lord Group

texts.en:
Faustina is the group leader of a trust bank group called The Lord. She is seated in the photograph.

Faustina is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade.

Kade is a farming and commercial town in the eastern region of Ghana. Most of the group members are either into trading and/or farming activities.

Faustina is a trader. She trades in utensils.

The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best educations they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa D. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est divorcée et mère d'un enfant dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de CENTRE2 dans lequel elle joue un rôle de leader. Elle y a reçu 11 prêts qu'elle a bien remboursés. Ce crédit lui servira à développer une petit unité d'élevage de poulets de chaire et parallèlement à commercialiser des effets vestimentaires tels que des tenues de dames. Ses bénéfices lui servent à assurer la prise en charge de son enfants.
texts.en:
Awa D. is a woman of 52 years. She is divorced and the mother of a child that she supports. She is member of the Village Bank of CENTRE2 in which she plays a leading role. She has received 11 loans there that she repaid well. This loan will be used to develop a small farm for raising chickens and also to market clothing such as ladies garments. Her profits serve to cover the costs of caring for her child.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a chicken farm

loans.name: Julia Aydee

texts.es:
Nuestra socia JULIA AYDEE es una humilD. madre D. familia, tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos Ella vive en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
 
La socia tiene un pequeño negocio D. producción y venta D. velas, Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora, emprendedora, responsable que trata casar adelante a sus hijos dándole una buena educación. La socia cuenta que este negocio tiene 20 años y esta pasado D. generación en generación y ahora ella es quien administra junto con sus hijos. La socia requiere el dinero para comprar más materiales para producción D. velas como parafina y pabilo.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
JULIA AYDEE, 55, is married and the mother of three children. She lives in the imperial city of Cusco and is a member of Asociación Arariwa's “UNIDOS PARA EL TRIUNFO” communal bank. She has a small candle-making business. She is a humble, hard-working, enterprising, responsible woman who tries to get her children ahead in life by providing them with a good education. She tells us that the business has been around for 20 years and has passed from generation to generation and now it is she, together with her children, who run it. The funding is needed to buy candle-making supplies like paraffin and wicks. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candle-making supplies like paraffin and wicks.

loans.name: Jacinto Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Jacinto José Q. E., tiene la edad de 29 años, Labora Vigilante de Seguridad en el Mercado Oriental, el tiene cuatros hijos a su cargo, dos de sus hijos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante cinco años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 8 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El cual utilizara para remodelar el piso de su de habitación, con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jacinto José Q. E. is 29-years-old and works as a security guard at the Eastern Market. He is married and has four children, two of whom are school-aged. He has been receiving loans from CEPRODEL for five years, during which time he has invested eight loans in home improvements. Thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL, Jacinto is an excellent client. He plans to use this loan to purchase building materials to renovate one floor of his house in order to provide better security and a higher quality of life to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of building materials.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia G. is from the village of Santa Isabel. She is 39 years old, married, and has one school-age child. To make a living, Emelia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $66 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Emelia joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Emelia is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace I., 35, is making sure that her family has enough for their daily needs. Married to Aniel I., a seaman, she is blessed with two children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn enough so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing their ‘buy and sell’ business for five years already.

Marie Grace has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than seven years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow five times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy different appliances and resell them on an installment basis. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 10,500 per month.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy additional home appliances for her 'buy and sell' business.

She hopes that her business will continue to provide them with enough income for her family’s everyday expenses.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buying additional home appliances to resell

loans.name: Ana Ronila

texts.en:
Ana Ronila M. is one of the very good members of ASHI in San Pedro center. The inspiration of maintaining her excellent performance in ASHI since the time of her membership is drawn from the four most significant blessing she received from GOD. These are her four children whose age ranges are from 10 to 20 years old.  Despite of poverty and small family income, Ana and her family give love and respect to each other. While her husband manages and working in their small business which is a vehicle (particularly motorcycle) repair shop, at home Ana does the household chores and is taking care of their children. 

As her children grew old their family expenses also increases hence, Ana and her husband wanted to enhance their small business through a loan for a capital. Because Ana and her husband are just poor, no one in their village would trust them for a loan. With that, Ana joined ASHI and had found the answer to her problem. Since then, she made her business grow anyhow but not yet to the extent of achieving her dream of making it sustainable. Ana and her husband still want to buy more equipments and machines necessary for the business to improve their efficiency, to improve the quality of service they can give and be able to have more costumers. Therefore she still asks for a much larger amount of loan for its fulfillment. Proceeds of her business will be a great source of finances for Ana to be able to sustain the education of her children until they graduate from college. And by then, their lives will be different and they can have a better and well compensated kind of job.

loans.use: Will be used to purchase necessary equipments such as welding machine and others.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel Maradiaga Sánchez

texts.es:
Es un ganadero de la zona de Cosiguina cuenta con una familia de 5 hijos los cuales trabajan con el, en el mismo  rubro 
El crédito lo ocupara para la compra de mas novillos para aumentar su hato ganadero y por ende sus ingresos
texts.en:
He is a cattleman in the Cosiguina area. He has five children, who work with him in the same line of work. He will use the loan to buy more bullocks to increase his herd size and thereby his income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Cristo La Solucion Group

texts.en:
Dignora is the coordinator of her group Cristo L. Solucion (Christ the Solution), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally.

Her group is located in the areas surrounding L. Romana, where the economy is based on sugarcane and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Dignora is excited to be taking her second loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by traveling to the capital and purchasing pants, underwear and sandals to sell.

She will use the profits to invest in her family by purchasing shoes for her children and saving towards the day when she can have her own store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, clothes and underwear to sell

loans.name: Niagna Ndiaye

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Niagna Ndiaye N. est une demoiselle de 28 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Ngaparou à Yoff et évolue dans le secteur de la coiffure depuis 10 ans. Elle gère un salon de coiffure non loin de chez elle. Parallèlement  elle fait le commerce de produits de beauté. Elle a choisi l’activité  de coiffure par passion dans l’objectif de gagner sa vie et d’éviter la dépendance. Ses moments préférés sont les week end et les périodes  de fête car ce sont les moments d’affluence. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but de réfectionner son salon de  coiffure. Ce crédit lui permettra d’embellir le salon et d’attirer d’avantage la clientèle.  Ceci est un moyen d’accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Niagna Ndiaye N. is a young lady of 28 years of age, who lives in the neighborhood of Ngaparou in Yoff and has worked as haidresser for 10 years. She runs a hair salon near her home. Besides, she is also in the cosmetics business. She chose to be hairdresser out of passion and also to earn her living and avoid dependency. Her favorite time is the weekend as well as the holiday season, as these are the peak times. She is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs in order to refurbish her salon. This loan will allow her to improve the facility and attract more customers. In this way she hopes to increase her revenue.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and mulch for his plantations

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
"Susitina T. is 51 and married with four children (ages 8 - 20).  She owns a business venture, selling local Samoan snacks such as palusami (coconut cream wrapped in taro leaves), cooked taro, yams, and soupo ese (hearty papaya soup).  Susitina has three years of experience in this business.  Susitina needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Susitins joined SPBD.This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Susitins's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Nadutari Enole

texts.en:
Nadutari Enole N. is 29 years old. She is married to Sinore Ole Saoli, and she is the mother of eight children.

Nadutari is a farmer, and she does the farming on her own piece of land. She has been doing this for the last eight years.

Nadutari learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members of KADET. This will be her first loan, and she is planning to spend 20,000 KES to plant more beans, which normally do well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her farming activities from small-scale to commercial farming.

Nadutari's dream is to do large-scale farming and to attain financial independence. She is a hardworking woman who is determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To plant more beans

loans.name: Self Help Group

texts.en:
Oretha J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Self Help.  She is 47 years old, is single and has five children who range from 7 to 28 years old.  She was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to financial difficulties. 

Two of her children attend university and she also cares for two siblings.

For six years, she has been selling rice, flour, oil and sugar in New Matilda Estate, Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more rice, flour, oil and sugar.
 
Her hope is to improve her business and take good care of her children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more rice, flour, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Consuela

texts.es: Consuela es una amable y carismática mujer de 62 años, comparte su vida con su esposo Ivan de 65 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Ambos, desde muy jóvenes se han dedicado a la venta de artesanías, actividad que heredaron sus dos hijos, quienes ahora pusieron su propio taller y se dedican a la misma labor. La elaboración de estatuillas de santos y adornos es lo que más frecuentemente realizan, puesto le es rentable. Ivan, su esposo trabaja al lado de sus hijos, que se dedican a elaborar santos (estatuillas) de tamaños muy grandes para el misterio en navidad o en iglesias, capillas. Por otra parte, Consuela se dedica a su propio negocio de venta de estatuillas del niño Jesús en tamaños pequeños, que los vende por pedidos, pues es menos trabajoso realizarlos por su tamaño, pero ello no significa que sea menos difícil, pues debe ser muy minuciosa, procurando colocar la mezcla en los moldes y cerrarlos con gran precisión para que ambas mitades se unan en armonía y así salga bien modelada la imagen, en el que luego pasa a tallarlos y darle el acabado necesario. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que será muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que necesita, quiere comprar materiales necesarios para acabar con los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Consuela is a very friendly and charismatic woman of 62. She shares her life with her husband, Ivan, 65, and they live together in their own home. Since they were both very young the couple has worked selling artesanal goods, an activity that their 2 children have inherited, having now established their own stall and working at the same activity. The most frequent work Consuela and Ivan do is making very large statues of saints for Christmas and for churches and chapels. Apart from this, Consuela also has her own business selling small statues of the baby Jesus, which she sells by order. This is less work because of the statues' size, but this doesn't mean it's less difficult as the statues are very detailed - putting in place the mix into the moulds and closing them with great precision so that both sides are in harmony and the image is modelled well. Later the moulds are sculpted and given the finishing touches necessary. This is the couple's third loan with MFP, and as usual they will be very punctual with the repayments. With this loan they will purchase the materials necessary to finish the orders that they have waiting.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to make statues to fill an order

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio Alberto tiene 52 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Chilanga del departamento de Morazán, es acompañado tiene dos hijos, y actualmente vive solo con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la venta de CD.
Tiene siete años de dedicarse a la venta de CD de música, y los comercializa en los municipios y zonas cercanas de su residencia, emprendió su negocio por la necesidad económica y la falta de empleo.
Julio está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de CD, y seguir con su negocio  ya que de las ventas depende la economía de su familia, sus aspiraciones son tener un lugar propio donde vivir, ahorrar para comprar un terreno.
texts.en:
Julio Alberto is 52 years old. He resides in the municipality of Chilanga in the department of Morazán. He lives with his partner and has two children. He currently lives alone with his partner. He sells CDs. He has been selling music CDs for seven years. He sells them in the municipalities and towns near his home. He learned his business due to economic necessity and the lack of employment. Julio is requesting a loan to buy CDs so he can continue with his business, since his family depends economically on his sales. His hopes are to have his own place to live and to save so he can buy a piece of land.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy CDs

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
H. Farogat is an enterprising, capable and very hard-working woman. She lives in Istaravshan, Tajikistan and sells kid’s clothing. She began her business after the death of her husband. Her work is allowing her three children go to school. It is very important to Farogat that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals. She needs 6500 Somoni to buy merchandise in order to increase sales. Farogat wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Support her!   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for selling.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora P. is from the town of Loon. She is 45 years old. Flora is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 2 years. She hopes to be able to acquire rice that she could also sell at her store.

Flora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Flora is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Flora from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: God’S Grace Group

texts.en:
James D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God’s Grace. James is 25 years old, single and was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of support. 

For four years, he has been selling second-hand shoes on Water Street, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia.
 
He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of second-hand shoes.

He describes himself as a quiet man. His dream is to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of second-hand shoes

loans.name: Rubina Abdul Hamid's Group

texts.en:
Rubina lives in the small town of Khanewal in Pakistan near the city of Multan. She is 34 years old and married to A. H.. A. H. is illiterate and works as a daily wage laborer. Rubina sells bangles to support her family financially.  
Rubina is the mother of seven sons. Her eldest son is also illiterate and works as a laborer like his father. Rubina's other sons are enrolled in school and receiving an education, except the youngest one who is just three years of age. 
Working as a laborer is an uncertain job for A. H. because it is not permanent –  people hire laborers on a contract basis and that is why he sometimes has work and sometimes not. In light of the current financial situation, A. H. has decided to start a fruit-selling business and leave his work as a laborer. Therefore, Rubina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for this purpose. With the loan, A. H. will buy a fruit cart and some seasonal fruits for resale.  
Rubina hopes that this business will be a profitable one and that her family will be able to enjoy a better financial life. She is a new loan user of Asasah. She hopes that this experience will be a good one for her family.   
Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Rubina.

loans.use: To buy a cart and seasonal fruits to start a fruit-selling business

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr: ramatou est une femme mariée, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de mercerie et de tissus. pour  avoir une plus grosse marge bénéficiaire sur ces ventes, elle s'approvisionne au burkina faso qui est un pays voisin. elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans ce commerce et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle fait face à une rupture de stock et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de divers articles de mercerie et des tissus.
texts.en:
Ramatou is married and makes a living selling sewing supplies and cloth. In order to increase her profit margin, she stocks up in neighbouring Burkina Faso. She has run this business for 3 years and her customers are all kinds of people. Since she is running out of stock, she is requesting her first WAGES loan to buy various sewing supplies and cloth.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: X. Nguyễn Thị is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three grown-up children. To make a living, X. owns and operates a specialized retail store selling confectionery products in her community. X. has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000,000 dong (VND) a month. In 2008, X. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,048,000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase products to sell. X. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from SEDA. X. plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. No. 20213030034. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ====================================== X. Nguyễn Thị (20213030034) là 52 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành. Để kiếm sống, X. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm bánh kẹo trong cộng đồng địa phương. X. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, X. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, X. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. X. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. X. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam. Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a heating system which has a boiler and a stove

loans.name: Joel Kang'ali

texts.en:
