Joel kang'ali A. is 31 years old and married to Jepkosgei Maureen, a business woman. Both Joel and his wife earn an income to support their family. They have two children, who are three years old and one year old. They live in Eldoret, Kenya. He operates a green grocery and has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES.

Joel learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer. He is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD. With this loan, he intends to purchase bananas, avocados, oranges, lemons, watermelon, and pilipilihoho (hot peppers). He plans to use the profits to expand the grocery and buy more fruit.

In the future Joel hopes to own rental houses and offer a better education to his children.

loans.use: To purchase produce

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mom S., 50, is married and resides with her husband and child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. 

S. and her husband grow rice, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day. S. has to spend USD 38 on food, USD 1 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 2 on other necessary expenses every month.  

S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase hair dressing equipment for her daughter to start a business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy hair dressing equipment to start new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more underclothes

loans.name: George

texts.en: George O. O. is a married man. His wife is a greengrocer and they have one child, aged three years old, whom they hope to educate to the university level. His business is located at Kisumu Central Business District. Kisumu is the region in Kenya which harbours Lake Victoria and is well known as the lake basin. He provides public transport around the busy Kisumu city. He has been in this business for five years now and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is the high cost of repairing the rickshaw. There is also increased thuggery in the area posing risk to his business and life. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 50,000 to buy spare parts to repair the rickshaw, so it will stay in good condition to provide better service to his clients. He hopes to acquire another rickshaw in the future to increase his income. He describes himself as tolerant, assertive and persuasive.

loans.use: Spare parts

loans.name: Resiato Ene

texts.en: Resiato has been raising animals to sell in Naivasha town for the last year. She is 23 years old, married to Jackson K. and they have two children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her first loan. She plans to use it to buy 10 young goats and 15 lambs which she will raise and sell later at a profit. In the future, Resiato hopes to practice large-scale livestock farming.

loans.use: To buy 10 young goats and 15 lambs which she will raise and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a food selling stall, selling wholesale and from door to door. Her husband contributes to meeting the family's basic needs.  Regina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy winter season, the availability of food for sale is low compared to the dry summer season where the demand is high. She hopes to become a big supplier of cloth in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to start selling clothes, purchase a bundle of cloth and leso's( Kikoi's: African print cloth) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To start selling clothes and purchase bundles of cloth for resale

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.es:
En EL Barrio Santa Clara de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros,  es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Pacifico, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Activas.

Aquí conocimos a María,  ella es madre soltera de una linda bebe de nueve meses de nacida. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal cinco  ciclos y le gusta porque gracias a estos créditos a podido sacar su negocio adelante para ganarse el sustento diario y el de su bebe.

Tiene un negocio en el cual se dedica preparar y vender bocadillos y comida rápida como: empanadas, tortillas, panes de almidón, corviches, además de vender sodas y jugos naturales. Trabaja todos los días en las tardes y una hermana le ayuda en su negocio el cual nos cuenta que lo tiene ya por tres años y que gracias a Dios le da lo necesario para sus gastos y los de su pequeña hija.

Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros ingredientes para la preparación de los alimentos. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres” (Women) meets every 2 weeks in the Santa Clara neighborhood of the city of Manta.  Manta is known for its beautiful beaches that are often visited by national and foreign tourists all year round.  Manta is one of the most important ports in the country and in South America and is located on the Pacific coast.

Here we meet María,  a single mother of an adorable 9 month old baby girl.  María lives with her parents.  She has worked with the communal bank for five loan cycles and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has been able to improve her business and earn enough to support herself and her baby.

She makes and sells bocadillos (sandwiches) and fast food such as empanadas (flattened fried dough stuffed with meats or sweets) tortillas, yucca bread, and corviches (fried rolls stuffed with shredded meats, plantains, etc) and she also sells sodas and natural juices.  She works every afternoon with the help of one of her sisters.  She tells us that she has had the business for three years and thank God, it gives her enough for her expenses and those of her daughter.

She will use the loan to buy oil, plantains, peanuts and other ingredients to prepare the food.  Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: To buy oil, plantains, peanuts and other ingredients to make her food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has built up a good experience working in floor covering for 7 years. And in 2005, he started working with multiple construction projects on a freelance basis. This man helps his father to cover the family expenses.

 Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.al to increase his business capital and invest in purchasing a paving cutter and other new tools needed in order to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year.

loans.use: purchasing paving cutter and other new tools

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina, a married woman without children, owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Faustina has operated a poultry business for the past two months, selling her chickens to restaurant operators in the market. She also operates a cosmetics shop, a business that helps support the family's basic needs.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans to get financial assistance, she is requesting Kshs 15,000 to purchase chicken feed.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. For the past six months he has operated an open market selling business, he sells at the market to his neighbours and passersby.  

Willy has faces a major challenge of perishable products in his business. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he is requesting he wants to purchase beans, wheat flour, maize flour, charcoal and firewood to use for cooking in a restaurant. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase beans, wheat flour, maize flour, charcoal and firewood to use for cooking

loans.name: Ruddy Franz

texts.es: El Sr. Ruddy  vive en la zona de la Villa 1ro de Mayo, ella vive allí hace más de 5 años, se dedica a la venta de comida que entrega todos los días a los obreros de una construcción, ya que su esposa desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana se levanta a cocinar y el sr. Ruddy le ayuda con la venta y entrega de la misma el esta haciendo compras cada dos o tres días y la mayoría de los trabajadores le cancelan de forma quincenal, por lo que necesita de capital de trabajo para realizar sus compras, además de que está por comprar envases personales para cada almuerzo, ya que actualmente entrega en platos desechables, también comprara abarrotes como arroz y fideo para la elaboración de sus comidas, el Sr. Ruddy es una persona joven y trabajadora que se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Ruddy has lived in the zone of Villa Primero de Mayo for more than 5 years. Every day he sells food to construction workers. His wife gets up very early in the morning to cook and Ruddy helps with the sale and delivery of it. He makes purchases every 2 or 3 days and most of the workers pay him every 15 days. Because of this, he needs capital to make his purchases. He will buy individual dishes for each lunch, since currently he delivers on disposable plates. He also will buy groceries like rice and pasta to make the meals. Ruddy is a young, hardworking person who is very grateful to the institution for the support it has given him.

loans.use: to buy rice and other things in bulk

loans.name: Jaime Arturo

texts.es:
Jaime, reside en San Miguel, vive con su familia, tiene tres hijos de 18, 17 y 23 años de edad, él posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, es negocio familiar y lo ejerce desde hace 20 años, lo aprendió de su padre y hoy día es el que permite tener una fuente de ingreso.
El necesita comprar materiales para realizar unos trabajos, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar hierro de diferentes medidas, esta inversión le ayudara a solventar la falta de materiales y poder realizar los trabajos de los clientes.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio grande, de doble función, tener una mejor estabilidad y ayudar a sus hijos a superarse.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in San Miguel with his family. He has three children ages 18,17 and 23. He owns a workshop that builds metal structures. It is a family business that he has run for 20 years; he learned from his father and now it is his income source.

He needs to buy materials for some jobs, so he has asked for a loan to buy rebar of different sizes. The loan will help him to cover the lack of materials and be able to finish the jobs for his customers.

His dream is to have a big business with dual-purpose, to have greater stability and to help his children to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy rebar.

loans.name: Garmai

texts.en:
Garmai is 32 years old.  She is single and lives in West Point.  She has two children ages 3 and 7, who are both in school.

Garmai has been selling oil, spices, pepper and other food items for the past five years.  Although there are fewer customers during the rainy season, her business has to go on because it’s from her sales that her children's food and school fees are paid.

Garmai is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, spices, pepper and other food items. She hopes to buy a piece of land and build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, spices, pepper and other food items

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 30 years old.  She is married and has 6 children, 4 of whom go to school.  Susan sells sugar.  She has borrowed a loan to stock more sugar to sell.  She hopes to open a big shop in the future with the extra profits.

loans.use: stock more sugar to sell

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis Enrique es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad. Vive con su novia e hijo en una casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Pítipo en la provincia de Ferreñafe – Lambayeque. La comunidad donde Luis Enrique vive es rural y de condición humilde,  la mayoría de hogares no cuenta con los servicios básicos de luz, agua y desagüe.

Luis Enrique se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad, en una bodega instalada al interior de su domicilio. Luis Enrique desea progresar en ambos negocios y por lo tanto invertirá en ellos. Por eso solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1300 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de animales para extender su ganado y en la compra de abarrotes para surtir su bodega.

Luis Enrique cuenta con un buen número de clientes, para ambos negocios y sabe que esta inversión le será de gran utilidad. Es por ello que estaría muy agradecido de concedérsele el crédito. Luis Enrique ya ha trabajado con nuestra entidad y tiene buenas referencias crediticias.
texts.en:
Luis Enrique is a 22 year-old entrepreneur who lives with his girlfriend and son in his own home which is located in Pítipo district, in Ferreñafe province, Lambayeque.  The community where Luis Enrique lives is poor and rural.  Most homes do not have basic services of electricity, water and sewerage.

Luis Enrique's business is raising livestock and selling basic household products from a grocery store located in his home.  Luis Enrique would like to make progress in both businesses and so he will invest in them.  He is requesting a loan for 1,300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will invest in buying animals in order to increase his number of livestock.  He will also buy groceries with which to stock his store.

Luis Enrique has a good number of customers for both of his businesses and he knows that this investment will be very useful.  For this reason, he  would be very grateful to receive this loan.  Luis Enrique has worked with our institution before and he has a good credit record.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Buyan-Nemekh

texts.en:
Buyan-Nemekh is 41 years old and lives with her family in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She works as a cleaner at two companies, while her husband runs a taxi business. In addition, her 17-year-old daughter attends public high school and her son currently has not yet found a job.

Buyan-Nemekh’s small house needs some work to be done on the outside and inside as well. She is requesting a 1,500,000 loan to buy materials such as, cement, bricks, wallpaper, wallpaper paste, vacuum-insulated window and other necessary materials to finish her homebuilding and renovating work. 

Recently, their family bought a 32 Inch LCD television and replaced their car with a better one, with the profits that Buyan-Nemekh’s husband made. Buyan-Nemekh and her husband want to improve their living standards so that their family can enjoy safe and comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials to finish fixing up her home.

loans.name: Ibrahim's Group

texts.en: Ibrahim, 40, is a member of this group. He is a driver, and his wife works in the registry office. Together, they bring up two daughters and two sons. In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs, Ibrahim cultivates agricultural products and breeds cattle. At the moment, he has 20 farm animals and owns 0.3 hectares of land, where he wants to grow potatoes. He applied for the loan because he needs additional financial funds for purchasing mineral fertilizers. He wants to purchase 13 packs, and the price is 1,500 soms per pack. In the near future, he hopes to get a good harvest. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Pedro, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y 6 hijos de 19, 14, 12, 10, 8 y 4 años de edad, Pedro se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, aprendió hace 35 años, su padre se lo enseño desde muy joven, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00am a 11:00am.
Actualmente él, comprara insumos para sembrar maíz de postrera, que es la segunda siembra en el año, para esto solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en fertilizantes y herbicidas, que son muy necesarios para tratar a tiempo cualquier plaga.
Esta compra le ayudara para iniciar correctamente todo el proceso de la siembra, que al final pueda darle una abundante cosecha para comercializar y consumir con su familia estos frutos.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his wife and 6 children--19-, 14-, 12-, 10-, 8- and 4-years old.  He operates a farm where he grows maize and beans, work that he's been doing for 35 years.  His father taught him to farm when he was a boy and he works from 6:00am to 11:00am.  
Pedro needs supplies to plant a new maize crop, his second and last crop of the year.  He is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and herbicides, supplies that he has to have to get a good yield.  
The supplies will help him kick off the growing process correctly so that he'll have a good crop to harvest for sale and so that he and his family can enjoy the fruits of his labor.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides for his farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn to make banku (corn dough)

loans.name: Maria Felix

texts.es:
La señora María, de 39 años de edad, es originaria de Telica municipio de León, esta casada, es madre de dos niños, ella es comerciante se dedica a elaborar nacatamales. Ella empezó con esta actividad hace 20 años cuando se caso su suegra le enseño como hacer nacatamales, al principio ella esta temerosa pues no sabia mucho pero cuando aprendió e sorprendió de los resultado pues fue adquiriendo buena clientela, fue aumentado sus ventas, pues su productos tuvo muy buen demanda y recibió elogios por sabor de sus deliciosos nacatamales y esto la motivo mas aun para sacar adelante y emprender su negocio. 
Requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor, pues es uno de los ingredientes principales del nacatamal y comprar cerdos para crianza. Esta inversión le facilitaría la compra de maíz al por mayor, lo compraría mas barato y almacenaría para cuando sufra incremento en el precio.
Su meta próxima es hacerle reparaciones a su negocio, para darle una mejor apariencia y almacenar inventario para vender.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria, age 39, is from Telica in the Leon municipality. She is a married mother of two children. She is a merchant who makes nactamales. She started this activity 20 years ago. When she got married, her mother-in-law taught her how to make nactamales. In the beginning she was unsure, because she did not know much, but she learned and was surprised by the results. She has acquired a good clientele, her sales have increased, and her products have been in great demand. She has received praise for the flavour of her delicious nactamales, and this motivated her even more to get ahead and take on her business.

She needs this loan to purchase corn whohlesale, as it is one of the main ingredients for nactamales; and to purchase hogs for raising. This investment will allow her to purchase corn wholesale. She will be able to buy it cheaper and stock up against price increases.
Her next goal is to make repairs to her business, in order to give it a better appearance, and to stock up inventory to sell.

loans.use: to purchase corn wholesale, as it is one of the main ingredients for nactamal; and to purchase hogs to raise.

loans.name: Koufoula

texts.fr:
Koufoula travaille comme couturière depuis 2009. Elle achete des bazins et pagnes qu’elle confectionne pour revendre à sa clientèle dans sa maison. Elle a 3 enfants qui vont tous à l’école, le premier a 12 ans et le dernier a 6 ans.
Elle travaille dans son entreprise. 
Koufoula a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter d’acheter des bazins et pagnes. Elle veut accroître ses ventes.
Dans les prochaines années, Koufoula voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Koufoula works as a tailor since 2009. She buys traditional cloth, bazins and pagnes, that she fashions to resell to her customers at her home. She has 3 children who all go to school, the oldest is 12 and the youngest is 6.  Koufoula has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy the traditional cloth bazins and pagnes. She wants to increase her sales. In the coming years, Koufoulaouw would like to open a boutique. She says that, with the profits, she plans to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy traditional cloth bazins and pagnes

loans.name: Goshi's Group

texts.en:
Goshi is married and her husband is a butcher by profession. He sells red meat (goats) to his customers through his shop. He is very honest with his customers and sells good quality meat at reasonable rates. 
Goshi is a housewife who stays at home to perform her household responsibilities. She is a very responsible person who does her work with great dedication. She has five children, two of whom work while the others are under four years old and haven’t started their education yet. 
Goshi has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats in order to sell their meat through his shop and increase his sales. He has been operating his business for the past 12 years and is well known for his good service. Goshi is confident that, after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow better.

loans.use: to buy goats for her husband's butcher shop business.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela is a 37-year-old single mother of one child, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Currently, she operates a boutique which she has owned for 7 years. Her major challenge has been untimely settlement of debts. Pamela needs the loan to buy shirts, trousers, and women's wear for sale. Her dream is to set up a nursery school one day.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, and women's wear for sale.

loans.name: José De Arimatea

texts.es:
José tiene 34 años es casado y tiene 4 hijos, vive con su familia en Ibarra. José se describe como una persona honrada, trabajadora y feliz.

José trabaja con su cuñado en la albañilería, pegando cerámica, bloques. Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de bloques, cemento para acabar la construcción de su casa lo cual mejora la calidad de vida de su familia.

Su sueño es poder trabajar en grande construyendo casas para vender.
texts.en:
José, 34, is married and has four children.  He lives with his family in Ibarra.  José describes himself as an honest, hardworking, happy person.

José works with his brother-in-law in bricklaying, installing tile and concrete blocks.  This is the first time he’s worked with Fodemi and he’s asking for the loan to buy concrete blocks and cement to finish building his house which will improve his family’s quality of life.  His dream is to be able to work on a large scale building houses to sell.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Norma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 21,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Norma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Norma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 34 years old. She is a single mother of two children aged 18 and 17 years old. She operates a retail kiosk and has been in the business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of KES 5,000 from the business.

This is her third term loan from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase a solar panel to enhance lighting in her house. Her dream is to become a wholesale distributor.

loans.use: To purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: La señora Tania  vive en casa familiar, en la cual ya tiene su propia construcción, entre esa construcción tiene una tienda de fiambres y embutidos, en esta tienda la señora vende hace varios años atrás, es cliente de emprender hace dos años conforme fue creciendo su crédito también fue  diversificando los productos de su tienda, ahora ya tiene su negocio bien establecido, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para poder abastecer y surtir su tienda con la compra de embutidos de mayor, por estas fechas y fiestas de fin de año,  es donde mas demanda tiene y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Tania lives in the family home, where she now has her own structure, in which she has a cold cuts and sausages store. In this store she has been selling for a number of years.

She has been an Emprender client for two years, and as her line of credit began increasing, she began gradually diversifying her store's products. Now she has a well-established business.

On this occasion, she is applying for a loan to supply and stock her store by buying sausages at wholesale.  Around this time of year, and with the year-end holidays, is when she has the most demand, and this way she will increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy sausages at wholesale.

loans.name: Damasco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Damasco está conformado por  mujeres trabajadora y emprendedora  una de ellas es Ivania de 40 años quien vende nacatamales y  perfumes desde hace 6 años. Su meta es expandir el negocio con más clientes y por hacer autosuficiente al negocio.
Las otras integrantes son Claudia quien vende ropa y medicamentos naturales, Silvia  vende tamales pisque y vende ropa, y Emerita vende ropa y sandalias.
texts.en:
The Damasco Group is made up of hard-working and enterprising women, one of whom is 40-year-old Ivania who has been selling Nicaraguan tamales and perfume for six years.  Her goal is to expand her business with more customers and to make her business self sufficient.

The other group members are Claudia, who sells clothes and natural remedies, Silvia, who sells pisque tamales and clothes, and Emerita, who sells clothes and sandals.

loans.use: To buy corn, pork, basic grains, meat and clothes

loans.name: Wanjiku

texts.en:
Wanjiku is 53 years old, married and has six children.  She sells charcoal to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2000.  In addition, she does farming to supplement her income.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has been trained on financial management.  This has helped her in saving her money and budgeting.
Wanjiku hopes to open another outlet of her business in another region. She has requested for 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy charcoal.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 51, is a married woman with seven children, four of whom still attend school. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a "chapati" (flat bread) baking business. She sells at the market to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge in the low number of customers that turn up in the business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat and charcoal.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LAS NIEVES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ilda; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener más adelante un carro. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ilda is a member of the Virgen de Las Nieves communal bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Hilda, age 45, is in a common-law marriage and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells rice, sugar, milk, and oil.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

Her dream for later on is to have a car.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies wholesale.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies wholesale.

loans.name: Clare

texts.en:
Clare is 40 years old single and a mother of three children. She owns and runs a beauty salon in Bombolulu- Mombasa for the past three years. 

This is her second loan from KADET ltd of kes 40,000.She plans to use the loan to purchase new hair dryers, blow dryers, towels and hair chemicals for her salon. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and use the rest of the profits for the gradual expansion of her salon. 

She hopes open another branch and be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase new hair dryers, blow dryers, towels and hair chemicals.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, a mother of seven children and married to a farmer, has been selling fried fish and producing gari for sale in Asebu Ekrofu for seven years.   Mary, who is responsible for feeding her childiren, needs this loan to purchase cassava for her gari production and fresh fish to fry for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cassava for her gari production and fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Ronnel

texts.en:
Ronnel is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children.
 
Ronnel provides motorcycle services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 10,000 to buy tools (like a T-wrench and screw driver) and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Ronnel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Ronnel hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Sabougnouman Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe SABOUGNOUMAN III sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Manakoro, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka, région de Koulikoro.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, OUMOU, première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 130.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The six members of the Sabougnouman III group are married women, on average 33 years old with three children. Most of them live in polygamous households in Manakoro, one of the towns in the Guegneka commune in the Koulikoro region.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. They cultivate millet and peanuts. They are on their seventh collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Oumou, the first person standing on the right, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and to pay for labour to maintain about 0.75 hectares of peanuts.
The produce is sold in the city of Fana after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. Oumou intends to realize an average profit of about 130,000 FCFA for this cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizers, herbicide, hoeing, and small equipment.

loans.name: Etonam

texts.fr:
Etonam est mariée et a 26 ans. Elle est mère de 3 enfants et habite le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. 
Depuis 5 ans, devant le portail de la maison familiale, elle vend des produits de première nécessité  et des poissons fumés. Compte tenu de son faible fonds de roulement, elle est obligée de s’approvisionner 3 fois par semaine. 
Etonam sollicite ce crédit pour acheter un sac de maïs et 18 bols de haricots, ce qui lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de ses clients.
texts.en:
Etonam, age 26, is married with three children and she lives in the district of Adidogomé, in Lomé.


For the last five years, she has been selling staples and smoked fish in front of the family home. She has to replenish her stock three times a week due to her limited capital. 


Etonam is seeking this loan to buy one sack of maize and 18 bowls of beans, which will allow her to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of maize and 18 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Christian Obeng

texts.en: Christian is an ICS Manger in an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm company (Serendipalm) who lives in Akim-Asuom in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 37 years old, single with a child. Christian believes Organic Oil palm is sustainable and helps develop his community through job creation and infrastructural fair trade projects. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan so that he can buy a harvesting knife for pruning and harvesting of his oil palm field.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Matanat

texts.en:
Matanat has her own tailor\'s shop. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She enjoys with her work.
Hawing borrowed a loan of $500 she bought a lot of leather in order to sew on a machine stylish leather jackets.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to buy a bench for leather wares and a iron for leather wares.
This 47-year-old Matanat is single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of  Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in Surakhani region Yeni Guneshli settlement.

loans.use: To buy a bench for leather wares and an iron for leather wares

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace wants to increase the supply of building blocks by hiring at least three more lorries

loans.name: Maria Adriana

texts.en:
María Adriana is married and has three children of 9, 13 y 14 years of age. To better their quality of life, she and her husband began their own business. At first they sold plastic products, sweets and second hand items that were sold on rolling markets. Then, they set up a space in their home for the business and included the sales of dry goods and cleaning products. Fortunately, they have had very good results.

The union of their family has been the corner stone of the development of this business and to continue to grow, María is asking for a $475 dollar loan that she will use in the purchase of merchandise to increase the supplies of her store. She is committed to return this amount in a time frame of 6 to 12 months. Your help will be a great blessing for this family. Doubt this no longer, they are grateful for any help you can give them.

Translated from Spanish to English by Justina Jasper, Alescia Kennon and Beatriz Miles-Peterson (Glassboro High School’s Honors Spanish III Class) under the supervision of Patricia Yáñez

María Adriana es casada, tiene tres hijo de 9, 13 y 14 años de edad. Para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia inició, junto con su esposo, su propio negocio, primero vendía artículos de plástico, dulces y cosas usadas que comercializaban en los mercados rodantes. Después acondicionaron un lugar de su casa para su negocio e incorporaron la venta de mercería y artículos de limpieza, afortunadamente han tenido muy buenos resultados.

La unión de la familia ha sido pieza fundamental en el desarrollo de este negocio, y para continuar creciendo, Maria solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para tener mejor surtido su local, ella se compromete a regresa esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Tu ayuda será de gran bendición para esta familia, no lo dudes más, ellos agradecen cualquier ayuda que puedas brindarles.

loans.use:
Purchase of Merchandise
Compra de mercancía

loans.name: It

texts.en: Mrs. It S. lives in Kampong Cham Province with her husband.  She works as a grocer, earning $2.5 per day, while her husband is a farmer who makes palm sugar.  He can usually earn between $1 and $2 per day.  This loan will be used to purchase grocery products and the remainder of the loan will be used to buy tools and supplies for producing wine.

loans.use: To purchase grocery products and to make wine

loans.name: Asmakhanim

texts.en: This 47-year-old woman has her  own orchard. She is a mother of three children and lives in the Salyan region, Khaladj village. She has 10 years experience in this business. Asmakhanim is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy plot of land.

loans.use: to buy plot of land

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria L. lives in her parent's home in the Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood on the west side of La Paz, with her three children; Maria works for herself, making pants and warm-up suits that she sells to retail merchants in the city.

She has a bedroom, a small kitchen and a precarious bathroom. As she lacks space, Maria has put her sewing shop in her bedroom, resulting in an uncomfortable situation for her and her sons to do her work.

The loan she seeks is to refurbish a room that is deteriorating in order to use it as a tailor shop. This is the first time that she seeks a loan and the socioeconomic analysis resulted in a favorable score and she can obtain a loan. The social vision of our institution applies perfectly to this case and is an important factor in the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria L. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz, con sus tres hijos; la señora Maria trabaja por cuenta propia, elaborando pantalones y buzos deportivos que vende a comerciantes minoristas de la ciudad.

Actualmente tiene un dormitorio, una cocina pequeña y un baño precario. Por la falta de espacio, la señora tiene instalado el taller de costura en su dormitorio, ocasionándole incomodidad tanto en su desempeño laboral, como a sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de una habitación que se encuentra deteriorada para utilizarla como taller de costura. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. La visión social de nuestra institución se aplica perfectamente y es un factor importante en la resolución de crédito.

loans.use: Refurbish a room in order to use it as a tailor shop

loans.name: Mayja Beldith

texts.es:
Mayja belongs to the Communal Bank Atenas Portillanas. She lives at Jr. Sargento Lores Mz. B Lt. 06, Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo, in the Calleria district in Ucayali. She is 37-years-old and is the mother of two children, who are still minors. She is separated, which is why the income she had wasn't enough to cover her home's expenses. This is why Mayja, with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles, decided to invest in buying and selling fruit.

Currently, she has an Internet cafe, which she attends to with her children, who help her. She also shares the household chores with them so they can then open their business and devote their attention to their clients. With this loan of 1,000 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy a computer, a monitor, a keyboard, a printer, and their respective installation so she can supply her business and have a larger clientele. Mayja is very happy because her business is attracting a lot of customers. Her income is increasing along with the well-being of herself and her children, who are her reason for living. This is all thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Mayja pertenece al Banco Comunal Atenas Portillanas, vive en el Jr. Sargento Lores Mz. B Lt. 06, Asentamiento Humano Pedro Portillo del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 37 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, es separada, de tal modo que el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Mayja, con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la compra y venta de frutas.

En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio de alquiler de cabinas de internet, donde atiende junto con sus hijos que la apoyan, además también con ellos comparten las tareas de la casa para después abrir su local y dedicarse a la atención de sus clientes. Con el préstamo de S/. 1.000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará un CPU, un monitor, teclado, impresora, y sus respectiva instalación para implementar su negocio y su clientela crezca mas. Mayja está muy feliz, su negocio está captando mayor clientela. Sus ingresos están mejorando para el bienestar de ella y la de sus hijos, que son su razón de ser, y todo gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of assets (a computer, monitor, keyboard, and printer)

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mariama A. is 31 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. Her stall, from which she sells goods, is set up in front of her house. With this loan, she would like to buy 5 bags of rice, 3 boxes of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 3 boxes of soap and 5 boxes of canned goods. With this she will increase her stock and meet the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Mariama A. est âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Elle a installé la baraque dans laquelle elle vend ses marchandises devant leur maison. Elle désire par ce crédit acheter 05 sacs de riz, 03 cartons de sucres, 02 cartons de laits, 03cartons de savons et 05 boîtes de conserves afin d'augmenter son stock et satisfaire la demande de la clientelle

loans.use: With this loan, she would like to buy 5 bags of rice, 3 boxes of sugar, 2 boxes of milk, 3 boxes of soap and 5 boxes of canned goods to open a store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her green maize business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Ms. María belongs to the Santa Bárbara Communal Bank, located at Pasaje Mariano Cárdenas N° 135, in the Calleria district of the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and mother of three children. Her husband, a musician, lost his right leg in an accident. She invested the first loan obtained from Manuela Ramos -of S/. 300- in building rooms to be rented.

She presently runs a room rental business, and rents sound equipment as well. In conjunction to tending to her tenants, when her equipment is rented, she takes care of it herself.

With this loan of S/. 3000, to be repaid in five months, she will invest in the purchase of wood, corrugated iron, nails, paint, an electric organ, etc.

María is very happy. In spite of her husband’s difficulties to walk, they are both able to work. Her business is starting to attract more clients and her income is growing. All of her efforts are directed at having a better future next to her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Pasaje Mariano Cárdenas N° 135, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 3 hijos. Su esposo, que es músico, perdió su pierna derecha en un accidente. El primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la construcción de cuartos para alquilar.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio de alquiler de cuartos, asi como alquiler de equipos de sonido. Realiza sus labores en conjunto con la atención de sus inquilinos, y cuando sus equipos son requeridos, ella misma se ocupa de eso.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de madera, calaminas, clavos, pintura, un órgano eléctrico, etc.

María está muy feliz. Pese a que su esposo tiene dificultades para caminar, esto no es impedimento para que ambos trabajen. Su negocio está empezando a captar mayores clientes, sus ingresos aumentan y todo el esfuerzo que realiza es para tener un futuro mejor a lado de sus seres más queridos.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and an electric organ.

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay S. is 39 years old and the mother of six children,. She and her husband have lived in Kampong Cham province for many years. She is an entrepreneur who supports her family by running two businesses with her husband. Everyday she goes from door to door in her village, earning about $3 a day selling rice. Her husband raises chickens and sells them at the local market, making about $4 a day. Two of their children are married and live away from home. One has a small business selling sugar cane juice in front of their house. On average, this child makes less than $1 per day. The rest of the children are students.

Lay S. has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy more rice to sell, and will use the balance of the funds to buy chickens and ducks to breed. By doing this, she believes that she can earn much more money and provide her children with an education. (Husband is pictured here because his wife is not available when the photo was taken.)

loans.use: To purchase more rice to sell, and chickens and ducks to breed.

loans.name: Kimmatoi

texts.en: K. Kimmatoi was born in 1979 in the J.Ismoil region of Tajikistan. She is married and has 2 children. Mrs. K. Kimmatoi has been raising livestock for 13 years so she started when she was a young girl helping her mother taking care of the flock. Now Mrs. K. Kimmatoi is married and helps her husband with the animal care and milk making. She trades the milk to fellow villagers and at the local bazaar.  It is only a part time business beacuse Mrs. K. Kimmatoi also works as a schoolteacher in the rural school. Now Mrs. K. Kimmatoi applies to KIVA to for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina decided many years ago to earn her living caring for her animals, always with a desire to increase the number of animals she owns while also improving her production of potatoes and ulloco, another root vegetable commonly consumed in Andean South America. Her efforts are always centered on sustaining her 4 minor children, who depend economically on her and her husband. With them in mind, she is now applying for a loan with which to meet her growth goals in livestock and crop production. You can support Celestina so that her wishes become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Celestina, hace muchos años optó por dedicarse a las tareas del cuidado de sus animales con el deseo de incrementar la cantidad de ganado que posee y también de mejorar su producción de papa y de olluco, siempre sus esfuerzos están concentrados en sostener a sus 4 menores hijos que dependen económicamente de ella y su esposo, por ese motivo ahora solicita un préstamo para lograr el objetivo que se ha propuesto. Vosotros podéis apoyar a Celestina para que sus anhelos se conviertan en realidad.

loans.use: Injection of capital into her agricultural business.

loans.name: Liz Lery

texts.es:
Liz pertenece al Banco Comunal Solidaridad, Jr. Cayetano heredia Mz b Lt 11, del Distrito de Yarinacocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 30 años y es madre soltera de 1 niño. Vive con sus padres. Para no depender de sus padres decide poner un negocio que consiste en comprar fierros y calaminas para fabricar canaletas, ventana de fierro, para ello hace un préstamo a Manuel Ramos el monto de S/. 300.00 En la actualidad tiene una mini empresa de fabricación ubicada en su propio domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su padre y él dirige la obra. Liz se dedica a la atención de sus clientes todo el día para lo cual se levanta a las 6 am., al mismo tiempo que se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, a partir de las 8:00 am hasta las 6: 00pm atiende su negocio. . Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,100, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 30 fierros, 20 planchas de calaminas y 5 baldes de pintura. Liz esta muy feliz, se siente muy bien porque así puede educar a su hijo, esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda su padre y la confianza que pone Manuela Ramos en ella.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Liz belongs to the Banco Communal Solidaridad located in the District of Yarinacocha in the Department of Ucayali. She is 30 years old and is a single mother with one child; she currently lives with her parents. In order to not depend on her parents she decided to open a business in which she buys iron and tin to manufacture gutters and iron framed windows. In order to continue this she is asking for a loan from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles. She currently has a mini manufacturing company located in her home where she is supported by her father who directs the work. Liz focuses on caring for her clients all day long from 8am to 6pm; in the morning she gets up at 6am and does household chores until it is time to care for her business. With her most recent loan from Manuela Ramos of 1100 soles (which will be paid in 5 months) she will buy 30 iron rods, 20 sheets of tin and 5 buckets of paint. Liz is very happy because she will be able to educate her child; she is very grateful for the support offered by her father and the trust that Manuela Ramos places in her.

loans.use: Purchase of iron, tin and paint

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sophorn is a farmer who lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. She is married and lives with her husband and their eight children. Two of the children are married, and the others are young. Sophorn and her husband work hard every day to support their large family. She grows rice crops in the rainy season; this is a main source of income for her family.

Now it is the rainy season and time for farming. Sophorn is preparing to grow rice, but she lacks necessary capital. She needs to pay for plowing and fertilizer, so now she is requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000 ($500 USD) to support her efforts.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and fertilizer

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: This is the third time that Mrs. Chet V. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions.  She is a teacher in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, and she can make $30 per month which is very little to support her family. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Pok Samorn, is a government officer in the Tax Department in the provincial town. Mrs. Chet V.'s neighbor wants to sell a piece of land at a reasonable price, so Mrs. Chet V. wants to buy it to then resell later at a better price. Therefore, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings, and achieve this goal. Mrs. Chet V. is 54 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending school. Previously, Mrs. Chet V. had obtained a loan to buy pigs for breeding. She has fully paid it back.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land and then resell later at a better price.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est âgé de 70 ans, marié e père de 5 enfants. Il est acheteur de produits café et cacao à Danyi, un village situé à environ 175 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Kossi détient cette activité depuis sa jeunesse et il maîtrise tous les rouages du métier. Il souhaite par ce crédit acheter plus de produits pour la revente. Monsieur Kossi compte sur cette opportunité pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Kossi A., age 70, is married and the father of 5 children. He buys and resells coffee and cocoa products in Danyi, a village located approximately 175 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Kossi has been in this business since his youth, and he masters all of its ins and outs. With this loan, he wishes to buy more products for resale. Mr. Kossi is counting on this opportunity to better provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffee and cocoa for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma A., 42 years old, is from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has two children, 18 and 20 years old.  Since 2000, Fatuma has been earning income selling snacks on the street. She sells items such as samosas (meat and/or vegetables wrapped in a thin dough and deep fried) and vitafunwa (slightly sweetened, poofy, deep-fried pancakes made of rice flour). Fatuma works 1 to 4 hours a day, 6 days a week. Currently, she needs a loan of US$250 in order to purchase additional raw materials, including flour, in order to increase her production. Fatuma thanks everyone for their support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for a food-sales business

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha T., 45, and her husband, Mr. Vit Ses, 47, live along national road number one about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1983 and have six children: three sons and three daughters. Two of them are married and live outside the family house, one child is a garment factory worker and other three children stay at home.

Sokha has been selling porridge and Cambodian cake for seven years. She buys meat and ingredient from Koki market to cook and sell in front of her house. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for twenty years. He drives people from his village to Koki market. Sokha and her family members live in an old house some part of which is broken (see the picture) but the couple lacks the money to repair it. Therefore, Sokha is requesting a loan of $ 1000 to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
G. Nazokat is 35 years old. She is married with three children. Nazokat has a tailoring business at her home. Her business is sewing a national raincoat called “Chapan” for men and women. Her workmanship is very good and she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business.

Nazokat has had this business for 10 years and this is her fifth loan from IMON International. With her loan, she will buy more fabric and embroidery materials. She smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses, and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it remains a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war that ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase materials for sewing national raincoats

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng A. works making incense in the Takeo province, and earns $2 per day. She is 40 years old; she and her husband (pictured) have four children. Her husband earns $5 per day working as a motor-taxi driver. Chen A. plans to use this loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband's taxi service.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike to operate a taxi service

loans.name: Confort

texts.fr: Madame Confort M. est née le 24/06/1970 à Accra au Ghana. Elle vit avec son époux et leurs deux (02) enfants dans la ville d’aného où elle fait le commerce des vêtements pour hommes  et du parfum. Pour développer son commerce et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants, elle sollicite un crédit. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires et ses bénéfices.
texts.en:
Ms. Confort M. was born on June 24, 1970 in Accra, Ghana. She lives with her husband and their two children in the city Aného, where she does commerce in men’s clothing and in perfumes. To develop her commerce and to ensure her children’s education, she is requesting a loan. This will enable her to increase her sales figures and her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell clothing and perfume

loans.name: Majengo "a" Street Group

texts.en:
Oliva has been a businesswoman in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 8 years. She belongs to Majengo "A" sreet group loan. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Oliva is 34 years old and married.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Meresiana, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items in order to expand her business

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 42 year old Man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. He has owned a phone shop for a year and a half. Nizar also sells recharge phone cards. He requests a loan of $2500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase recharge cards. This is the first time Nizard has requested a loan.

Nizar is speciA. in his work because he has competitive prices. His clients can be anybody. When Nizar first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Purchase recharge phone cards.

loans.name: Bennett

texts.en: Bennett O. is a 39-year-old, married, father of four children. Currently, he is a boda-boda driver in Kisumu, a port city in western Kenya. A boda-boda is a bike with a platform above the back wheel that the customer can sit on. Riding a boda-boda is the most common way of getting around. Bennet is asking for a loan of 20,000 KES (US$275) to purchase a motorbike (known here as a piki-piki) and to help sick people in his community. Bennett says the boda-boda business is tough.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Искандарова Раъно, кредитор в Микроинвест с 2003 года. Она раньше занималась торговлей детской одежды, а на сегодня она  изменила свой бизнес на продажу ковровых товаров. Она торгует в отделе  магазина «Импульс» в городе Худжанде. Ей помогает её муж , который привозит товар с Коврового Кайраккумского комбината. Для закупа новых моделей шерстяных  ковров  Раъно подала заявку на займ. За шесть лет кредитования у Раъно улучшилось семейное положение, сосотояние. Она, смогла устроить, своего сына учится в Университет. Раъно благодарна KIVA  за сотрудничество.
texts.en:
Rano I. has been a loan client of MicroInvest since 2003. In the past, she has sold children's clothing, but today she has switched over to the sale of carpets. She sells out of a department in a store called Impulse in the city of Khujand. Her husband assists her by delivering the goods from the Kayrakkum carpet center. Rano has applied for a loan to purchase new woolen carpets. In the six years Rano has been a loan client, she has improved her family's circumstances and standard of living, and was able to arrange for her son to study at the university. Rano is grateful to Kiva for the collaboration.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Carpet sales

loans.name: Agafia

texts.en:
The meat market for Agafia had its start in 2000 as a small family business. She opened a store for meat and dairy in 2005, which served local residents and restaurants as a purveyor of fine meats. With the urging of her frequent customers, she decided to increase her stock of goods. Microinvest helps Agafia to buy all she needs.

Agafia thanks Microinvest for financial support and trust.

loans.use: To increase her stock of goods

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth D. is from the town of Lumbia, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 34 years old. Maribeth is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Maribeth owns and operates a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from peddling household materials and products such as mats, blankets, plates, etc. in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Maribeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and for her family's needs.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 36 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. Mercy owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2008, Mercy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a young cow

loans.name: Dora Okumu

texts.en:
Dora makes a living by selling small dried fish called omena. She also sells maize at her store in the market in Rongo, Kenya. She has been running this business for over forty-five years!

Dora is now 65 years old, and has been married for the whole time that she has had her business. Both of Dora’s children passed away, and now she is caring for the six grandchildren left behind. She pays their school fees, buys their clothes, and pays for all of their needs.

Dora says that the stock of her business is down and that she would like to boost her supply in order to get her profit levels up again. She wants to save some money every month so that she can have an emergency reserve.

The most important thing to Dora is to provide a good life for her grandchildren. She hopes that they are as smart and successful as their parents were before the passed away—one was a doctor and one was a teacher.

loans.use: To buy a large variety of vegetables

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort E. sells gari, which she prepares using cassava. She buys the cassava in large quantities, mills it and fries it to get the gari, which she sells at the market in Elmina. Comfort has no educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a cleaner. Comfort has been selling gari since 1980. She contributes to the upkeep of her family. Her loan will be used to buy more cassava to fry for sale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more cassava

loans.name: Evelinda

texts.en:
Evelinda is a tricycle operator in the village of Andres Bonifacio, Diffun, Quirino. She is young and full of determination. Being an operator of a tricycle is risky but Evelyn does not care because she needs the additional income for her family to survive.

According to Evelinda, the family's daily needs are met by her passenger tricycle. For this reason, she would like a loan of PHP 5,000 to be able to buy new sprockets and other parts needed for her tricycle. Evelinda and her husband are thankful because they are blessed with three children: Maria Erika, 10 years-old and in grade five, Roselyn Jade, 7 years-old and in grade two and Danilo Jr., who is 3 years-old. She hopes that she will be able to get the loan in order the help the family.

loans.use: To purchase tricycle parts

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: N. Jane is operating the clothes business in Kampala town. She is a business woman of twenty-eight years old. She is living with the husband and they have five children. She has been doing the business for over four years. Her husband has a furniture workshop. She is using the loan to put more clothes for the season especially she is targeting Christmas season because people tend to buy more and more clothe in this season. She wishes to renovate her house and enlarge on her business.

loans.use: To put more clothes for the season especially she is targeting Christmas season

loans.name: Ray

texts.es:
Ray tiene 41 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos, siendo el mayor de ellos quien lo apoya en su negocio y los tres restantes estudian. Él cuenta en su propia casa con un taller de soldadura, vulcanizadora y venta de repuestos para motos y motocarros, negocio donde viene trabajando desde hace 2 años.  Asimismo, desde hace 3 años tiene dos motocarros, los cuales son manejados por chóferes particulares que brindan el servicio de transporte de pasajeros y le entregan las ganancias del día. Lo que le gusta a Ray de su trabajo es sentirse como un doctor de motos, porque no hay un día que deje de atender una moto malograda y tiene que repararla bien para garantizar su trabajo. Para un futuro cercano, quiere implementar su negocio con la instalación de un lavadero de vehículos.
Este es su 3er crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y se llevan muy bien entre todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más repuestos de motos para incrementar el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Ray, 41, lives with his wife and four children. The oldest child helps him in the business, and the three other children go to school. He has his own house with a shop for soldering, repairing tires, and selling replacement parts for motorcycles and “motocarros” (three wheeled motorized vehicles). He has been working in this business for two years. For three years he has had two “motocarros”, which are driven by private drivers who offer transportation services. They give him daily earnings. What Ray likes about his work is feeling like a motorcycle doctor. Not a day goes by that he does not have to tend to a motorcycle that has broken down. He needs to repair it well to guarantee his work. In the near future, he wants to set up his business with a car wash. This is his third loan with MFP. What he likes about his communal bank is that all of the members are responsible people, and they get along very well with each other. He will use the money he is now asking for to buy more motorcycle parts to increase the stock in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy motorcycle parts

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice N. is 46 years old and is a widow with two children aged 24 and 30. She lives in Kicukiro district in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda.

Beatrice has been an entrepreneur for some time now, starting her business in 2005. Her popular shop employs three people. She has a lot of experience in decoration activities. Her store is open from 9 a.m. - 7 p.m. each day.

This is Beatrice’s first loan with Vision Finance Company. This loan will allow her to purchase more inventory and different types of decorations for sale and for rent which will help her to attract more customers and, hopefully, more profits.

Beatrice currently hopes to make monthly profits of over 100,000 RWF (approximately USD 175). She wants to build her business to give herself a secure future in her old age.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and different types of decorations for sale and rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items for her restaurant

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Al negocio del señor Miguel Ángel G. le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía de temporada de invierno ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que venda ropa de frío.
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar mercancía, que esta negocio es la fuente de ingreso de el y de su mamá que es una persona ya mayor de edad y está bajo su responsabilidad.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que con está inversión su negocio va a tener más ingreso.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel Gonzalez's business is lacking variety of merchandise for the winter season and his customers are requesting for cold weather clothing. He is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise. This business is the source of income for him and his mother, a senior citizen who is under his responsibility. He plans to pay off the loan with a portion of the earnings from his business since with this loan the business will create larger profits.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Winter Merchandise

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is 25 years old and is married with one child. He runs a pharmacy business in Nablus, a city in Palestine. Nour wants to use the loan to increase his supply of medicines and to include items that are frequently demanded by his customers. He hopes to earn a good income to take care of his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Increased supply of medicines

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo (Crisanto), de 42 años; juntos tienen 3 pequeños hijos: Leonela de 11, Luz de 8 y Jefferson de 5 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia en una tranquila zona de la sierra del Perú.

Desde muy pequeña Maria aprendió que solo se puede salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. Ella era una comerciante que viajaba frecuentemente para vender su mercadería, pero al darse cuenta que sus niños empezaron a bajar sus calificaciones, esto la mortificó mucho, por lo que decide implementar un negocio en su propia vivienda, y no tuvo mejor idea que empezar el negocio de venta de comida, ya que su sala era amplia y casi perfecta para el  proyecto. Actualmente, también vende algunos productos comestibles, como una bodega y en un solo local tiene dos negocios muy rentables, pues en la zona no hay competencia.
Así trabaja Maria desde hace más de un año, casi sin descanso, le va muy bien y es por eso que está muy satisfecha con su negocio. Y como si fuera poco, durante los fines de semana vende desayunos, para esto cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien la suple en la atención cuando ella debe salir.

Este es el séptimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy satisfecha con el apoyo brindado, por lo que promete ser responsable con cada uno de sus pagos. Además manifiesta que el trabajo de su banco comunal es muy importante para el éxito y progreso de todos. Maria tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en un nuevo negocio junto a su esposo, que sería una llantería (venta y cambio de llantas), ya que para cumplir sus metas no existe fatiga ni impedimento.
texts.en:
Maria (35) is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband, Crisanto (42), and their three small children: Leonela (11), Luz (8) and Jefferson (5). They live in their own house in a quiet area of the Peruvian mountains. From an early age, Maria learned that success comes only through hard work and dedication. She worked as a traveling sales representative; however, she was mortified to discover that her children's grades were beginning to fall, so she decided to set up a business in her own house. She opened a small restaurant in her own living room, which is spacious and ideal for this purpose. She also sells groceries, so on the same premises she has two very profitable businesses, since there is no competition in the area. Maria has had this business for over a year; things are going well and she is very satisfied with the results. Moreover, on weekends she serves breakfasts with the help of her husband, who takes over the business when she has to go out. This is her seventh loan from MFP and she is very happy with the support she has received; she promises to repay punctually. Maria also considers that the community bank is very important for everyone to succeed and improve their situation. She plans to invest the money in a new business with her husband: a tire store, where they will sell and change tires. They are determined to work hard to achieve their goals.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a new business

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en: Jaafar is a 34-year-old married man with one unemployed child. He has been working in computer maintenance since 1999. Today, Jaafar is requesting to borrow $1,200 to renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: To renovate his shop

loans.name: Abdulkodir
