texts.ru: Джалилов Абдулкодир проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Джалилов Абдулкодир работает в области торговли более 15 лет. Он продает продукты в собственом магазине. Кредит барет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdulkodir D. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has 2 children. Abdulkodir has been working in the retail field for over 15 years. He sells food products in his own store. He is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.en:
Telesforo G. Sr. is from the village of Parog Parog in Solana, Cagayan. He is 54 years old. Telesforo is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Telesforo planting, harvesting, and selling rice. Telesforo has been engaged in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month frp, these activities.

In 2009, Telesforo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Telesforo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from ASKI. Telesforo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. This will be Telesforo's third loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima N. is a married woman with four sons. She is a busy entrepreneur who has been running a sari-sari store for almost two years. Her husband, Rodrigo, is also an entrepreneur in the community. To continue to build her business, Maxima is seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($350) to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store. More specifically, she is planning to purchase additional products such as rice, cases of beer, and charcoal. Maxima believes that offering a wider assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and will maintain customer loyalty. Her dreams are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her grandchildren so that they can finish their studies all the way through college.

Since 2008, Maxima has been a committed member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines. Indeed, Maxima has been a model member by regularly attending her weekly meetings and by promptly repaying her prior loans. Through hard work and determination, Maxima is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders.

About ASHI: ASHI has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank's approach of providing credit to the poor people of the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the pioneers of microfinance in the country.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her store's inventory of rice, beer, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Las Emprenderdoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal LAS EMPRENDEDORAS, en su Secuencia 2, está formado por 8 clientes, todas mujeres, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. San Antonio Alto, que están ubicados por donD. se encuentra el sindicato D. Minibuses y Colectivos "Simón Bolívar"  y sus alrededores las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, D. ropa libros cuadernos cosméticos, jugos D. fruta. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción D. dos socias que pagaron con atrasos, las cuales fueron retiradas del banco. En cuanto a su historial D. créditos no tienen días D. mora.
 
La Sra. Ruth Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos D. Yanbal por catalogo y por mayor cuenta con esta actividad hace 2 años, el préstamo será destinado a la inversión en sus pedidos cada 20 días, contando con una buena cartera D. clientes. Casada con el señor Benedicto, que trabaja en la Republica D. Argentina como costurero, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen D. la socia.  En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

La Sra. Juana  Socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. material escolar en una librería ubicada en la Av. Josefa Mujia,  se dedica a esta actividad hace 1 año, el préstamo esta destinado a la compra D. material escolar por mayor. Casada con el señor Javier que trabaja como empleado en la empresa FADERPA, tiene 1 hija Es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado con sus compañeras. 

La Sra. Carla activa y dinámica para la redacción es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la costura D. ropa y también a la venta D. anticuchos en los locales D. fiesta D. Villa Copacabana, el préstamo esta destinado para la compra D. tela y otros insumos para la elaboración D. ropa.

Todas las socias estan agradecidoas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Las Emprendedora (Entrpreneurs) Communal bank, in its second loan cycle, is formed by 8 clients, all women. Most of the members live in the San Antonio Alto area, which is located near the Simón Bolívar minibus and group taxi union. The members are engaged in the sale of diverse products in the surrounding area such as clothing, books, school supplies, cosmetics, and fruit juice.

In the previous cycle, most members paid on time, though a few were late, and their payments were covered by the communal bank. Insofar as the communal bank’s credit history is concerned, there are no late payments.

Sra. Ruth represents the group. Currently, she is the president of the bank. She is engaged in the sale of Yanbal cosmetics via catalogue (the products are in a catalogue which she shows to her customers) and at wholesale. She has counted on this business for two years. She will invest the loans in ordering her stock every 20 days, relying on a steady clientele for purchases.

Ruth is married to Señor Benedicto, who works in Argentina as a tailor. She has two dependent children. In her communal bank, she is known as a responsible person who is punctual with her payments.

Sra. Juana is the member who is the treasurer of the bank. She is engaged in the sale of school supplies in a bookstore located in Josefa Mujia Avenue. She has been involved in this business for a year. She will use the loan to purchase school supplies at wholesale. Juana is married to Señor Javier, who is employed by FADERPA, an auto parts business. She has one daughter. Ruth has been selected for the post of treasurer because she has shown her colleagues how responsible she is.

Sra. Carla, an active and dynamic women, was selected a secretary of the communal bank. She is involved in sewing clothing and also sells anticuchos (beef heart kabobs) at the Villa Copacabana festival. She will use the loan to purchase fabric and other raw material for making clothing.

All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown to them by making the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama W. is married and has five dependents. She has received a senior high education. Ama sells salt by moving from house to house and customer to customer in and around Jukwa. She has been selling salt for quite some time now. Ama uses the income she generates from her selling of salt to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  

Ama will use the loan to purchase provisions to sell in her already built shop, which is in addition to her salt business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Ama will use the loan to purchase provisions to sell in her already built shop

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Rebecca L. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called 'God’s Blessing'. She is 48 years old, married with 3 children ranging in age from 9 to 32 years old. She could not continue her education through 7th grade.

For 10 years Rebecca has been sewing and into pastry at the Bassa Town in Paynesville, Liberia. She sews very well for her customers and at a low cost in order to encourage them to continue patronizing her business.

Rebecca started sewing when she graduated from trade school where she studied sewing. And she was given a sewing machine on credit that she did work on and paid back.

She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cloth and materials for sewing. Her goal is to grow her business to a larger size and to improve the living conditions of her family.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Rebecca is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more cloth and materials for sewing.

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es: José Mauricio M. D.  de 53 años de edad, posee una tienda de productos comestibles, la cual esta ubicada en la ciudad de Soyapango, lugar en el cual también se ubica su hogar y en donde vive junto a su esposa la cual se encarga de administrar la tienda, así mismo vive junto a su nieto de 4 años de edad. El negocio esta ubicado sobre calle principal, así mismo es la única tienda que se encuentra en los alrededores, por lo que cuenta con mucha clientela fija, la cual compra a diario. Esto es de mucho beneficio para José ya que el negocio es bastante estable, es por esta razón que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar productos alimenticios como pan, café, pollo, huevos, ya que en la actualidad con lo que más cuenta es con golosinas y bebidas. Poder mejorar el negocio es de mucha importancia para José debido a que es la única fuente de ingresos que posee, razón por la cual él desea mucho mejorarlo para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
José Mauricio M. D. is 53 years old and has a grocery store located in the city of Soyapango. His house is located in this same city. He lives with his wife, who is in charge of running the store, and his 4-year-old grandson. The business is located on the main street, and is also the only store found in the area, which lets him depend upon many regular customers who go there to do their daily shopping. This is very beneficial for José and has made his business rather stable. He is asking for a loan to buy products such as bread, coffee, chicken, and eggs, as right now he mainly has sweets and beverages. It is very important to José to improve his business since it is his only source of income. He desires to improve it in order to achieve higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread, coffee, chicken, and eggs

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio M. Diaz es un señor de 45 años el cual vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos.



Don Julio se ha  dedicado  toda su vida  a la agricultura,  pero la cría de cerdo  para engorde ha sido uno de sus principales actividades en la cual ya tiene 10 años de experiencia. El Asegura que este siempre ha sido una buena fuente de ingresos ya que en la comunidad reconocen la calidad de producto.

Por ahora Don Julio  desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢606000 (seiscientos seis mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condiciones de cuido e Infraestructura. Con este préstamo espera alcanzar su meta de tener 50 cerdos para engorde y aprovechar el buen precio que tiene el producto en este momento, para asi aumentar las ventas y  mejorar sus condiciones económicas. 


Don Julio forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su primer préstamo y asegura que será de mucho beneficio para su negocio, y espera seguir participando mas activamente con la empresa de crédito Comunal.
texts.en:
Julio M. Diaz, 45, lives with his wife and five children in a rural community in Costa Rica called Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is located 150 kilometers south of San José province, Costa Rica’s capital. It is 850 meters above sea level. It is an agricultural area where vegetables, coffee and other products are farmed; in addition, there are other activities like pig and cattle raising. Julio has been a farmer all his life but for the last 10 years he has also raised pigs. He assures us that this has always been a good source of income because the quality of his product is well recognized in the community. For now, Julio wants to obtain a microcredit in the amount of 600000 colones to buy more pigs and improve their care and infrastructure. With this loan he will reach his goal of having 50 pigs to raise so that he can take advantage of the good prices this product currently commands thereby increasing sales and improving his economic conditions. Julio is a member of Bancruce communal bank one of EDESA’s 100 member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his 1st loan and he assures us that it will be of great benefit for his business; he hopes to continue participating more actively with his communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Zafiro Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama  “Zafiro” nombre elegido por ser una piedra preciosa. Todos ellos viven en la ranchería Vainilla, Nacajuca, Tabasco. Esta integrado por dos hombres y tres mujeres. Efrén C. T., su negocio es una frutería. Rodolfo P. G. se dedica a la venta de zapatos marca impuls. Rosa O. H. se dedica a vender quesos de manera ambulante a las abarroteras del municipio de Nacajuca. María Esperanza F. L. el crédito lo quiere para poner una tiendita en su domicilio. Brenda del Carmen F. O. se dedica a la venta de zapatos para dama, viaja al estado de Yucatán para comprar su mercancía y la vende de manera ambulante y también por pedidos que le hacen sus clientes fijos. 

Don Efrén es el representante del grupo, es casado, tiene 4 hijos. Efrén  tiene su frutería de nombre “La Frutana” local ubicado en las afueras del mercado público del municipio de Nacajuca, negocio familiar que atiende junto con su esposa e hijos, antes  su esposa trabajaba en una frutería que era de su hermana,  hace  4 años  decidieron tener una propia. Su negocio les rinde ganancias que le ayudan  para la educación de sus hijos. 

Con este crédito,  quiere comprar papaya, calabaza, tomate, frijol, cebolla, melón, manzana, piña, cilantro, pera, guineo (plátano), uva, pera, también frijol, maíz, cilantro, pasta, etc.  Su meta para el futuro es dar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos y que estos terminen una carrera universitaria. 

Son un grupo familiar entusiasta, muy unidos, emprendedores con deseos de superarse.  Están muy contentos  y se sienten afortunados por la ayuda que  le brinda la Fundación y KIVA al creer en sus negocios, al otorgarles un crédito que les servirá para invertirlo en cada una de sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
This group is called “Zafiro” [Sapphire], and this name was chosen because it is a precious stone. All of them live in the town of Vainilla, Nacajuca, Tabasco. It is composed of two men and three women. Efrén C. T. sells fruits. Rodolfo P. G. sells Impuls brand shoes. Rosa O. H. sells cheeses by going from grocery store to grocery store in the municipality of Nacajuca. María Esperanza F. L. wants to use the loan to open a small store in her house. Brenda del Cármen F. O. sells women’s shoes. She goes to the state of Yucatán to buy her merchandise and then sells as a traveling merchant and also fills orders from regular customers. Efrén is a representative of the group. He is married and has 4 children. Efrén has a fruit store named “La Frutana”, which is located on the outer edges of the public market in the municipality Nacajuca. It is a family business that he tends to with the help of his wife and children. His wife used to work in a fruit store that belongs to her sister. Four years ago they decided to open their own store. The business provides them income that helps them with their children’s education expenses. With this loan Efrén wants to buy papaya, squash, tomatoes, beans, onion, cantaloupes, apples, pineapples, cilantro, pears, bananas, grapes, corn, pasta, etc. His goal for the future is to provide a better standard of living for his children and for them to finish university. This is a family-oriented group that is enthusiastic, united, hardworking, and with a great desire to get ahead. They are very happy and feel fortunate because of the support the Foundation and Kiva provide them by believing in their businesses and granting them a loan that will allow them to invest in each of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy papaya, squash, tomatoes, beans, onion, cantaloupes, apples, pineapples, cilantro, pears, bananas, grapes, corn, pasta, etc.

loans.name: Ruth Rocio

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Ruth; ella tiene 30 años de edad y la socia es soltera y se dedica a su trabajo de lleno, ella trabaja en el municipio de Oropesa y le gusta mucho todo lo que aprende cada día, ella es una mujer muy empeñosa y disfruta mucho su trabajo, pero la socia también le ayuda a su mamá que vende granos los fines de semana en el mercado de Angostura, ella es muy buena hija y desea para su mamá lo mejor, sabe que su ammá disfruta lo que hace y por eso le deja que mantenga su negocio de venta de granos y los fines de seman le ayuda. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar el negocio chico de su mamá, ellas le compran a lso proveedores de granos al por mayor para la venta. 

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y de este modo seguir creciendo y apoyando a su madre; así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The client belongs to the “Purified Virgen – Angostura” communal bank. She lives in the district of Angostura, in the province of Saylla, department of Cusco. The client is Ruth and she is 26 years old. She is single and works full time. She works in the municipality of Oropesa and she likes everything that she learns everyday. She is a very dedicated person and enjoys her job very much. She also helps her mother, who sells grains at the Angostura market on the weekends. She is a very good daughter and wants the best for her mother. She knows that her mother enjoys what she does, so she lets her keep running her grain-selling business and helps on the weekends. She is requesting a loan to buy more inventory for her mother's small business, they buy in bulk from local grain providers and then resell the grains. This client values and is infinitely grateful for the loan granted to her, since it will allow her to grow and continue to support her mother. She promises to make her payments in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Genaro Ceguera le esta haciendo falta el vitropiso en la cocina de su casa, pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo y así poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona se encargara de la colocación del piso. 
Don Genaro tiene dos hijos de edad escolar a quines les quiere dar lo mejor y que tengan un lugar decente don de vivir. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en un centro comercial como panadero.
texts.en:
Mr. Genaro Ceguera needs a tiled floor in his kitchen but he does not have the money to make the improvement. He is requesting the loan to buy the material and pay the contractor for the installation of the floor. Mr. Genaro Ceguera has two school age children. He wants them to have a decent place to live and he wants to give them the best in life. He plans to repay the loan with the income he earns from his job as a baker at a mall.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of a tile floor in his kitchen

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles O. M. is 24 years old, married and has a one-year-old son, whom they hope to educate to university level. Charles' business is located at Kachok junction in Kisumu, a strategic location along the road. He has been making menswear and selling to local men. He also sells household goods such as flour, sugar, milk and soap. He has been running this business for three years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has are financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy materials for making menswear and restocking his inventory of flour, sugar, soap and milk. He hopes to be a wholesaler in the future. He describes himself as hardworking, social, humble and respectful.

loans.use: to buy materials for making menswear and to restock household goods to sell

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Miss Rana N. (in the photo with her widowed mother), is single and lives with her mother, sisters, and brothers in a village along National Road Number One, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her mother is farmer. 

Rana is a teacher and a tailor. One of her brothers is learning tailoring, so she is asking for her second loan of US$ 500 to pay fees for her brother. She will also use a part of her loan to help capitalize her mother's farming business.

loans.use: To pay fees for her brother who is learning tailoring  and help capital her mother’s farming business

loans.name: Maisha Plus Group

texts.en: Albert O. is the manager of the group “Maisha Plus” made up of 17 members who have firmly united to receive loans from the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses. Albert O. runs a drugstore in the western surburb of Kinshasa. He started his business in 2005. With hard work, good management and Hope’s loans, his business has prospered. He is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC and has already received six loans -- all of them repaid properly. Albert intends to use the next loan to buy medicine needed by his customers, and add to his working capital. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $60. His ambition is to expand his business by opening drugstores in other places. Albert is 36 years old, married and the father of a one-year-old-child.

loans.use: to purchase medicine needed by his customers

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus J. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 51 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling vegetables in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jesus joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia es cliente antigua, ella quedo viuda hace dos años, tiene un hijo en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de varios productos en su tienda que se halla bien surtida, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, ya que desde muy joven se hizo cargo de la tienda, en la casa donde vive se encuentra su mamá y hermano que comparten algunos gastos familiares, es esta última temporada ella se dedico también a la venta de comida por las noches, en una tienda alquilada por la misma zona, y precisamente el crédito invertirá en la compra de enseres y refrigerador para ese ambiente, así como productos alimenticios para el preparado de las comidas. Es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable por lo que se solicita este tratamiento preferencial de la tasa kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is a long-time Emprender client. She has remained a widow for two years and has a child of school age. She sells several products in her well-stocked store. She is a very hard worker, since when she was very young she took over the store. Her mother and brother live with her to share some of the family expenses. This last season, she also sold food at night in a rented tent in the same neighborhood. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of furniture and a refrigerator for the store, as well as food stuffs for meal preparation. Sonia is a very hardworking and responsible person, why is why she is seeking this loan with preferential rates through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and groceries

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel M. is from the village of Sto. Domingo, Echague, Isabela. She is 35 years old. Isabel is married and has three school-aged children. Isabel owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a motorcycle transport business. Isabel has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2010, Isabel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Isabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Isabel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories to improve the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Isabel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing tires and other accessories to improve the business

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Касимова Насиба жительница Вахдатского района. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Работает на рынке. Арендует торговую точку, где продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 8 лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nasiba K. lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children.  She has a secondary education and works at a market.  Nasiba leases a retail outlet, where she sells food products.  She has been in this business for over 8 years.  She is requesting this loan in order to increase product turnover.

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband's business, who is a farmer by profession. He works in the field and grows different vegetables, wheat, and cotton, etc. 

Growing these items enable him to fulfill the needs of his customers and earn good profit on it.  With the loan, he will buy fertilizer & seeds to improve his business and to get better results from his work. 

Zainab lives with her family in Chichawatni, which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry.  She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area named Gulistan colony. She came here after her marriage with A. A. 26 years ago. 

She is a housewife and does her household responsibilities by staying at home.   She has given birth to 4 sons and a daughter. Her daughter is studying in 4th class, while all of her sons are involved in different kind of works to contribute financially to the family.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has built good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer & seeds for farming business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby L. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Nanca, E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental.  She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: buying and selling livestock and a general store. Her husband Raymund, who is 49 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 4 children who are 2 to 21 years old. 

Ruby joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ruby has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000 which she intends to use as funds for her business operations so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children.  Ruby L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. In the photo you will see Ruby together with her sons and a carabao that is ready to be sold.  

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: To fund the business operation

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags rice, gallons of oil etc

loans.name: Seav

texts.en:
Seav S., age 26, is married with one child who is attending school. Currently, Seav S. lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She is a domestic rice trader, and she also buys rice in bulk at a reasonable cost, and then resells the rice to people to earn a living. Her husband works with her in the business. 

In addition, Seav S. is also feeding some pigs behind her house. Usually Seav S. generates around $4 of income a day to meet the needs of her family. This rice harvesting season, Seav S. needs capital to purchase many sacks of rice to store. She will sell them when the rice commands the highest price. She hopes that she will use any remainder to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of rice to store and if possible buy more small pigs to raise

loans.name: Fany

texts.es: La señora Fany G. G. tiene 38 años y vive en compañía de su esposo y dos hijos en el barrio El Tesoro de la ciudad de Bogotá. Tiene un taller en el cual fabrica productos en fibra de vidrio como deslizadores, túneles y balancines para parques infantiles. El negocio comenzó hace cuatro años cuando el esposo de la microempresaria quedó desempleado luego de trabajar por más de veinte años en el ramo de la fibra de vidrio. En un principio las ventas eran bajas, pero fueron aumentando gracias a la labor de promoción y mercadeo de la señora Fany. Hoy sus productos gozan de un gran prestigio debido  a la calidad de los mismos; son tan buenos que ella otorga dos años de garantía, mientras que la competencia da sólo 18 meses. Los más importantes clientes del negocio son otras empresas que reciben contratos grandes del sector público o privado para construir parques infantiles y ellos a su vez sub contratan con microempresas como la de la señora Fany. Ella es quien maneja la parte administrativa y comercial, su esposo se encarga de la parte operativa, pero cuando los pedidos aumentan considerablemente no es raro verla con guantes y mascarilla pintando con soplete los productos. Este es el segundo préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de fibra de vidrio, resina, catalizadores y pinturas. Con el primer crédito compró nuevos moldes y herramientas. Cuando los pedidos de piezas para parques infantiles disminuyen, la microempresaria también produce guarda barros para automóviles, lava cabezas para peluquerías, toboganes para piscinas y jacuzzis para baños. Ella en general produce cualquier objeto en fibra de vidrio, pero lo que más le gusta fabricar son piezas para parques infantiles porque, según su esposo, eso equivale a producir felicidad a los niños de Colombia.
texts.en:
Fany G. G. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two children in El Tesoro neighborhood, in the city of Bogotá.  She has a workshop where she makes products from fiberglass such as slides, tunnels and seesaws for children's playgrounds.

Fany started her business four years ago when her husband lost his job after having worked for more than twenty years in the fiberglass industry.  At first, her sales were low but they increased thanks to her work promoting and marketing the business.  Today her products enjoy great prestige owing to their quality.  The quality of her products is so good that she offers her customers a two year guarantee whilst her competition only offer 18 months.

Fany's most important customers are companies who receive large contracts, in the public or private sector, to build children's playgrounds.  They, in turn, sub contract small businesspeople such as Fany.  Fany manages the administrative and commercial side of the business.  Her husband is in charge of the manufacturing side.  However, when orders increase considerably it isn't unusual to see Fany with her gloves and mask on, spray painting the products.

This is Fany's second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying fiberglass, resin, catalysts and paints wholesale.  She used her first loan to buy new molds and tools.  When the orders for children's playgrounds slow down, this small businesswoman also produces mudguards for cars, sinks for hairdressing salons, slides for swimming pools and jacuzzis for baths.  In general, she produces any object in fiberglass but what she most likes making are items for children's playgrounds because, according to her husband, this means they are producing happiness for the children of Colombia.

loans.use: To buy fiberglass, resin, catalysts and paints wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has been working as a gypsum specialist for 5 years, sticking with multiple construction projects. He also works as a freelance gypsum decorator depending on customers' demands. He cooperates with his parents in the family’s income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products and tools so he can work in a more professional way, allowing him to increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and tools

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, ella tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de 26, 24, 22 y 20 años, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque  los créditos siempre están a tiempo y cuando lo necesitan.

Es una gran ama de casa que realiza el crédito para que su esposo tenga los recursos necesarios para poder realizar un gran trabajo, su esposo se dedica a la pesca, el junto a otras personas se van a alta mar  en su pequeña embarcación a realizar sus faenas de pesca y no regresan sino hasta después de quince días con los productos que el mar les da, una vez en la playa entregan los productos a comerciantes mayoristas para que estos los distribuyan a toda la provincia. Nos cuenta que su esposo lleva toda su vida en esta labor y que gracias a Dios siempre ha llegado con bien en todas sus salidas.

Este crédito es para comprar redes, piolas, combustibles y alimentos para los días que tienen que estar en alta mar. Sus sueños son tener un gran barco para que sus esposo realice un mejor trabajo y de forma más segura y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Village bank Estrella De Belén meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta, known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by both foreign and national tourists. In this city the majority of inhabitants are fishermen or involved in other jobs related to the sea.

Martha is 52 years old, married, and has four children ages 26, 24, 22, and 20 years old, two of whom live in her house and study at the University. Her husband is a fisherman. She is a founding member of the village bank and likes it because the loans are always available on time and when she needs them.

She is a great housewife who wants the loan so her husband can have the necessary resources to do a good job at work. For his work, her husband goes out to see with other people on a small boat to fish and doesn't return for fifteen days after which he has collected the fruits of the sea. Once back on the beach he sells her products to wholesalers who distribute the fish all over the province. She says her husband has been doing this job all of his life and thanks to God he has always done well on his trips.

This loan is to buy nets, ropes, fuel, and food for the days he is on the high sea. Her dream is to have a large boat for her husband to be more successful at work and for her children to become successful professionals.

loans.use: Buy rope, nets, fuel, and food

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is from Pakpattan. She lives there in a small house with her family in the area of Eidgah. Pakpattan is a small city known for its dairy industry in Pakistan. She came here 20 years ago.

She is 31 years old, married to T. H. who operates a printing business. He prints different books, visiting cards, etc. He is well-known among his clients for his good work and timely providing services. 

Shamim lives in a combined family system along with her brother-in-law and father-in-law.

Shamim is a very good house wife and does her household works very well. She is also a very caring mother who is raising her 3 sons with care and discipline. She has enrolled all of them in a school, so that they will get a good education and good jobs in their lives.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy items like printer toner, paper, etc. in larger quantity to continue the business of printing. He has been operating this business for past 20 years and Shamim is very confident that an investment will bring more profits to him, which will help her family to enjoy a better standard of living.

She is a new loan user of Asasah and hopes it will be a profitable experience for her.

loans.use: To buy printer toner, papers, etc., for a printing business,

loans.name: Claudia Margarita

texts.es: La Señora Claudia Margarita tiene 28 años. Es madre de 2 hijos y están bajo su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Claudia es una persona muy responsable y siempre ha cumplido con la obligación de madre, la vivienda de Claudia es la más humilde de su comunidad. Es por eso que decide incursionar en este negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. El sueño más grande de Claudia es mejorar la condición económica de su familia y salir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia Margarita is 28 years old and has two children.  She has worked selling cosmetics for more than four years.  Claudia is a very responsible person and she has always met her obligations as a mother.  Claudia's home is the most humble in the community.  She decided to start this business to improve the living conditions of her family.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  

Claudia's dream is to improve the economic condition of her family and succeed with her business.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose H. es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de bebidas desde hace varios años, está casado con la Sra. Inocencia, con quien tiene 8 hijos, 4 de ellos ya casados con hijos también y los 4 restantes viven en la casa aún con ellos.
Además de esta activadad se dedica al trabajo en albañilería, actividad que lo realiza con uno de sus hijos.
El Sr. Jose es una persona muy responsable y sacrificada, se dedica de lleno al bienestar de su familia y se encuentra muy agradecido con la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad que le otorga.
texts.en:
José H. is a salesman.  He has been selling drinks for several years.  He is married to Inocencia and has 8 children.  4 of his children are already married and have kids themselves.  The other 4 still live at home.

In addition to this business, José also works in construction together with one of his children.  José is a very responsible and selfless person who is fully committed to his family's well-being.  He is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving him.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow with five children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years she has operated a fish-selling business, and she sells in a shop and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of fish, bundles of maize, flour and sugar. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fish, bundles of maize, flour, and sugar

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GAVIOTAS” iniciará su cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Edith. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de productos Yambal, Avon, costura, pensión, venta de productos Zermat, reparación de electro domésticos, chifleria, almacén de abarrotes.
 
La señora Edith,  indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por invitación de las socias de la asociación; en la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de promotora de productos cosméticos, nos cuenta que este negocio lo inicio por iniciativa propia, posteriormente viendo la necesidad de las personas amplio su negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumento de sus productos, los que adquirirá de las agencias autorizadas, posteriormente lo venderá  personalmente todos los días. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene una hija.  

Cuando le consultamos qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que se brinda a las socias.

En la foto podemos apreciar que no esta presente Don Jason, pues segun sus costumbres no es propio las fotografías.
texts.en:
The “GAVIOTAS” community association is beginning its fourth cycle with “Pro Mujer,” as part of the Villa Exaltación center.  The group is made up of eight women and lead by a council headed by Edith.  The members are involved in different businesses, such as selling Yaman and Avon products, sewing, running guest houses, sale of Zermat products, small appliance repair, new age products, and groceries.

Edith tells us that she became involved in Pro Mujer after being invited by one of the other members.  She currently has a business where she sells cosmetic products and tells us that she started on her own.  She expanded when she saw the need grow.

She will use the money from this loan to increase her inventory though authorized distributors.  She will then resell the products.  This type of work allows her to earn an income to help support her family.  She is married and has a daughter.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us that she likes the training that the members get.

Jason is not present in the photographs because his beliefs do not allow photographing.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Elvin Nahun

texts.es:
Elvin, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de refrescos, vive con su madre, es soltero y trabaja para ayudar a sus padres en la estabilidad del hogar, vende refrescos naturales y sodas.
Él inicio este negocio con el propósito de ayudar a sus padres, hasta el momento el negocio ha sido rentable y solo necesita estar invirtiéndole continuamente en recursos necesarios para los refrescos naturales.
Necesita un préstamo para la compra de frutas como melón, manzanas, piña, azúcar y sodas, esta inversión le ayudara a producir siempre los refrescos naturales.
Sus sueños son crecer en el negocio como microempresario hasta tener un negocio bien establecido.
texts.en:
Elvin lives in San Francisco Gotera in Morazán Department.  He sells beverages.  He’s single living with his mother and works to help his parents with household costs.  He sells natural beverages and soft drinks.

He started this business with the aim of helping his parents.  To date, the business has been profitable and he only has to continuously invest the necessary resources in it for the natural beverages.

He needs a loan to buy fruit like melon, apples and pineapple and to buy sugar and soft drinks.  This investment will help him to produce natural beverages always.

His dream is to continue growing in his business as a micro businessman until achieving a well established business.

loans.use: to buy fruit like melon, apples and pineapple and to buy sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kanyogoga Twetungure Group

texts.en:
33-year-old Henry, a happily father of 5, has been operating his medical clinic business in Kanyogoga-Mubende for 10 years.  He says he began this business after he became aware of the growing demand for medicine in his home area. He not only offers therapy but also sells drugs to patients and people in the neighborhood. 

Before he embarked on this business venture, Henry was fully engaged in that common business that preoccupies most people in Western Uganda:  farming. Henry also raised pigs.  Weekly, he says his business generates for him 100,000 shillings in sales profit. With this loan, Henry says he is going to purchase more drugs to resell.

Henry is affiliated with the Kanyogoga Twetungure Group.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to resell

loans.name: Namik

texts.ru:
Namik yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Namik 44 qoda. 
Uje 5 let kak on zanimayetsya perevozkoy stoitelnix materialov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini dlya toqo chtobi perevozit stroitelniye materiali i tem samim obespechit svoyu semyu.
texts.en:
Namik is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family. He is married and has two children.  Namik is 44 years old.
 
For five years, he has been transporting building materials.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his truck, which he needs to transport construction materials and to support his family.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for his truck.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosario tiene  32 años de edad, vive con su esposo y  4 hijos,  en casa propia  ubicada en la parte rural del distrito de  Tambogrande – Piura.  Rosario es una mujer trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar de su familia.

La actividad que desarrolla Rosario es la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, la cual la realiza recorriendo los caseríos cercanos al suyo donde cuenta con  clientela  establecida a la que vende sus productos al crédito y al contado. Adicionalmente Rosario cría aves de corral, en su casa, para luego comercializarlas a los pobladores de su zona.

Rosario tiene muchos deseos de seguir creciendo en su negocio y por eso ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería (cosméticos) e incrementar sus ventas atendiendo los pedidos de sus clientas en menor tiempo. Además, otra parte del crédito serás destinada a la compra de alimento balanceado para sus aves de corral.

Rosario estaría muy agradecida de concedérsele el préstamo pues este le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosario, age 32, lives with her husband and their four children.  They live in their own house in the rural area of the Tambogrande-Piura district.  Rosario is a hard-working woman who makes every effort for her family’s well-being.

Rosario sells cosmetics by catalog.  She does this by going to the villages close to her own.  She has established customers in the villages, and she sells her products on credit and for cash.  Rosario also raises barnyard fowl at her house.  She later sells the fowl to the people living in her area.

Rosario has a lot of desire to keep growing in her business.  That is why she has believed it advisable to request a loan for 500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise (cosmetics).  She will increase her sales and take care of her customers’ orders in less time.  She will use part of the loan to buy balanced feed for her barnyard fowl.

Rosario will be very grateful to be granted the loan.  It will help her improve her income for her children’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and balanced feed for barnyard fowl.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single with one child. 
Edgardo is raising piglets to sell. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy pigfeed.
Edgardo is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Edgardo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy pigfeed

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice, 33, is a very hard-working woman who practices mixed farming in Olokurto-Narok, Kenya. She has been farming for over five years. She is married and has five children.

She is applying for her first loan, which she plans to use to buy farm supplies. She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. 

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PUNTUALITO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vilma; ella tiene 55 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de horno panificadora, ella vende panes, galletas y tortas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de horno panificadora. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los panes, tortas y galletas como harina, azúcar, manteca y huevos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vilma belongs to the Puntualito Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Vilma is 55 years old, single, and has three children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of making bread.  She sells bread, cookies, and cakes.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead. 

She wants to expand and improve her bread making business.  She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make bread, cakes, and cookies.  She will buy wholesale ingredients like flour, sugar, shortening, and eggs.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy wholesale ingredients for making bread like flour, sugar, shortening, and eggs.

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es:
José Arnulfo tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Chillanes, Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVE DE ABRIL, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao.

José se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar la calidad de sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es comprarse una finca.

Le gusta jugar vóley.
texts.en:
José Arnulfo, 20, is single living with his parents in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueve de Abril” (April 9) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members are primarily corn and cocoa bean farmers.

José is a corn and cocoa bean farmer.  His purchases and his sales take place in the San José del Tambo market.

He requests the loan to buy seeds and manure for his crops.  The loan will serve as support to meet his economic needs and improve the quality of his agricultural activities.  He faces challenges like the drop in price of the products he sells as well as middlemen.  His dream is to buy a farm.  He enjoys playing volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Steffanie

texts.es: Steffanie tiene 21 años, es soltera, es muy joven y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos y un sobrino. El trabajo de Steffanie consiste en la venta de ropa, vende sus productos en su barrio, lleva este trabajo ya casi dos años y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es su independencia, pues mas adelante se decidirá por estudiar algo, pero para ello necesitará de capital. Considera que su trabajo es muy rentable, y por tanto desea estabilizarse por un buen tiempo. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con el monto solicitado, comprará más ropa de vestir para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Steffanie is 21 years old, single, very young and hardworking. She lives at home with her parents, siblings and a nephew. Steffanie sells clothes in the neighbourhood. She has been doing this for almost 2 years on her own. What she likes the most about her work is the independence it gives her. In the future she hopes to study but to do so requires money. She thinks that her work is very profitable and therefore wants to stay in this business for a while. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is hoping to get all your support in order to continue with this line of business. With the amount requested, she will buy more clothing to offer her clients.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 36 year-old hardworking businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. For the last 8 years, he has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. He earns extra income by selling cereals. In the next 5 years, he wants to be successful in dairy farming. 

He is requesting for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. He is 46 years old and married to Rachael. They have four children who attend school.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his fourth loan. He paid all of his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to pay for school fees for his son in high school.

In the future, Peter hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his child

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 35 years old and married. She has two school-aged children to attend to. She resides in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines with the whole family.

Pablita owns and operates a specialized retail store in the local community. She offers some soft and hard drinks and most of the basic commodities. She has operated the business for over four years. She earns approximately PHP 9,500 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase more soft and hard drinks to sell. 

Pablita joined GDMPC earlier this year. She is looking forward to another loan after the total repayment of her current loan. She hopes to expand and improve the business to gain more income for the family and have her children finish a degree in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more soft and hard drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, vive con su esposa, y tres  hijos, él tiene un taller automotriz, el oficio lo aprendió de ayudante y ahora tiene su propio taller, trabaja todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar herramientas (pintura, vidrios, repuestos en general) de esa forma obtendrá mejores resultados y más ingresos.
El propósito de Jorge siempre mantener su negocio estable, tener lo necesario para la vida diaria y en el futuro tener su casa propia, que su familia viva en buenas condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his wife and three children.  He has an auto repair shop.  He learned this trade as an assistant and now has his own workshop where he works every day, from Monday to Sunday.

Jorge needs this loan to buy tools (paint, glass and general spare parts).  This will make him better results and more income.

Jorge's goals are to always keep his business stable, to have what he needs on a day-to-day basis and, in the future, to have his own home so that his family can enjoy good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy paints and spare parts for all types of vehicles

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed. Teresita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31-years-old, married and has two children. 

Haydar has been the owner of a wholesale food market since 2000. He sells flour and all kinds of grain. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to make showcases, an outdoor ceiling, ad boards and to buy a split air conditioner. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole

loans.use: to make showcases, build an outdoor ceiling, ad boards and to buy a split air conditioner.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Silvia vive en casa de sus padres, tiene una hija pequeña, ella se dedica a la repostería, elaboración de galletas y panes esta en el negocio mas de 15 años no tiene puesto propio pero alquila un espacio donde prepara y alista su productos para dejarlo a los clientes por las mañanas, el dinero lo necesita para poder equipar mejor el puesto comprar vitrinas para exponer sus productos y preparar en el sitio los productos que vende, para no tener que estar con problemas de traslado ya que el lugar donde viven es alejado y le es costoso llegar hasta su puesto, es una persona joven con ganas de superación desea darle a su hija un futuro mejor por eso se esfuerza para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia lives at her parents’ house and has a young daughter. She has been producing baked goods, such as cookies and breads, for more than 15 years. Silvia does not have her own stand, but rents a space where she prepares her products before selling them to her customers in the mornings.

The money she needs will be used to better equip her space. Silvia will buy display cabinets for showcasing the products that she sells. She will no longer have problems transporting her goods since her home is located some distance away and the costs related to traveling to her business are expensive.

Silvia is a young person who has the desire to succeed. She wants to provide her daughter a better future, so she strives to move forward.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets for showcasing her products.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: La señora Luz Dary a sus 42 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir y accesorios que ella misma elabora; esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 10 años desde su casa, aunque en ciertas ocasiones es ella quien visita a sus clientes. Actualmente la señora Luz Dary desea comprar insumos como telas, hilos y accesorios que le permitan elaborar más productos y así suplir la alta demanda de temporada de fin de año y  de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida. A futuro la señora Luz Dary desea tener su propio almacén de ropa y accesorios.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Dary is 42 years old. She sells clothing and accessories that she produces herself. Luz has been in this business for more than 10 years and works from home. On certain occasions, she will visit her customers.

Sra. Luz Dary wants to buy supplies such as fabrics, thread, and accessories so that she can produce more products and meet the high demand during the year-end season. This will help to increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. In the future, Sra. Luz Dary wants to have her own clothing and accessories store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.ru: Рахбар женщина в возрасте 50 ти лет, мать 4 детей,в торговле 8 лет. Имеет большой опыт в бизнесе. Она привозит товар с Истаравшана, ассортимент детская одежда.На получаемый кредит она хочет привезти сезонную зимнюю одежду, куртки и свитера.Её муж работает строителем, у него сезонный доход.Также в семье Рахбар дополнительный доход приносит её сын, который работает мастером по ремонту квартир.Она благодарна организации и кредиторам за своевременное финансирование и поддержку.
texts.en: Rahbar is a 50 year-old woman and a mother of four children.  She has been involved in sales for eight years and has an extensive experience in business.  She brings in merchandise from Istaravshan and sells children's clothing.  Rahbar wants to use this loan to bring in seasonal winter clothing, such as jackets and sweaters.  Her husband is a construction worker and has a seasonal income.  Rahbar's son, who works as a master of apartment repairs, also earns an additional income for family.  She is grateful to this organization and creditors for the timely financing and support.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal winter clothing

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a business selling shoes from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of enough capital in her business. She dreams of establishing a shop to sell shoes in the future.

With this 35,000 Kenyan shilling loan she wants to purchase shoes and clothes for sale during the festive season. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for sale during the festive season.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 25 años, es una mujer joven, amable y muy trabajadora, es madre de un niño quien es tiene 5 años, es conviviente con su pareja Julio de 28 años quien es el padre de su hijo. Ella a lado de su familia vive en una casa propia en donde comparte la alegría de vivir juntos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. María se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa, de manera quincenal o mensual, dependiendo de la demanda de sus productos. Ella trae de la ciudad de Lima gran variedad de mercadería que luego son distribuidos a sus clientes que previamente le han hecho el pedido. Asimismo recorre las calles de la ciudad de Pucallpa, en busca de clientes que deseen comprar alguna prenda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y está muy feliz cuando lográ vender toda la mercadería. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los zapatos, ya que las cajas que trae son muy pesadas y la cansan mucho, espera tener con tiempo una tienda de calzados donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este será el noveno préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará mas zapatos, ropa y otros artículos de uso personal, ya que aumentara su variedad de productos.
texts.en:
María, aged 25, is a friendly and very hard-working young women.  She is the mother of a 5-year-old child, and lives with her partner Julio, aged 28, who is the father of her son.  She lives with her family in their own home, where she shares the joy of living together and being able to have a better quality of life.

María works selling shoes and clothing, twice a month or monthly depending on the demand for her products.  She brings a large variety of merchandise from the city of Lima, which she then distributes to her customers, who have previously placed orders.  She also travels the streets of the city of Pucallpa, looking for customers who might want to purchase some items.  What she likes most about her work is selling, and she is very happy when she is able to sell all her merchandise.

She has been doing this work for eight years, and considers the most difficult thing to be transporting the shoes, as the cases which she obtains are very heavy and carrying them is exhausting.  She hopes with time to have a shoe store where she can sell to her customers with more comfort.

This will be her ninth loan with MFP, and as such she hopes for your collaboration so she can continue with her goals.  For her part, she promises once again to comply with making her repayments, as she did with her previous loans.  She is also grateful to be part of the communal bank, because all the members are responsible and very supportive.  

With the 2,000 soles requested, she will purchase more shoes, clothing and other items for personal use, so that she can increase the variety of her products for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing, shoes, and personal items.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet used the previous loan to complete her house. However, she changed from the transportation sector and now owns a retail shop. Her challenge in this business is price fluctuations and inflation and customers not paying on time. Her dream is to educate her children and diversify her business to a renowned wholesale shop. Harriet needs the loan to buy sugar and soap to sell and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap to sell and renovate her house.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua  is married and has five children. She sells charcoal at Asebu Ekroful, which she has done for six years. Her husband is a farmer. 

Ekua uses her income to help her husband in the general upkeep of their family. Ekua will use the loan to produce more charcoal for sale. With the new profits, Ekua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to produce more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Barno

texts.en: Barno is a kind woman. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Barno is a higher educated person. She works in a local school as a teacher more than 2 years. She is one of the smart and successful young teachers. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 2500 Somoni because she is ill. Barno awaits your mercy and in advance thanks KIVA lenders for support.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Leah would like to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pamela would like to buy 300 chickens and expand her chicken house

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
I'm very concerned about the safety of my family. Our neighborhood is not very safe, and there are many delinquents here. I would like to protect my family by installing a fence of iron bars around my house. I'm asking for a loan of $1,000 to install the fence.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

“La seguridad de mi familia me preocupa mucho, la colonia en donde vivimos no es muy segura hay muchos delincuentes y no quiero exponer a mi familia; es por eso que me gustaría poner rejas alrededor de mi casa para tener más seguridad”. Solicito $ 1.000.00 dlls para poner rejas en mi vivienda

loans.use: Install security bars

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is39 years old and married to a polygamist. She has been struggling to set up a business but lacked start up capital and also had difficulties paying for her children's education. Her sister, who was very supportive of her, died, making Veronica more frustrated.

With this loan of $100, Veronica plans to invest in buying and selling fresh corn and groundnuts. She believes that with this loan she will provide for her family's education and also provide food for her family. She plans to repay her loan in 15 months. Her first repayment will commence from the date her loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Buying and selling of fresh corn and groundnut

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Mr. P. Ruos was married in 1979 and has 5 children, 4 sons and 1 daughter. He started his horse cart business in1979. With his horse cart service, he helps the people in the community transport goods, and bricks and rocks from one village to another.

His wife has been weaving silk at home since 1979, after she learned to weave from her mother.

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times. Now he is requesting a loan of $200. He will use this money to purchase a new horse cart because the current one is too old and is easily damaged.

loans.use: New horse cart for transportation service

loans.name: Gloria Eusebia

texts.es:
Gloria is a brave woman who possesses fortitude. For years, she worked hard to sell food and now, she has a small convenience store in her own house. She runs this business in hopes of a better future for her family. She wants to continue working to see her four children who are already separated from her. She lives for the idea of always being there for her children when they need her. Currently, she works intensely to support her youngest child who is 11 years old and her only companion. Her other three children already support themselves and live in other cities. She requests a loan for her store and the various initiatives she has in mind for this business. We are grateful, from this moment onwards, for your great willingness and wish to help her.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Gloria, es una mujer valiente y con mucha fortaleza; hace años atrás se dedicaba al comercio de alimentos y ahora en la actualidad tiene en su propia casa una pequeña tienda de venta de artículos de primera necesidad con la que mantiene la esperanza de obtener un futuro mejor para ofrecérselos a su familia.Ella quiere seguir trabajando para ver a sus cuatro hijos ya superados y es por ello que se desvive con la idea de estar siempre presente cuando sus hijos la solicitan; ahora se dedica intensamente a sostener a su último pequeño de 11 años que es su única compañía ya que sus tres hijos ya se sostienen y radican en otras ciudades.Solicita un préstamo para implementar su pequeño espacio de ventas y los proyectos de negocio que tiene en mente. Te agradecemos desde ya tus grandes deseos de ayudarla.

loans.use: Use the loan to increase the quantity and variety of products in her store's inventory

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is 51-years-old. She lives in La Esperanza district in the province of Trujillo in La Libertad. She has 6 children, but only 4 are still her dependents. She only studied through elementary school because she no longer had support from her parents.

Consuelo started a business selling groceries, but her husband worked in a shoe factory, where he learned to make them. When she obtained her first loan of 300 nuevos soles in the Communal Bank Mujeres Valerosas (Courageous Women), she decided to start a small shop where she made shoes, which she learned how to do from her husband. Little by little, with her skills and subsequent loans, she bought more equipment and material. She now produces a large quantity of shoes and distributes them in markets in Trujillo and on Peru's border with Ecuador.

With this loan of 500 nuevos soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy shoe forms, leather, and glue to make her shoes. Consuelo dreams about having a larger store with all of her machinery to be able to make shoes of better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Consuelo tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Tiene 6 hijos, pero sólo 4 dependen de ella. Estudió sólo educación primaria debido a que no tuvo más apoyo de sus padres.

La señora Consuelo se inicia en el negocio vendiendo abarrotes, pero su esposo trabajaba en una fábrica de calzado donde aprendió a confeccionarlos. Cuando obtiene su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 en el Banco Comunal “Mujeres Valerosas”, deciden implementar un pequeño taller artesanal y dedicarse a la confección de calzado, con ello implementó el taller e inició la confección de calzado aprendiendo de su esposo, poco a poco con sus utilidades y los siguientes préstamos recibidos ha ido comprando más utensilios y material y actualmente producen en mayor cantidad y distribuye en los mercados de Trujillo y en la frontera de Perú con Ecuador.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 cuotas, comprará hormas, cuero y algo de pegamento para la confección de los zapatos. La señora Consuelo sueña con tener un taller mas amplio con toda su maquinaria y poder fabricar calzado de mejor calidad.

loans.use: Purchase of materials (leather and glue)

loans.name: Rehema's Changamoto Group

texts.en:
Rehema, age 30, is married with 2 children (ages 18 and 15). She owns a cafe which she started in 2005. She works there from 6am to 7pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $40 from her business.

In the past, Rehema took out a loan to increase her cafe's services. She now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose and will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses in clothing, food, and drink sales.

loans.use: To buy food items for cafe

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo B. is a 52 years old mother of 4 children and lives in Mushin in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells engine oil, diesel & kerosene. She has been a member  LAPO for the past 3 years. She solicits for the loan amount of $450 to buy more engine oil, diesel & kerosene for sale.

loans.use: To buy more engine oil, diesel & kerosene

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
