Luisa is in her early forties. She and her husband have five children, two of them boys, all of whom go to school.

A few months ago, Luisa took a loan from FSMA, which she invested in her husband's business. He sells sweets and candies, and that activity is the principal source of income for the family. The couple used their loan intelligently and they managed to move the business forward and increase the family’s revenue.

Luisa is requesting a new loan to boost her husband’s business. The loan funds will be invested in the acquistion of ingredients to keep producing the sweets and candies. This way, Luisa and her husband will be able to improve their family’s standard of living.

loans.use: The funds will be invested in raw materials to produce sweets and candies for a pastry shop.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en: Mr. F. is 53 years old. He has 5 children. He works and lives with his family in southern Lebanon, in Tyre. Youssef sells livestock. This is the second time he has applied for a loan through kiva. He wants to buy a cow to sustain and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Ziragul

texts.en: N. Ziragul lives in the Kairakkum region of Tajikistan. As many fellow villagers she is engaged in the livestock. It is the family business but she has her own duties. Mrs. N. Ziragul is responsible for taking care of the animals and  milk production and sour product-making. It is very hard work so her children help her. Mrs. N. Ziragul is married and has a child. She also works in the collective farm. She works hard and has a good reputation. Now Mrs. N. Ziragul applies to KIVA for a business development loan of $625 for 8 months to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.use: To purchase one more milk cow

loans.name: Miriam Sonia's Group

texts.en:
Teofila, Miriam, and Robertina are members of the Village Bank Estrella.

Teofila is married, 56 years old and has five children. Teofila travels to the different fairs of the region where she buys cereals and sells them at the Nery García market. She is also dedicated to raising young animals.

Miriam lives with her boyfriend, is 36 years old and has two children. Miriam sells aggregates - such as sand, concrete, and cement - to people and brings them to their homes by the use of a dump truck. She is also dedicated to the production of gypsum.

Robertina lives with her boyfriend, is 30 years old and has four children. Robertina sells fruits at the market Las Américas. Robertina is also going to begin selling salchipapas and other food from the door of her home.

Teofila, Miriam and Robertina need loans of 400 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of barley, wheat, gypsum, and various fruits and to cancel the rental of a stand.

Teofila, Miriam and Robertina´s dreams are to build their businesses, buy a car, better their quality of life, and to have other businesses.

loans.use: Teofila, Miriam and Robertina need loans of 400 soles, 1400 soles, and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of barley, wheat, gypsum, and various fruits.

loans.name: Virgen Elena

texts.es:
Virgen is a loving mother of 3 children who are already adults. Now she only supports her youngest daughter who is at University and Virgin wishes to continue this support so that her daughter completes her studies. Virgin sells clothing which she offers, house to house, to her friends and also to the neighborhoods around her. She is able to sell her merchandise at low prices and on credit. This is how she is able to support herself, but she has in her mind a plan to open her own juice stand and to rent a shop space for clothing sales. That way she will no longer have to walk door to door and she will be able to attend to all of her business. The loan that she asks for is for the rental of the store area and to buy ingredients for making juice. We hope that you can help Virgin to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Virgen es una dulce madre de 3 hijos que ya son mayores y sólo vela por el cuidado de su última hija quien cursa estudios universitarios y desea seguir a apoyándola para que concluya estos. Virgen se dedica a la venta de ropa, que ofrece de casa en casa a sus vecinos y amigos y también por los alrededores de su localidad, con el fin de poder dejar su mercadería a precios módicos y a crédito.De esta forma es como se gana la vida, pero tiene en mente un proyecto para abrir una juguería y alquilar un local para la venta de ropa, así ya no tendría que caminar por las calles y podría atender desde cerca ambos negocios. El préstamo que solicita es para el alquiler del local y la compra de insumos para la fabricación de los jugos. Esperamos que usted pueda ayudarle a doña Virgen a realizar su negocio.

loans.use: To rent a shop area for the sale of clothing and to buy supplies for a juice stand

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh A. is 24 years old. He is married with two adorable kids.

Farrukh has been breeding cattle since he was a young boy. He is a purposeful person. He likes animals and enjoys looking after them. Being in this business for 11 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable, considerable income for his large family.

Today, knowing that the prices for the animals are not so high now, but will increase for sure, Farrukh is planning to add to his livestock and to purchase cattle and calves. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 12 months. Farrukh thanks all for trusting and supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em C. is a villager in Ti Prumpei Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a clothes seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fashionable clothes to re-sell.

Her husband, Mr. Phoem Thorn, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small salary to support his family. Mrs. Em C. is 35 years old and the mother of four children one of whom helps her in selling clothes while the remaining three are attending school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable clothes to re-sell

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
La señora Antonieta pertenece al Banco Comunal “Juan Zaplana Belliza”, ubicado en el Jr. Abner Monrroy Mz. D Lt. 7, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 51 años y es madre de 4 hijos, 3 mayores de edad y 1 depende aun de ella, es soltera y trabajadora. Antonieta con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir con la venta de maíz, fréjol, tomate, etc.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio, vendiendo plátano, tomate, detergente, naranja y otros.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2.000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá comprando abarrotes para ampliar mas su negocio.

Antonieta se siente realizada, contenta y es por eso que  sigue adelante y pagando puntual su préstamo.
texts.en:
Ms. Antonieta is a member of the “Juan Zaplana Belliza” microfinance institute, located on Jr. Abner Monrroy Mz. D Lt. 7, in the Yarina Cocha district of the Ucayali department. She is a 51-year-old single, working mother of 4 children—3 who are adults, and 1 who is still her dependant. Antonieta decided to invest her first 300.00 PEN loan from Manuela Ramos in selling corn, beans, tomatoes, etc.

She currently has her own small business in which she sells tomatoes, detergent, and oranges, among other goods.

With this loan of 2,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase provisions in order to further expand her business.

Antonieta has a sense of joy and fulfillment, which is why she keeps moving forward and paying her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted goods

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Mrs. Choun N. is 26 years old and lives in Speu Commune in Kompong Cham Province. She is a farmer, and has grown rice and vegetables for many years while her husband, Mr. Chanra Vann, 27, both farms and drives a horse-cart. Chanra leaves home early every morning to pick up customers or merchandise in various parts of his commune, returning in the afternoon. He earns about $2 a day. Unfortunately, Chanra's horse is often sick. His wife is applying for a loan of $325 so that they can buy a new horse to replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mr. Sarin S. is a villager in Neil Village in Takeo Province.  He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  What he can earn through his cultivation is less than what he needs to povide for his household expanses.  

His wife, Mrs. Khat Khem, is a housewife and she now wants to breed pigs.  Thus, Mr. Sarin S. decided to request a loan to buy seven piglets to start a breeding business.  He would use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food for them. He hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan. 

He is 47 years old and the father of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while the others are enrolled in the local school.  His wife is also presented with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy seven piglets to start a breeding business.  He will use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food for them.

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy L. lives in Kvav Village in Takeo Province. She is 36 years old and the mother of six children. Four of her children attend the local school and the other two stay at home because they are young.  Her husband, Mr. Im Thea, is a motorbike taxi driver.  He is pictured with his wife.

Mrs. Thavy L. sells coconuts for a living. Currently, she does not have enough money to buy coconuts to re-sell.  Therefore, she is asking for a loan to buy coconuts and two carts, which will help her transport the coconuts to the market.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and two carts

loans.name: Srey Pau

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Pau N. is a villager in Chey Neang village in Kampong Cham province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Han Horn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces a problem because his field is infertile which  has a bad effect on his crop. Thus, Mrs. Srey Pau N. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to amend the field to make the crop more productive. She is 28 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to make the crop more productive

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara A. sells charcoal in the Vituka Ward in Dar es Salaam. She is a Tanzanian married woman with three school-aged children. She has been with YOSEFO Services for six years. She managed to build her own house from  the income that she earned in her business. 

She purchases the charcoal bags directly from the wholesale producers and sells them to retail customers. Charcoal is the main source of power in most developing countries due to the high cost of electricity. 

She is requesting a loan of  Tshs 1,500.000 to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Gerlita

texts.en:
Gerlita is 45 year old woman with a motorcycle transport business. Her service is very much needed by the people living in the municipality of Hamtic, and especially the villagers of Malandog. She started her business with a P 5000 loan from ASHI, and now owns two motorcycles. She earns extra money by raising Bangus fish fry. The extra income is a big help in meeting her daily needs and educating her children.

Gerlita dreams of adding a sidecar to her motorcycle to make it into a tricycle. She would like to use the additional passenger income for her children’s education so that they, too, will one day have good and stable jobs.

loans.use: purchasing the needed materials for motorcycle

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana Cecilia siempre ha sido comerciante, es su forma de vivir, y a traves de esta actividad ha podido  darle estudios a sus hijos.
Comenzó el negocio en Marzo de 1990 su padre fue el que le ayudó poniéndole un negocio de comida en un puesto ambulante, posteriormente le ofrecieron poner la cafeteria del Colegio en donde actualmente se encuentra, ya que el local tiene acceso al Colegio para atender a los alumnos y tiene acceso a la calle, para atender a clientes externos del colegio.
Su negocio  ha ido progresando  desde que inicio a la fecha ya que  compro una camioneta, y con ella empezó a sutir más el negocio, y con las ganancias pudo comprar otra camioneta, actualmente ya tiene dos.

Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $5300 para comprar materia prima para la temporada de semana santa, es cuando  incluye platillos de cuaresma  para llevar.
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia has always been a businesswoman. It's her way of life and, thanks to her business, she's been able to educate her children. She started in March 1990, setting up a food vending business with help from her father and selling on the street, at first. Later, she set up a cafeteria in a school where she operates now. The cafeteria can be reached from both inside the school so that she can serve the school's students and from outside so that she can serve people coming in from the street. Her business has grown steadily from the start. She bought a small truck so that she could better supply the business and, with the earnings, she was able to buy another truck so that she now has two.

She needs a MXN$5300 loan to buy supplies for Semana Santa.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Linnette Akoth

texts.en: Linnette Akoth O. is a 30-year old mother of three children ages 12, 10 and 6. She purchases new clothes from Busia and sells them in the Kibuye market. Linette recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Dadau Driciru Grace Group

texts.en: Mrs. D. Grace is 35 years old, married with 3 kids, all going to school, with 3 dependents. She has been selling produce for over 5 years. She is using the loan to purchase produce such as beans, simsim (sesame seeds), cassava flour, and tomatoes. She is a hard-working woman and her dream is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase produce such as beans, simsim, cassava flour, and tomatoes for re-sale

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta Alicia M. D. H. vive en Zacatecoluca  departamento D. la paz, A sus 38 años Marta se encuentra casada y madre D. 3 hijos . Marta y su esposo se dedican a su negocio que es una tienda donD. venden  productos D. consumo diario, esta tienda es el único aporte económico que la familia recibe, es por ello que esta pareja D. esposo se preocupan mucho por su negocio para vender productos D. calidad a sus clientes y dar los mejores precios. Marta ya ha obtenido créditos  en otras instituciones donD. actualmente  no tiene ninguno vigente, pero ha sido muy puntual en sus cuotas; ahora solicita un nuevo crédito para surtir  su tienda.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia M. D. H. lives in the Zacatecoluca department of La Paz. Marta is 38, married, and has three children. Marta and her husband have a store where they sell everyday consumer goods. This store is the only economic support the family receives. Because of this, they are very concerned about their business and selling quality products at the best prices. Marta has received loans from other institutions. She currently does not have one. She has been very punctual in her payments. She is asking for a new loan to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her store

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
La señora María Julia R. Díaz tiene 23 años, vive en el Asentamiento Humano Víctor Raúl II etapa, distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene  1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
María se dedica al Alquiler de CD y DVD, este negocio se inicio hace 3 meses, gracias al préstamo de la ONG Manuela R. su negocio se desarrolla dentro de su casa.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco comunal Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de productos como CD Y DVD.
El crédito de 400 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de CD Y DVD para implementar su negocio ya que es su único sustenta económico de su hija y la socia porque es madre soltera.
 María  tiene como sueño tener su Internet y venta y/o alquiler de CD Y DVD para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Maria Julia R. D. is 23 years old, and lives in the neighborhood of Asentamiento Humano Victor Raul II, in the district of Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She finished high school, and has 1 child who depends on her economically. Thanks to a loan from an NGO, she has been able to run a CD and DVD rental business out of her home for the past 3 months. She received her first loan from the community bank Lideresas en Accion II, and invested the money in the purchase of CDs and DVDs. She will invest this loan of 400 soles in buying more CDs and DVDs in order to expand her business since she is a single mother and this is the only source of income she has to support herself and her daughter. Maria's dream is to have an internet cafe and to sell and/or rent CDs and DVDs in order to grow as a small businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Melenikan

texts.en: Mama, as she is called, sells provisions and foodstuffs and has been in this business for eight years. Mama is 55 years old and married with  five children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more more provisions and foodstuffs to sell in order to meet her customers' need. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mafalda

texts.pt:
Mafalda N. nasceu em Gaza tem 43 anos de idade vive maritalmente é mãe de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 13 aos 25 anos de idade todos vão a escola somente a filha do meio é que já esta empregada na educação.

Mafalda sai de Gaza para o Município da vila de Namaacha na fronteira de Suazilândia ainda criança com seu pai este que era trabalhador das águas da Namaacha (MONTEMOR), este que vem perder a vida durante o horário de trabalho. Sendo assim a empresa cede trabalho para um dos seus filhos, sendo a mais velha teve a oportunidade de trabalhar para ajudar no sustento da família. Hoje e funcionaria permanente a mais de 24 anos trabalhando em turnos das 07h00min as 15h30minh no período da manhã e das 15h30min as 23:0h no período da noite, auferindo mensalmente um valor de 2.129.00MT, valor este que não satisfaz as suas necessidades, pois vive numa casa de aluguer pagando mensalmente 500.00MT. Mas com ajuda do seu esposo este que trabalha como guarda fronteira, eles conseguem colectar um fundo e ambos dão inicio da obra que devido ao elevado custo do material não conseguem concluir, então o esposo teve que pedir um empréstimo de 34.000.00MT numa instituição bancaria (BIM) para dar continuidade da mesma que também não e concluída. numa conversa com seus colegas de serviço teve conhecimento dos nossos serviços e aproxima pedindo um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT para concluir as mínimas partes e de seguida mudar se para sua própria casa, para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza não responsabiliza se por ninguém. Tem 

Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Mafalda na Hluvuku e Kiva, estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para comprar aros da porta e janelas e as suas respectivas fechaduras, esta muito feliz, pois dentro em breve vai viver na sua própria casa. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo empréstimo para os preparativos do seu futuro casamento
texts.en:
Mafalda N. was born in Gaza. She is 43 years old and lives with her common-law husband. She has five children between the ages of 13 and 25. They are all in school except the middle daughter, who is already employed in education. Mafalda and her father left Gaza for the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland while she was still a child. Her father worked at the Montemor mineral water company, and died on the job. The company then hired one of his children, and since she was the eldest she had the opportunity to work to help support her family. Today she has been an employee there for 24 years, alternating between a day shift from 7 a.m. to 3:30 p.m. and a night shift from 3:30 p.m. to 11:00 p.m. She earns 2129 meticals a month, not enough to cover her basic expenses, since she lives in a rental house that costs 500 meticals a month. But with the help of her husband, who works as a border guard, they manage to scrape by. Because of the high cost of construction materials they have not been able to finish building their house. Her husband had to apply for a 34,000-metical loan from a bank (BIM) to continue the work, and it still remains unfinished. She learned about our services in a conversation with coworkers, and came to us to request a loan of 10,000 meticals to finish part of the house and be able to move into their own home. Apart from her children, she is not financially responsible for anybody else. She has big dreams of getting married officially and being This is Mafalda's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She will use these 10,000 meticals to buy door frames and windows and their respective locks. She's very happy, since soon she will be living in her own home. She's confident that she will pay off the loan early and request another one to pay for preparations for her future wedding.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy constructions materials

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: amy B. est une ancienne societaire dela caisse de bayelaye qui est tres experimentee en credit eten couture.elle gere un atelier chez elleelle sollicite un credit decent cinquante mille(150 000)pour augmenter son fond de roulement en vue d'accroitre ses benefices.ceci lui permettra de mieux assister sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy B. is long-time member of the bank of Bayelaye and is very experienced with loans and with dressmaking. She manages a shop in her home. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to increase her working capital with the aim of growing her profits. This will enable her to assist her family further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For increasing her working capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa M. is married and has five children. She has no educational background. Theresa sells charcoal, which she gets from burning wood, she buys the wood and then buries it in the ground before burning it to get her charcoal to sell at the market Elmina, which she has been doing since 2001. Theresa adds her income to that of her husband for the up keep of the family. Theresa will use the loan to purchase more wood to use as charcoal for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Theresa plans to educate children.

loans.use: Theresa will use the loan to purchase more wood to use as charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland B., 40 years old, is married to Cynthia B.. According to him, big capital is needed in his catering business but, sad to say, he doesn’t have enough capital. Thus he would like to obtain a loan of PHP 5,000 to further use in purchasing additional kitchenware so that he can complete his set of utensils needed in his catering.

Roland’s wife, Cynthia, is an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). This couple is grateful for they have been blessed with two children: Josh Roland - 10 years old and Jeanne - 9 months old. Roland stands as both a mother and a father to his two children due to the absence of his wife.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchenware

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline N. is 24 years old, married and she has one kid of 4 months age
Jacqueline has an experience of 1 year in shopping  by starting from 6h30’ A.M to 19h00’.

Jacqueline is now requesting her first loan in Vision Finance Company s.a  for the purpose of expanding her shop through buying many goods. With that expansion, Jacqueline hopes to get more profit than before then with that profit, she will be able to buy a house and save for the future.

Through accessing this loan, Jacqueline hopes to see her life changing in a positive way.

loans.use: purchasing more merchandises

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean H. is from the village of Unidos. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Mary Jean owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling gasoline in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2000, Mary Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Elieth Del Socorro

texts.es: Elieth es soltera,  trabaja como docente de educación primaria desde hace 3 años, está solicitando su primer credito a AFODENIC para  Terminar de construir  una habitación, se caracteriza por ser resónsable, honesta,  es muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo y padres de familia, a pesar que ella no se ha casado ayuda a sus padres con los gastos familiares, esta joven sueña por tener un buen porvenir,  estudiar una licenciatura, estabilidad laboral y  formar una familia.
texts.en:
Elieth is single. She has worked as a primary school teacher for three years. She is asking AFODENIC for her first loan to finish construction on her house. She is characterized as being responsible, honest, and much loved by her work colleagues and parents. Even though she is not married, she helps her parents with the family expenses. This young woman dreams of having a good future, studying for a degree, work stability, and forming a family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster her house

loans.name: Malik-Ajdar

texts.en:
Malik-Ajdar Q. is married and has 2 children. He runs a small grocery business. Malik-Ajdar has been in this business for over 14 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.

Malik-Ajdar is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN to increase the assortment of his inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. His dream is to save more money and build his own store one day.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his grocery

loans.name: Luaipoualii

texts.en:
Luaipoualii M. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Gautavai. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Luaipoualii owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Luaipoualii has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Luaipoualii joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luaipoualii is requesting a loan from SPBD for the first time. The 1000 WST loan will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. Luaipoualii plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
Basilio, de 31 años, es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de productos variados, él viaja todos los días llevando sus productos a otras ciudades de su región, distribuyéndolos en las distintas tiendas donde ya tiene contratos previos. Los productos que más le solicitan son papel higiénico, shampoo, jabones, etc.
Lo que más le gusta a Basilio de su trabajo es conversar con sus compradores y negociar con ellos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es viajar todos los días, pues es muy cansado hacerlo. 
Para el futuro de su negocio espera juntar el dinero necesario para tener una tienda en la ciudad donde vive y así ganar un ingreso extra.

Este es el primer préstamo de Basilio con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo si quiere acceder a otros créditos posteriormente. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevos productos para tener más mercadería para llevar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Basilio, 31 years old, is very hardworking. He lives in his own house with his family and what he wants most is to improve his standard of living. The activity he does is selling a variety of products. Every day he travels to other cities in his region, distributing his products among the different stores where he has had prior dealings. The products most in demand are toilet paper, shampoo, soap, etc. What Basilio likes most about his work is talking to his colleagues and doing business with them. He has been doing this for 10 years and what he feels is hardest is traveling every day, as it is very tiring. In the future he hopes to put together enough money to have a store in the city where he lives, so that he can earn more money. This is Basilio´s first loan with MFP and he knows he has to repay it on time if he wants to have access to other loans later on. With the three thousand new soles that he requests he will buy new products so that he has more merchandise to take to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Posseh

texts.en:
Posseh K. is married and has four children, all in high school. She also has two relatives staying with her. Her store is located in the Dove Cut market area . For the past thirty years, Posseh has been in business and has been doing well. She is very hardworking, as she stays in her store from 8 a.m. - 9 p.m. on a daily basis.
In order to respond to her children's schooling needs and other domestic issues, Posseh is seeking a loan in order to buy more stock.

loans.use: To purchase food items

loans.name: Ehis

texts.en:
Ehis is 33 years old and married. He has a child who is still dependent on him. His wife is a hairdresser and she also supports their home. 

Ehis sells shoes and handbags to his customers at retail prices. He is a focused, hard worker. He sells for long hours to enable him meet the basic needs  of his family members. He loves this business because it is highly profitable. He hopes to own a shoe company in the future. 

Ehis is hoping for a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and handbags to sell

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru: Раджабов Рахмат проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Раджабов Рахмат имеет среднее Техническое образование по специальности "Шофер". Животноводством занимается более 11 лет. Раджабов Рахмат откарливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Rahmat R. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has 4 children. Rahmat has a secondary technical education as a driver. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 11 years. Rahmat raises and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George M. W. is fifty-eight years, married and has four children. His business is located at Gatundu near Family Bank in Thika, Kenya and it is well known by the name Ituru Shoe Repair Shop. He makes shoes and sells them to the local people. He also engages in shoe repair and he has been in this business for the last twenty-five years.

He says that his major challenge has been too many people doing the same business as his, so customers are spoilt for choice. He is using his Kes 40,000 loan to purchase leather to make more shoes and for repairs to grow his business.

In future, he hopes to open a big shop for shoe supply. He also has a dream to give his children a good education. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: Leather

loans.name: Lucrecia Adelina

texts.es: Lucrecia Adelina  tiene la edad de 29 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de frutas. Hace más de 8 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado, por lo que siempre le ha gustado luchar. Sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que fue por cuenta propia poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de piña, bananos, naranjas, limones, tomate, cebolla entre otros. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo mucho.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Adelina is 29 years old and supports her 2 children. She has had a business selling fruit for more than 8 years. Her store is located on the outskirts of the market, and she has always liked to work. She got her start with very little capital, but with a lot of drive and self reliance, little by little she increased her stock with the small earnings that her store produced. The financing that she is requesting is for working capital to buy pineapples, bananas, limes, tomatoes, onions, and more. Her greatest dream is that each of her children finish their studies and that they continue with their education, as it will be a great help to them.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for the purchase of produce

loans.name: Issa B.

texts.en:
Issa B. K. is an approximately 42-year-old man who lives in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone with his wife and their 4 children. Issa has been running a small video center (a mini-cinema) for 5 years now. He shows mainly soccer – European, domestic, and Champions’ leagues, which are very popular here. He also shows Nigerian, Western, and Indian movies. 

He requested a loan from Kiva field partner Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT), in order to pay his monthly satellite subscription fee, buy petrol for his generator and buy video tapes. This is the first loan that Issa has requested from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay his monthly satellite subscription fee, buy petrol for his generator, and purchase video tapes

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Ouidah, une ville historique du Bénin, B. Odette vit depuis sept ans à Allomey, à Allada dans le département de l’atlantique. Odette est mariée à ADJADI François, un transitaire, avec qui elle a quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Odette a encore un autre enfant à sa charge. Odette vit seule avec ses enfants mais elle est secondée par son mari pour subvenir aux divers besoins des enfants. Pour participer à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants, Odette mène comme activité la vente de divers produits (huile de palme, chaussures, condiments etc.) non loin de son domicile. Odette fait ses provisions à Lomé, capitale économique du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin, et au Nigéria, pays limitrophe du Bénin. Odette a laissé les classes au cours primaire mais exerce son activité depuis bientôt 10 ans. ALIDé a déjà accordé un prêt à Odette, prêt qu’elle a bien remboursé. Odette souhaite accroître ses revenus pour pouvoir s’acheter une parcelle, c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Ouidah, a historic village of Benin, B. Odette has been living for 7 years in Allomey in Allada in the Atlantic district. Odette is married to Adjadi Francois, a freight broker with whom she has 4 childern all in school. Odette has one more child at her care. She lives alone with her children but she is supported by her husband providing various needs of the children. In order to take part in the education of her children, she engages in the sale of various products( palm oil, shoes, ingredients etc) not far from her home. Odette gets her provisions in Lome, the economic capital of Togo, a neighboring country of Benin, and in Nigeria, an adjoining country of Benin. Odette abandoned primary school and has been doing business for almost 10 years. Odette already got a loan from AlIDe which she repaid. Odette wishes to increase her profits to be able to buy a plot of land. That is the reason for which she is requesting a second loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients, shoes and gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Tiwaa Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Comfort is fifty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to six children who are between the ages of seven and thirty-two. Some are married and currently live with their spouses. Others are, however, still in school. 

Comfort lives with her husband and the younger children in a rented apartment in the community. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Comfort is hard-working. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells 'kenkey', a local dish made of corn dough served hot with peppers and fried fish. She has been in business for four years. 

Comfort buys her raw materials – bags of maize, fish and other ingredients--from nearby communities. She desires to support all her children up to the university level.

Comfort is the leader of a six-member trust bank group called ‘Tiwaa’, the leader’s surname. The group is made up of mainly traders and food vendors. They request the loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and other ingredients for 'kenkey'

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Rice farming is the main source of income for Lourdes, 49.  She is also involved in her businesses of quail raising and canteen vending. She has 100 quail and sells their eggs at her canteen. She supports her 9-year old child.

Lourdes joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to get a loan with low interest to finance her businesses.  She’s requesting 15,000 PHP to buy farm necessities so she can sustain her family.

loans.use: farm supplies and feed for quail

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José Alberto A. P., tiene la edad de 53 años, es casado, y vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. El crédito lo quiere para comprar lechones para el engorde, él desea tener más cantidad de cerdos y así poder mejorar la calidad de la raza. Cuenta con un local para el desarrollo y engorde de los cerdos. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don José tiene muchos años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
José Alberto A. P. is 53 years old, is married and lives with his wife and their four children. The loan that he wants is to buy piglets to fatten. He wishes to have a greater quantity of pigs and be able to improve the quality of the breed. He has a place where he develops and fattens the pigs. This is the first time he is taking out a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the facilities they have provided. José has been working at this business of raising pigs for many years. He hopes in the future to provide a better quality of life and greater economic stability for his family and to be able to continue to grow as a person and producer.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase piglets to fatten.

loans.name: Merline Nadège

texts.fr:
Femme âgée de 35ans,célibataaire avec un enfant de 12ans.Elle est dans ce commerce (vente des poissons salés) depuis l'an 2004 et ce commerce lui permet de s'occupper de la scolarité de sa fille.elle est au marché à partir de 8h du matin et quitte vers 16h de l'après midi.Elle a une clientelle très active et variée, car le Poisson salé est  apprecié dans sa Zone D'activité.
Ce prêt lui permettra d'améliorer la qualité de son activité en achetant 10 cartons de poissns salés, 10 cartons de poissons thons, 5 cartons morues,elle choisie toujours les meuilleurs poissons et agrandir son étallage.Pour la croissance de son commerce,elle vend aux prix hors concurence pour mieux attirer la clientelle, elle est une bonne gestionnaire.
dans son quartier et au marché, on la qualifie  de brave femme,elle se bat pour l' éducation futur de sa fille en lui offrant des études à létranger et s'organiser pour améliorer ses condition de vie.
texts.en:
This lady, 35, is single and has a child of 12. She has been in sales (selling salted fish) since 2004, and this business has allowed her to pay school fees for her daughter. She arrives at the market at 8 am every day and leaves around 4 pm. She has an active and varied clientele since salted fish is much in demand in her area. This loan will allow her to expand her business by buying 10 cartons of salted fish, 10 cartons of tunafish, and 5 cartons of codfish. She always chooses the best fish and expands her display. In order to grow her business, she sells at very competitive prices so as to attract more customers. She is a good manager. In her neighborhood and at the market, she is considered to be a respectable woman who struggles to educate her daughter and to allow her to study abroad and to be organized so as to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying cartons of salted fish wholesale

loans.name: Nelly Socorro

texts.es:
En el barrio Las colinas Municipio de Somotillo La señora Nelly socorro L. A. se desempeña como comerciante en el mercado municipal  de Somotillo.
Ella nos dice que el crédito será utilizado para la compra de mercadería por mayor y variada como es arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, golosinas etc.
Este es el segundo crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que el primeros créditos la beneficio para empezar a surtir su  pulpería.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Las Colinas in the town of Somotillo, Nelly Socorro L. A. works as a merchant in the Somotillo town market. She tells us that this loan will be used to buy various wholesale merchandise such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, sweets, etc. This is the second loan that she has requested, and she tells us that the first loan allowed her to begin to supply her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various merchandise for her business

loans.name: Chona May Fe

texts.en:
Chona May Fe S. is from the village of Bucana, Sicayab, Dipolog City. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Chona May Fe owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Chona May Fe has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Chona May Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona May Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for installation of electric wiring in her house. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Chona May Fe from PMPC. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for installation of electric wiring in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married man from Lebanon with one child. For the past few years, he has made his living as a professional driver, operating a car service for customers in his village as well as neighboring towns. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform maintenance work on his vehicle. He reports that these improvements will enable him to provide his service to more passengers and earn more income, especially during the summer season when there are many passengers going to Lebanon.

In Lebanon, it is common to use taxi services to go between neighborhoods in a given town as well as to travel between different regions. These services are especially important in areas where the infrastructure is less developed, which is true for most of the towns outside of Beirut and its surrounding suburbs.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l.,a Lebanese services company, in 2003. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To perform maintenance work on his vehicle.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie was born in 1959 and is a hard-working mother with six children. Her eldest child is 21 years old while the youngest is 7 years old. She is married to a farmer and they both work hard to raise their children. 

Epiphanie sells green bananas and she has done this business for 30 years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more green bananas and increase her sales.

loans.use: Buying green bananas

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally O. is from the town of Banga. She is 45 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Sally owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for breeding. Sally also cooks food that she sells in her neighborhood.
Sally joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sally is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos, de 27 años de edad, es carpintero y tiene un negocio de venta de papas fritas, reside en el Departamento de San Miguel y vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos uno de 6 y 1 año de edad.
Él se dedica a la carpintería desde hace tres años y en la zona no hay otro carpintero por lo que Juan Carlos adquiere la mayoría de trabajo de sus vecinos, el atiende el taller desde las ocho de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde.
Juan Carlos solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera, pleywood, tubos y otros materiales  necesarios para su negocio, esto ayudara que su inventario este fortalecido y pueda realizar el trabajo que sus clientes de demanden.
Las aspiraciones de Juan son crecer con su carpintería, capacitarse en nuevos diseños de muebles, aumentar la clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, age 27, is a carpenter.  He also has a business selling French fries.  He lives with his wife and their two children, ages 6 and 1, in the San Miguel department.

He decided to work in carpentry three years ago.  There is no other carpenter in the area, so Juan Carlos gets most of his work from his neighbors.  He tends his workshop from eight in the morning until four in the afternoon.

Juan Carlos is requesting a loan to buy wood, plywood, tubes, and other needed materials for his business.  This will help him increase his inventory, and it will allow him to do the work that is in demand by his customers.

Juan’s aspirations are to grow as a carpenter, to train himself to make new furniture designs, to get more customers, and to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Buy plywood for carpentry

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita L. lives in the village of Brgy. Villaros, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. For the last four years, she has made a living producing and selling charcoal. She earns about 5,000 PHP from her work.

Last year, Elenita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 9,000 PHP, to buy the materials she uses to make charcoal. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business.  

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern parts of the country. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Sosorbaram

texts.en:
Sosorbaram D., age 34, lives with his wife and two sons in Tuv province, Mongolia. They have lived together in a 'ger' (traditional Mongolian tent home) on a small plot of land they own for several years. His two sons, ages 12 and 8, attend a local school while his wife works as a cook in a restaurant. 

Sosorbaram operates a meat trading business at Huchit Shonhor market, the largest meat supply market in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has operated this business for the last 3 years and has found much success with his new business. He usually purchases his meats from the countryside and sells it at the Huchit Shonhor market as a wholesaler. Also he sells meat through meat shops in the rural areas as a retailer.  

Before starting his own business, he was a herder between 1992 and 2002 and worked as an assistant in the meat shop at the Har horin, a big market in the city from 2002 to 2004. His business was successful enough to purchase a new house and fence for his family. Moreover, his earnings have enabled him to buy a new small car as well as a van for his business. 

He is planning to establish his own meat processing factory in a building that he purchased out of his earnings. Sosorbaram is a very modest, honest and hard-working man. "My only goal is to open my own meat processing factory and export a variety of processed meats on the foreign market," he says. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan for his meat trading business.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Cruzero Group

texts.es:
Esta  foto fue tomada en la granja porcina de la Sra. Blanca S.,  la cual es integrante D. grupo  “CRUZERO” que está ubicado en Puebla en México. Aun costado de la foto se pueden apreciar los lechones (cerdos pequeños) que ella cría con mucho empeño. Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos, negocio que inicio hace 10 años .Solicita  el préstamo para la compra de alimento para cerdos.  Sus clientes  prefieren comprarle los cerdos a ella por dar una carne de calidad y limpia. En este momento se siente contenta por este nuevo préstamo ya que piensa invertir en la construcción de más chiqueros (lugar donde se crían). Tiene 51 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de primaria, es casada y tiene una  sola hija. Espera que con la construcción de los chiqueros  tenga más espacio para aumentar la producción.El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes y es la segunda  vez que solicitan un crédito en CrediComún
Observación: Al momento de capturar la fotografía la señora Teresa E. se movió un poquito, pero si se alcanza a ver.
texts.en:
This photo was taken on the pig farm belonging to Blanca S. who is a member of the 'CRUZERO' group which is located in Puebla in Mexico.  To one side of the photo you can see the 'lechones' (young pigs) which she puts a lot of effort into raising.  She raises and sells pigs and started her business  10 years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy feed for her pigs.  Her customers prefer to buy their pigs from her because she provides them with high quality and clean meat.  Right now she is happy about this new loan because she plans to invest in the building of more pigsties (where the pigs are raised).  She is 51 years old and studied up to the third year of elementary school.  She is married and has one daughter.  She hopes that with the building of the pigsties she will have more space to increase her production.  The group has 12 members and this is the second time that they have requested a loan from CrediComún.

Note: At the moment the photo was taken Mrs Teresa E. moved a little bit but she can still be seen.

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora, dedicada a apoyar  a su familia, uno de sus anhelos ha sido la mejora de su casa.
 Trabaja como conserje desde hace varios años, y ha logrado poner una pequeña pulpería en su casa. Con los financiamiento que la institución ha dado lo ha invertido parte en el comercio y en su vivienda.
Con el crédito anterior su objetivo era cambiar todo el techo, no lo logra ya que solo compro una parte de materiales ya que todo está ah altos costos. Con este nuevo préstamo llevara a cabo su proyecto de poder cambiar todo su techo que será de mucho ya que por los años está ya muy viejo. Siendo Afodenic una puerta al cambio. 
Comprara mas laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura para hacer el cambio.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to helping her family. One of her greatest wishes has been to improve her home.

She has worked as a custodian for many years and has been able to install a small grocery store in her house. She has invested part of the loans that she has been granted by Afodenic in her business and the other part in her house. 

With her previous loan Gloria wanted to completely replace the roof of her house, however she wasn’t able to do so because she could only purchase some of the materials as they were quite expensive. With this new loan she will complete this project and replace the whole roof because it is many years old now and is quite worn. Afodenic has been the agent for this change.

Gloria will purchase more zinc sheeting, purlins, welding agents, and other construction materials to replace her roof and improve her home.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to replace her roof and improve her home

loans.name: Prisca Jepkemboi

texts.en:
Prisca is a forty year old lady married to Korir, and they have three children aged fifteen, twelve and eight years old respectively.

Prisca has been in the business of buying cereals in her area and selling them at a profit. She has been in this business for six years now, and says she has made good profits from it, especially during the harvest seasons.

With this first loan she plans to puchase bags of maize and beans, because the supply is high right now, and then she will transport them to the centre to sell.

She plans to buy a plot at the centre to develop, and to supply cereals to bigger towns where she will get more profits to educate all her children to university levels.

loans.use: To purchase cereals for resale.

loans.name: Salissou

texts.fr: Salissou a 24 ans. IL est né  à  Lomé  et vit dans le quartier  Lycée de Tokoin. IL gère comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de la viande de chèvre et compte dans cette activité  10 ans déjà. Il vend ensuite ses viandes à abattoir de port de pèche. Avec le nouveau crédit, il espère acheter 20 chèvres.
texts.en: Salissou is 24 years old.  He was born in Lomé and lives in the Lycée district of Tokoin.  He has been managing his business of selling goat meat for 10 years.  He sells his meat at the abattoir at the fishing port.  With this new loan, he hopes to buy 20 goats.

loans.use: to buy goats

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa, 46 years old, belongs to the “Solidaridad Cachimayo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Cachimayo district of the province of Chinceros. She has a common law husband and three children. Josefa would like this loan to invest in her business of raising animals. Principally, she raises roosters, buying them when they are young and selling them for meat or to hen houses. She is very happy with the loan being granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: to invest in more animals

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. lives in the Lubaga road, Kitawuluzi neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school. Florence has a business of mini-bakery. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Florence sells her products at the market, by means of wholesale/retail.

Florence has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more jerry cans of cooking oil and cartons of baking flour. The main business challenge(s) for Florence include transport, and ever increasing prices of cooking oil and baking flour. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to run a fully stocked bakery. Florence lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of cooking oil, cartons of baking flour.

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Hin H., age 52, who lives in the Province of in Cambodia, where she earns living raising pigs. She has run this business since 2006 and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. Her husband who is skilled for making concrete in order to sell to construction workers who need the material for building houses in the village. He earns an income of approximately $6 per day. 

Mrs. Hin H.’s wants to invest in his business by purchasing supplies of stone, sands, and cement for making concrete. She would like to ask for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase stone, sand, and cement for making concrete.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: Valeria es socia del Banco Comunal Las Gaviotas, es viuda, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos. Valeria se dedica a la venta de zapatos, antes vendía ropa, pero decidió cambiar por la venta de zapatos porque tiene más salida y es mas rentable. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías: zapatos, zapatillas para damas caballeros y niños. Valeria ingreso a Finca Perú, por la invitación de una amiga, lo que ahorró le sirvió para la educación de sus hijos, ahora está ahorrando para compararse un terreno.
texts.en:
Valeria is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls) communal bank.  She’s 56 years old, a widow and has four children.  

Valeria sells shoes.  She used to sell clothes but decided to change into selling shoes because they sell more and are more profitable.

She will use the requested loan to buy merchandise: shoes and slippers for women, men and children.

Valeria joined Finca Perú invited by a girl friend.  She used what she was able to save for her children’s education; now she’s saving up to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy ladies' shoes and slippers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Victoria; la socia tiene 59 años de edad, soltera y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de venta de cosméticos ella vende productos de belleza como perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otros mas, a la vez la socia teje a mano chompas para niños y adultos, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos de belleza y comprar hilos, lana de diferentes colores entre otros más.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" [Together and United], located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Victoria is 59 years old, single, and has four children.  She sells cosmetics.  She sells beauty products like perfumes, colognes, creams, and other products.  She also hand-knits sweaters for children and adults.  She is a happy person with a drive to succeed.

She is asking for this loan to purchase more beauty products and also to purchase thread and yarn in different colors.

She is happy with the loan provided and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for a cosmetics sales business and yarn and thread for a knitting business.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. Abdalla lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills.

He has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past 4 years. His potential customers are the passersby. In addition, he also operates a beer depot business, which contributes a lot to his monthly income. Abdalla faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of purchasing more than one motorcycle in the future. 

With the 60,000 KES, he wants to purchase crates of beer and purchase motorcycle spare parts. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase crates of beer and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga nació en el distrito San Salvador y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Dominga vive en hermosa ciudad Imperial de los Incas (Cusco, Perú), ella es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a sus cuatro hijos de las cuales dos ya son independientes, ella se dedica a la venta de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella lleva sus animales a vender a la ciudad de puerto Maldonado donde no hay mucho de estos productos y se vende como pan caliente. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Dominga en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y gallinas de buena calidad. 

Dominga es una persona responsable que pertenece al banco comunal “Sumac Purisisun” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Dominga was born in the San Salvador district and is 38 years old.  She lives in the beautiful imperial city of the Incas (Cusco, Perú) and is an enterprising woman who has raised four children, two of whom are independent.  She sells small animals, such as guinea pigs and hens, for a living.

She takes them to the port city of Maldonado where this type of product is not in abundance and so she sells them like hotcakes.  She has been in business for a year and it going well for her.

Dominga needs a loan to buy quality guinea pigs and hens.  She is a responsible person and member of the "Sumac Purisisun" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association in Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy quality guinea pigs and hens

loans.name: Nanci Paola

texts.es:
Para Nanci Paola F. M., el trascurrir de los días la vida  le brinda nuevas oportunidades para mejorar su negocio ya que actualmente tiene un nuevo punto de venta donde es  muy concurrido, ya que es carretera principal al mercado,   ahora la  prioridad para ella es  llenar cada espacio de su nuevo local,  y poder aprovechar ese recurso,  pero esto implica más inversión en  capital por lo que ella solicita un nuevo crédito,  ella sabe que con una buena atención y disposición a sus clientes ella puede salir avante diariamente, también ha incluido nuevos productos en su negocio, como la venta de carteras, bolsos, cinchos, artículos para dama, y diversidad de calzado.solicita este credito para la compra de zapatos,bolsas para dama,cinchos etc.
Su anhelo es seguir aumentado su capital invertido, seguir vendiendo y seguirse manteniendo en el mercado a pesar de las mucha competencia que la rodea, ya que es para ella un patrimonio para sus hijos, como también una actividad productiva que pueda servirles en un futuro, lo que también la hace sentirse una mujer productiva y no dependiente de los demás lo cual la hace sentirse orgullosa
texts.en:
For Nanci Paola F. M., the past few days of life have brought her new opportunities to improve her business. She currently has a new sales outlet that is very busy. It is located at the market along the main highway. Now her priority is to fill each space of her new shop and take advantage of what she has. However, she needs to invest in more capital, which is why she is requesting this new loan. Nanci knows that good service and attention to her customers will help her get ahead each day. She also wants to introduce new products to her business such as wallets, handbags, belts, women’s accessories, and a variety of footwear. Nanci is requesting this loan in order to buy shoes, women’s purses, belts, and other items.

Her wish is to continue increasing her investment capital so that she can maintain her shop despite the amount of local competition. This business serves as an inheritance for her children as well as a productive activity that can give them a future. Nanci believes she is a productive woman who does not have to depend on others, an accomplishment of which she is proud.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, women’s purses, belts, and other items.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Aminata from Kissy in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 15 and 20. All of Aminata’s children attend school. They also take care of seven relatives.

Aminata runs a local produce (food stuff) store. She sells groundnut, rice, and palm oil. She has been running this business for 10 years. Aminata has requested a loan in order to purchase more local product. The extra income from this loan will allow her to rent a big store. In the future, she plans to be a supplier to other business partners.

loans.use: to purchase groundnut, beans and palm oil.

loans.name: Zaitun

texts.en:
Zaitun is a married woman and has two children, a boy and a girl. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent.

For the past 2 years, Zaitun has been operating a Kanga selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major challenge in the  high cost of transportation and in competition from other clothes selling businesses. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 40,000,  Zaitun wants to purchase bundles of Kanga for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy bundles of Kanga for resale

loans.name: Barnokhon

texts.en:
Barnokhon is 38 years old. She is married and has three children. Barnokhon is engaged in an animal husbandry and has been running this business for 8 years.  She also grows apricots. Currently, her husband is working in Russia and sends his family 200-300 USD every month. Barnokhon would like to get a loan of 5,400 TJS to expand her land for apricot farming.  She has received 2 cycles of loans from Imon International and has a good credit history.
    
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: buy an apricot garden

loans.name: Darwin Oswaldo

texts.es:
Darwin Oswaldo tiene 26 años, es soltero vive con los padres. No tienen hijos.  Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Darwin se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol por mas de 8 años, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos para los cultivos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como el pago del arriendo del terreno. Su sueño es tener terrenos propios para dejar de pagar el arriendo.

Le gusta jugar futbool.
texts.en:
Darwin Oswaldo is 26 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He does not have children. Darwin resides in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

This Communal Bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and located in the neighborhood of Recinto Cachely Grande, which is in the canton of Ventanas. The members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Darwin is a farmer who has been growing corn, rice, and beans for more than eight years. He buys his supplies at the Olivos Brothers Shopping Center each month and then sells his goods at the fair in the same location.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost for his crops. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, he will be able to acquire needed supplies. His challenges include making the rental payments on his land. Darwin dreams of having his own land so that he can stop paying rent.

He enjoys playing soccer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and compost.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old . She is widowed with five adult children. Elizabeth has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods, shampoos and soap. She has had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 to purchase additional goods for the store.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snacks, shampoos, detergents and more for the store.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en: Kawthar is a 40-year-old single lady. Ten years ago, she was able to start her own small home-based business. Her business is basically selling home products such as kitchen tools and home decoration pieces. Now Kawthar has applied for a loan to add new products to increase variety so she can open a home supplies store in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more types of home products for resale.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
(Quillabamba es la ciudad capital de Provincia de La Convención e importante centro de comercio de las valles de Lares y La Convención, las actividades principales son la producción de coca, café, cacao y frutales).
En la ciudad de Quillabamba visitamos al banco comunal “Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan” y conocimos a la socia Susana y nos cuenta: 

 “Nací en la ciudad de Quillabamba, tengo 62 años edad, soy casada, tengo tres hijos y vivo en la misma ciudad donde nací y mi actividad principal es la agricultura”.

Susana es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que a pesar de las adversidades saca adelante a sus hijos. Ella tiene terrenos de cultivos de frutas como mangos, naranjas, limones y también café y cacao. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes y pollos.
texts.en:
(Quillabamba is the capital of La Convencion province and an important commercial center for the Lares and La Convencion valleys.  The local people make a living growing coca, coffee, cacao and fruit.)
We visited the Los Corazones Valientes de Morro San Juan community bank in Quillabamba and met Susana, a member of the bank:

"I was born in Quillabamba, I'm 62 years old, I'm married, I have three children, I live in the city where I was born and I operate an animal-sales business".

Susana is a determined and enterprising woman who has managed to support her children despite all the obstacles she's faced.  She owns land where she grows fruit such as mangos, oranges, lemons and even coffee and cacao.  She will use this loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs for her aniimal-sales business.

loans.name: Benkadi 5 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 5 est un regroupement de dix  membres  qui des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et  en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, FATOUMATA la personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 5 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have six children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali).
