They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Fatoumata, standing in the middle of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 25,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 51 years old and married with 7 children.

Miguela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Miguela has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Miguela aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Edwelyn

texts.en:
Edwelyn is 48 years old and married. She has three children. The oldest child is 19 years old.

Edwelyn and her husband are both farmers. She helps in tilling their land and planting rice crops. Edwelyn does her best to support her family. She makes rice cakes and other delicacies and sells them to the people in her community.

Edwelyn has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She said she wants to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea (in the photo) is 37 years old and her husband, Sarran, is 43 years old. They live about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2003 and have three sons and one daughter. Two are in school and other two are still young.  

Sophea and her husband are banana and flower farmers. She is asking for a loan of $600 to repair the house where she lives and to assist in her farming. She will be buying fertilizer and small flowers.

loans.use: to repair the house where she lives and to assist in her banana and flower farm by buying fertilizers and small flowers.

loans.name: 03.08.88 Thiệu Toán Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Thanh is 27 years old and married with no children.

Thanh is the group leader of the 88 Thiệu Toán solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

She lives and works in Thiệu Hóa, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2008, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thanh has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 48 years old and lives in Casul, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with no children. 

Cornelia has a general store that sells assorted items. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase assorted stocks worth 25,000 PHP and 30 cases of coke. 

Cornelia has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To purchase inventory, including 30 cases of coke

loans.name: Margo

texts.es:
Margo, nuevamente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, en esta ocacion comprara huevos para vender, ropa como blusas pasa damas, faldas, vestidos, ya que es demanda por sus clientes, esta compra le ayudara a crecer en el negocio y tener la mercadería necesaria para atender a la clientela.
Su inversion anterior le ayudo ha librarse de un negocio bajo, porque con este fondo logro la compra oportuna de ropa y pollos, permitiendole mejorar su condicion y pagar oportunamente las cuotas.
texts.en:
Margo is once again requesting a loan to buy merchandise.  On this occasion she’ll buy eggs to sell and clothes like women’s blouses, skirts and dresses which her customers are asking for.  This purchase will help her business grow and to have the necessary merchandise on hand to meet customer demand.

Her previous loan helped her overcome a low period because she was able to use the funds to buy clothes and chickens in an opportune way allowing her to improve her condition and to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy eggs and clothes.

loans.name: Erkhembaatar

texts.en:
Erkhembaatar is 33 years old, has a son and daughter ages 4 to 10, lives in outer ger district, a district without basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His daughter and son attend kindergarten and secondary school while their mother works as a Chemistry teacher at her son’s school. 

Erkhembaatar has worked as a musical technician at local stadium in 1999-2006. After that, he started to operate own musical instrument renting business. Now he has 15 million MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ priced musical instruments and tools. His business advantage is in Mongolia, there are few entrepreneurs who operates this kind of business. Therefore Erkhembaatar’s business is very popular and he often participates in concert and rents his instruments. 

As his business growing, he became owns a lot of instruments, so he doesn’t have any depository for instruments to keep these. So he decided to built own new depository for instruments and tools. He is requesting a 3.000.000 MNT loan to purchase necessary construction materials for his new depository for instruments. If he finish it, he will operate business successfully.

loans.use: to purchase necessary construction materials for his new depository for instruments

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es: Josefa mujer humilde, trabaja como docente en un colegio público, casada, junto a su esposo tiene el proyecto de mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Para ofrecerle a su familia seguridad. Con el préstamo comprar materiales de construcción como. Cemento, arena, piedrines, estribus, alambre de amarre, hierro, bloques, tablones de madera, clavos entre otros materiales para la construcción de una pared del lado derecho delantero de la vivienda, siendo de necesidad ya que actualmente es alambre y laminas de zinc viejos. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al mejoramiento del nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Josefa is a humble woman who works as a public school teacher. She is married. Along with her husband, she has the goal of improving their household infrastructure, thus offering safety to their family. 

Josefa is asking for a loan to purchase construction materials such as concrete, sand, gravel, supports, tie wire, iron, cinder blocks, wood planks and nails (among others), needed for building a wall on the front-right side of their house. It is a necessity, considering that this space is currently covered with old sheet metal and wires. She is thankful to the microfinance institution for the support she has received in order to improve the quality of her life.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
La señora Anastacia es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y tiene 09  hijos independientes.  Nos cuenta que nunca pudo estudiar.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace once años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles dinero que utilizó en su negocio de venta de golosinas, gelatinas, gaseosas, etc.

Solicitará un nuevo crédito  de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizará para comprar galletas, gaseosa, chocolates, golosinas.  Su  mercadería  la compra en las  tiendas mayoristas.

Su sueño para el futuro es seguir trabajando en el negocio.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Anastacia is a member of the communal bank “Candelaria” in the district and province of Yungoyo, in the Puno department. She is 63 years old, married, and has 9 grown children. She tells us that she’s never been able to go to school.

She’s been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 11 years. Her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles was for her business selling candy, jellies, soft drinks, etc. She has asked for a new loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, and she will use the money to buy cookies, soda, chocolates, and candy. She buys her merchandise at wholesale stores. 

Her dream for the future is to continue running her business. 

What she likes the most about her communal bank is the ease of getting a loan.

loans.use: to buy cookies, soda, chocolates, and candy

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 56-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer.

Rosa sells coconut wine for a living. She gathers the coconuts from her farm. Rosa requested this loan to purchase containers and wine ingredients. 

Rosa hopes for her business to prosper. She also hopes for her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase containers and wine ingredients.

loans.name: Fetna

texts.en:
Fetna used to be an employee in the Ministry of Health till she recently retired and started making pickles at home for sale. This has been going on for four years now. Year by year, Fetna make more types of pickles based, of course, on the season. Spicy olive pickles and cucumber pickles are the most ordered.

For now, Fetna wants to increase the quantity of pickles she makes and sells to the food markets, until she can open her own pickles store. In order to do that, Fetna decided to apply for a loan to buy more vegetables and containers to start providing the market with her product.

Fetna, a 51-year-old lady, is married and has two sons and a daughter.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and containers to start providing the market with her product.

loans.name: Adriana Maria

texts.es: La señora Adriana Maria a sus 48 años de edad laboró en un restaurante de una amiga por varios años hasta que su jefe le brindo la oportunidad de trabajar como independiente y es así como desde hace cuatro años inicio con su propio negocio de venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo. Actualmente y luego de mucho esfuerzo, la señora Adriana es líder de ventas y tiene a su cargo 120 mujeres cabeza de hogar que trabajan como vendedoras. Con el ánimo de seguir brindando una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo de 13 años, la señora Adriana necesita de la compra de productos cosméticos que le faciliten ofrecer a sus clientes crédito y así poder ahorrar para poder cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén y brindarle una buena educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Adriana Maria is 48 years old. She worked in a friend's restaurant for several years until her boss gave her the opportunity to work independently. So, for years ago, Adriana started her own business selling cosmetic products through catalogs.

After a lot of hard work, Adriana is currently the leader of sales,and she has 120 women homemakers who work for her as salespeople. With the goal of continuing to offer a better quality of life to her 13-year-old son, Adriana is applying for this loan to buy cosmetic products to offer to her clients. This loan will help her save, and eventually, to reach her goals of having her own store and of providing her son with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase assorted cosmetics.

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is 48 years old and a mother with four sons and two daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who earns a decent salary. He also he works in agriculture to increase the family income.  Khitam, who is photographed here, has a daughter who is studying methods of technology at the university. 

Khitam is requesting a loan from FATEN to pay the university fees for her daughter since her husband's salary isn't enough to cover the family's expenses. Her loan will enable her daughter to complete her studies and get the first university degree in the family. Khitam hopes this will result in a good job offer in the future which will improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her daughter

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es:
el grupo Mujeres en Marcha esta integrado por 3 mujeres, que tienen muchos deseos de salir adelante, Doña Rosa es la cordinadora del grupo, ella tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 2 hijos, Rosa se dedica a la preparacion de alimentos, su actividad principal es la elaboración de nacatamales y Hamburguesas; negocio que opera en su casa de habitación, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para empezar la produccion y luego salir a vender los nacatamales y las hamburguesas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la preparacion de sus comidas. muchos clientes la prefieren ya que sus alimentos son higienicos y de muy buen sabor. 
estas tres mujeres se conocen muy bien y son muy responsables, conforman el grupo con la Sra. Blanca Lidia de 54 años de edad y con la Sra. Maryuri Maribel de 28 años de edad.
las ganancias las necesitan para salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The Mujeres en Marcha group has three members who are very motivated to succeed in their business goals. Rosa is the group's coordinator; she is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She owns a food preparation business, specializing in nacatamales (a steamed meat and vegetable pasty, cooked in banana or maize leaves) and hamburgers. Part of this loan will be used to buy ingredients for her food products. Rosa has many customers because she is very careful about the cleanliness of her ingredients and preparation, and because her food is delicious.

All three women know each other very well and are very responsible. The other members are named Blanca Lidia, age 54, and Maryuri Maribel, age 28. The income these women earn from their businesses are used to improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: To buy bread, ground pork, lettuce, tomatoes, ketchup, mayonnaise, mustard, oil, corn flour, poultry, pork, vegetables, olives, raisins, rice, and condiments.

loans.name: Kotognontala Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA II sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont en moyenne 29 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et qui vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fofanabougou, un des villages de la  préfecture de Dioïla.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MINATA FAMORY, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
La production sera vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 85.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the group KOTOGNONTALA II are married women who average 29 years of age and seven children each. They live mostly in polygamous families in Fofanabougou, a village in the prefecture of Dioïla. This is their 7th collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. They grow millet and groundnuts.

Minata Famory, standing second from the left, will use this new loan to purchase inputs and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing 0.5 hectare of groundnuts. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the city of Fana to a clientele composed of men and women.

Minata Famory expects to earn an average profit of 85,000 CFAF per season. This will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, small farming tools, and plowing.

loans.name: Duhurizehamwe Group

texts.en: Duhurizehamwe is a group led by Godeleva who is 44 years old. The group name means “All together” in English. She has been a group leader for six years. She sells food stuffs and has been selling in a business for 12 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea of changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, bananas, cassava and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: to buy more beans, bananas, cassava and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as hardworking. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a better life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is a 21-year-old university student. He is a second-year student studying geology. He lives in Salheye with his family ‎that consists of six members including his parents, and his father is retired.  
Faisal is hard working and always spends his free time looking for a good job. He would like to request a loan because he ‎does not have enough finances to pay his university fees. This loan will help him to cover his university fees and graduate ‎successfully. After graduation, Faisal hopes to have a proper job and then he will be able to save enough money to help ‎his big family.‎

loans.use: To pay his university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy 2 sacks of rice, laundry detergents, and soft drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa D/O S. H. is married and lives in District 5 of Kabul City. Sharifa is an uneducated women, and she helps her family by running a carpet weaving business with the help of her children. When she first started her business, she didn't have the right materials to make enough carpets. Her work progressed slowly, and she could only make one or two carpets a year. She decided to participate in the loan program, which enabled her to buy the materials she needed to produce more carpets. Now she has completed her first loan cycle, and requests a second loan for $175 so she can make 4-6 carpets a year and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase materials to increase her carpet production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of her charcoal business
